('78', 0, 2, 3, 68) LIKANDA February 23, 1940
('78', 0, 3, 4, 94) MY DEAR IDIOT, Though we have hostile slogans 1, on the whole, things have gone smooth.One never knows when they may grow worse.
('78', 0, 3, 5, 223) The atmosphere is undoubtedly bad.
('78', 0, 3, 6, 258) The weather is superb.
('78', 0, 3, 7, 281) I am keeping excellent and have regular hours.
('78', 0, 3, 8, 328) The b.p.
('78', 0, 3, 9, 337) is under control.
('78', 0, 3, 10, 355) Radical changeshave been made in the workingand composition of the Sangh.
('78', 0, 3, 11, 429) 2 This you will have already seen.
('78', 0, 3, 12, 464) We are leaving here on Sunday and leaving Calcutta on Tuesday for Patna 3. No more today.
('78', 0, 3, 13, 554) Mountain of work awaiting me.
('78', 0, 3, 14, 584) Your reports about the family there are encouraging.
('78', 0, 3, 15, 637) Poonam Chand Ranka 4 told me he was going to correspond directly with Balkrishna about Chindwara.
('78', 0, 3, 16, 735) Evidently he has done nothing.
('78', 0, 3, 17, 766) This is unfortunate.
('78', 0, 3, 18, 787) Love to all.

('78', 2, 0, 1, 2488) 5. TALK WITH WORKERS 1
('78', 2, 1, 2, 2511) MALIKANDA, [February 24, 1940] 2
('78', 2, 2, 3, 2544) All incompatible mixtures are bound to explode.
('78', 2, 2, 4, 2592) 3 You must resolve to act on the square, and whilst you should be prepared to compromise on non essentials you should never be in the uncomfortable position of having to compromise truth.
('78', 2, 2, 5, 2780) You should retire from all such positions.
('78', 2, 2, 6, 2823) That is the essence of compromise.
('78', 2, 2, 7, 2858) Let service without near or distant objective be your motto.
('78', 2, 2, 8, 2919) You are surrounded by poverty on all sides.
('78', 2, 2, 9, 2963) Serve those that are afflicted, whether they are Muslims, Namasudras 4 or others.
('78', 2, 2, 10, 3045) Satyagraha transcends parties and divisions of class and creed.
('78', 2, 2, 11, 3109) It should permeate the whole of our being and society.
('78', 2, 2, 12, 3164) There is no question before you of enlisting members for the Congress.
('78', 2, 2, 13, 3235) Give up all thought of gaining members for the sake of swelling your register.
('78', 2, 2, 14, 3314) That is power politics.
('78', 2, 2, 15, 3338) I would rather have no register than blacken it with bogus members.
('78', 2, 2, 16, 3406) If you will thus become silent workers, even one of you will lead the Congress in the province without being in it.
('78', 2, 2, 17, 3522) I hope you will not now say, What will happen if the Congress is captured by the opponents ? You know the Upanishad precept
('78', 2, 3, 18, 3646) 5 Enjoy by means of renunciation.
('78', 2, 3, 19, 3680) Give up the Congress in order to enjoy or have it.
('78', 2, 3, 20, 3731) The moment I set my heart on some kind of capturing I am done for.
('78', 2, 3, 21, 3798) No manoeuvring to keep your hold on the Congress, no descending from the right path, and you will disarm all opposition.
('78', 2, 3, 22, 3919) A bogus Congress register can never lead you to swaraj any more than a paper boat can help you to sail across the Padma.
('78', 2, 4, 23, 4040) Harijan, 9 3 1940
('78', 2, 5, 24, 4058) 1 Reproduced from Mahadev Desais article Gandhi Seva SanghII.

('78', 3, 1, 2, 4482) 6. ADDRESS AT BENGAL WORKERS CONFERENCE 1
('78', 3, 2, 3, 4524) MALIKANDA, February 24, 1940
('78', 3, 3, 4, 4553) Gandhiji said that his time was limited and he wanted to say some things to them.
('78', 3, 3, 5, 4635) The first question that struck him was : What was the meaning of the new manifestation which they were witnessing ?
('78', 3, 3, 6, 4751) Why did some people cry Down with Gandhism ?
('78', 3, 3, 7, 4796) (Gandhibad Dhansa Hauk).
('78', 3, 4, 8, 4821) Let us understand that there is a kind of poison in the atmosphere.
('78', 3, 4, 9, 4889) How are we to fight it ?
('78', 3, 4, 10, 4914) Whether the number of those who shout these slogans is 50 to 500, we may not ignore them.
('78', 3, 4, 11, 5004) We must try to discover their grievance.We may not treat them with contempt, if we are believers in ahimsa.
('78', 3, 4, 12, 5112) No argumentum ad hominem will do.
('78', 3, 4, 13, 5146) It is no answer to say that they are mercenaries, for you may be sure that not any and everyone who is offered a train fare and a wage would consent to come here.
('78', 3, 4, 14, 5309) They must to an extent believe in their mission.
('78', 3, 5, 15, 5358) They should remember that these people must bear some ill feeling against certain things.
('78', 3, 5, 16, 5448) That was why they came.
('78', 3, 5, 17, 5472) One thing they could understand was that these people wanted to destroy something which they wanted to create.
('78', 3, 5, 18, 5583) And at the back of their mind is the feeling that Gandhism is out to destroy what they hold dear.
('78', 3, 5, 19, 5681) If that is the case, they may well desire the destruction of Gandhism.
('78', 3, 5, 20, 5752) When we see the thing in this light we can afford to keep our temper.
('78', 3, 5, 21, 5822) We will then try to meet and plead with them and assure them that we do notdesire to obstruct their work.
('78', 3, 5, 22, 5928) 4 I do not say that you will immediately win them over, but you will certainly check the spread of the poison.
('78', 3, 5, 23, 6039) Retaliation is counter poison, and poison breeds more poison.
('78', 3, 5, 24, 6101) The nectar of love alone can destroy the poison of hate.
('78', 3, 6, 25, 6158) These people were raising cries many times a day but afterwards they became silent of their own accord.
('78', 3, 6, 26, 6262) It might be if they bore with it in silence their virulence might increase but they must be prepared for eventualities.
('78', 3, 6, 27, 6382) They would bear in silence not on account of weakness but through patience out of which strength would grow.
('78', 3, 7, 28, 6491) 1 A conference of about 200 constructive workers of Bengal and volunteers of Malikanda was held in the morning.
('78', 3, 7, 29, 6603) 2 This paragraph is from Amrita Bazar Patrika.
('78', 3, 7, 30, 6650) 3 The following paragraph is from Amrita Bazar Patrika.
('78', 3, 7, 31, 6706) 4 Amrit Bazar Patrika here has : If they did not offer resistance it might be that they would go away after shouting to their hearts content and the poison would not spread. 5 The following paragraph is from Amrita Bazar Patrika.
('78', 4, 0, 1, 6936) VOL. 78 : 23 FEBRUARY, 1940 15 JULY, 1940 5
('78', 4, 1, 2, 6980) Therefore let not the cries anger you.
('78', 4, 1, 3, 7019) Let none of you think of drowning those cries in the cry of Mahatma Gandhiki Jai.You have done well in not shouting counte slogans.
('78', 4, 1, 4, 7151) You have thereby sterilized theirs, and very little mischief has been done.
('78', 4, 1, 5, 7227) If the forbearance is based on ahimsa, I am sure they will ultimately be still.
('78', 4, 2, 6, 7307) Gandhiji advised workers to devote themselves to constructive work and not to try to keep the Congress organization under their control by any means.
('78', 4, 2, 7, 7457) They must be prepared to leave the Congress if they were hampered in carrying out the constructive work.
('78', 4, 2, 8, 7562) The service of the Congress did not lie in four anna membership.
('78', 4, 2, 9, 7627) There were crores of people who were outside the Congress but they loved and respected the Congress and they served the Congress better than those who were in control of the Congress to secure power and position.
('78', 4, 2, 10, 7840) Gandhiji said he would say that those who had silently taken to the charkha were serving the country better than those who were inside the Congress but did not constructive work.
('78', 4, 2, 11, 8019) Therefore I have told you that he who takes up the charkha with a knowledge of its implications serves the Congress cause better than Congressmen.
('78', 4, 3, 12, 8166) He was glad to know that the constructive workers of Bengal had resolved to spin no less than 60,000 yards annually.
('78', 4, 3, 13, 8283) If they regularly spun for half an hour daily it would not be difficult to spin one lakh yards annually.
('78', 4, 3, 14, 8388) It was no big thing but out of consideration of self interest they should do it.
('78', 4, 3, 15, 8469) The cost of weaving was not much.
('78', 4, 3, 16, 8503) If they spun they would serve the country.
('78', 4, 3, 17, 8546) It was better that they took a vow that would give them strength and determination to perform work regularly.
('78', 4, 3, 18, 8656) If, however, there is the slightest hesitance on your part, I would ask you not to take the pledge but try to do your quota without taking it.
('78', 4, 4, 19, 8799) Though spinning might seem monotonous Gandhiji said that he called charkha Daridranarayana Annapurna.
('78', 4, 4, 20, 8901) If 500 or 1000 people took the vow of doing constructive work, that would provide money for poor weavers.
('78', 4, 4, 21, 9007) That was why he called the charkha Annapurna.
('78', 4, 4, 22, 9053) There is, however a flaw in self spinning to which I should like to draw your attention.
('78', 4, 4, 23, 9142) You will of course spin to make your own cloth, but you will to that extent deprive the poor spinners.
('78', 4, 4, 24, 9245) 4 The wheel is meant for them.
('78', 4, 4, 25, 9276) But though there is this flaw in it I am asking
('78', 4, 5, 26, 9324) 1 The following paragraph is from Amrita Bazar Patrika.
('78', 4, 5, 27, 9380) 2 ibid 3 ibid
('78', 4, 6, 28, 9394) 4 Amrita Bazar Patrika here reports : He conceded there was some truth the argument that to the extent they used khadi they deprived the mill workers of their bread.
('78', 5, 0, 1, 9560) 6 THE COLLECTED WORKS OF MAHATMA GANDHI
('78', 5, 1, 2, 9600) you all to spin in order to universalize spinning.
('78', 5, 2, 3, 9651) If they used khadi not only for wearing but also for other household purposes that would consume more khadi and give more bread to the poor people.
('78', 5, 2, 4, 9799) Those of you who are too poor to purchase khadi will of course card and spin for yourselves.
('78', 5, 2, 5, 9892) But such of you as can afford to buy your khadi will send the 60,000 yards to the Spinners Association, which will thus be able to reduce the price of khadi in its stock by adding to it the gift of your yarn 2. That will enable poor people, who can neither spin for themselves nor purchase khadi today, to buy the khadi thus made cheaper for them.
('78', 5, 3, 6, 10240) In other countries crores of people were conscripted for military service.
('78', 5, 3, 7, 10315) One hours spinning for service to the nation by all was conscription which he wanted his countrymen to impose on themselves.
('78', 5, 3, 8, 10440) This is what I call voluntary labour tax.
('78', 5, 3, 9, 10482) In Europe there is compulsory military service.
('78', 5, 3, 10, 10530) Let us have compulsory non military service here.
('78', 5, 4, 11, 10580) Their method was non violence and they would not resort to violent methods but he merely asked everybody to give one hours work for national service.
('78', 5, 4, 12, 10730) This would provide bread for the poor and destitute.
('78', 5, 4, 13, 10783) All that you do, you will do intelligently, of your free will, and out of a spirit of service.
('78', 5, 5, 14, 10878) Concluding, Gandhiji said the civil disobedience movement would not be possible unless they prepared themselves in this way.
('78', 5, 5, 15, 11003) So far as he could see he would not be able to launch civil disobedience unless by constructive work they had succeeded in eschewing violence completely.
('78', 5, 5, 16, 11157) Along with khadi are the other cottage industries, Harijan service, and other items of constructive work, which, if solidly done will create the strength that political work, so called, cannot.
('78', 5, 5, 17, 11351) That may preclude the necessity for civil disobedience and will automatically end the Hindu Muslim tension, abolish untouch ability, abolish the squabbles between the leftists and the rightists and break the chains of slavery.
('78', 5, 5, 18, 11578) This to my mind is rashtradharma 6 par excellence.
('78', 5, 6, 19, 11629) Harijan, 9 3 1940, and Amrita Bazar Patrika, 25 2 1940

('78', 6, 1, 2, 11834) 7. ADDRESS TO BENGAL WOMEN WORKERS
('78', 6, 2, 3, 11869) MALIKANDA,
('78', 6, 3, 4, 11880) February 24, 1940
('78', 6, 4, 5, 11898) Politics means not merely to sit on the Congress Executive.
('78', 6, 4, 6, 11958) Real politics is in spinning.
('78', 6, 5, 7, 11988) He drew their attention to the vow taken by the male workers to spin 60,000 yards yarn a year and said that women should spin more than that.
('78', 6, 5, 8, 12130) Menfolk have taken to spinning, but let me confess that the art comes more naturally to you than to them.
('78', 6, 5, 9, 12236) One of the reasons is that men have many other avenues of employment.
('78', 6, 5, 10, 12306) And if swaraj has to come through the charkha, your share in the fight for freedom is going to be greater.
('78', 6, 5, 11, 12413) Again if swaraj has to come through non violence, then too your place in the fight will be in the forefront, for Nature has given you a greater capacity for suffering than she has to men.
('78', 6, 5, 12, 12601) In order also to wipe out the reproach of inferiority and subjection that man has imposed on woman, you will take your privileged part in the fight and prove to the world that you are better fighters for freedom than men.
('78', 6, 6, 13, 12823) Mahatma Gandhi congratulated them on the management of the kitchen during the Seva Sangh Conference and urged them to engage all their spare time in spinning which he said would bring swaraj to India.
('78', 6, 6, 14, 13024) Harijan, 9 3 1940, and The Bombay Chronicle, 26 2 1940

('78', 6, 8, 16, 13131) RAMNARAYAN, Your time is fully occupied.
('78', 6, 8, 17, 13172) Do not take up any more work.
('78', 6, 8, 18, 13202) Your main job is to attain proficiency in khadi work.
('78', 6, 8, 19, 13256) It is not at all difficult to do the carding according to the Andhra method.
('78', 6, 8, 20, 13333) Consult Krishnadas.

('78', 7, 0, 1, 13521) 8 THE COLLECTED WORKS OF MAHATMA GANDHI
('78', 7, 1, 2, 13561) 9. SPEECH AT PUBLIC MEETING 1
('78', 7, 2, 3, 13591) MALIKANDA,
('78', 7, 3, 4, 13602) February 25, 1940
('78', 7, 4, 5, 13620) Mahatma Gandhi at the outset expressed gratification that he was able, after many years, to meet so many people here.
('78', 7, 4, 6, 13738) Gandhiji said : I have been presented a purse of Rs. 18,000. 2 This money will be spent in Bengal for the service of the poor.
('78', 7, 4, 7, 13865) I have nothing to tell you new.
('78', 7, 4, 8, 13897) Four resolutions were passed at the Nagpur Congress 3. I regard them as four pillars of the countrys indepe ndence.Those included Hindu Muslim unity, untouchab ility, prohibition and charkha.
('78', 7, 4, 9, 14089) If we can give effect to those four resolutions, swaraj will be won automatically.
('78', 7, 4, 10, 14172) I have the same if not more regard for those programmes today.
('78', 7, 4, 11, 14235) 4 In that programme millions of the masses could take part.
('78', 7, 4, 12, 14295) I hope the vast gathering here, which consists of Harijans and Muslims as well, will fulfil those programmes.
('78', 7, 4, 13, 14405) The programme of charkha can be taken up by everyone, including the old and the young.
('78', 7, 4, 14, 14492) It is a matter of regret that the charkha has not yet been taken up by all.
('78', 7, 4, 15, 14568) It pains me that most of you who have come here are not clad in khaddar.
('78', 7, 4, 16, 14641) If you spin your yarn, you will not have to complain to me of the dearness of khadi.
('78', 7, 4, 17, 14726) If you spin for half an hour daily you can meet your own requirements of cloth.
('78', 7, 4, 18, 14806) If you are not prepared to devote one hour a day to spinning, how can we claim to attain swaraj ?
('78', 7, 4, 19, 14904) People of other countries make huge sacrifices in retaining their independence.
('78', 7, 4, 20, 14984) If we pin our faith on ahimsa we will not have to spend croresof rupees nor sacrifice millions of people for our independence.
('78', 7, 4, 21, 15111) Till my death,I will talk of no other means of achieving independence.
('78', 7, 4, 22, 15182) I would repeat the programme that I have laid before the country.
('78', 7, 4, 23, 15248) Women can take more effective part than men in achieving independence through ahimsa.
('78', 7, 4, 24, 15334) Women as much as men must work side by side for the countrys independence.
('78', 7, 4, 25, 15409) Whether in charkha or removal of untouchability, they must not lag behind men.
('78', 7, 4, 26, 15488) From times immemorial, in India it had been the duty of women to spin.
('78', 7, 4, 27, 15559) Even today women spin more than men.
('78', 7, 4, 28, 15596) If charkha be the sole weapon for winning swaraj then women can certainly contribute more than men
('78', 7, 5, 29, 15695) 1 Gandhiji addressed a gathering of 50,000 before his departure for Calcutta in the afternoon.
('78', 7, 5, 30, 15790) 2 This was the balance from the money collected for the session of Gandhi Seva Sangh 3 In December, 1920 4 The following sentence is from Amrita Bazar Patrika.

('78', 8, 1, 2, 15994) towards the countrys independence 1. My prayer to God is that women of India may be inspired with the ideal of the charkha and induce their relations to take to the charkha.

('78', 8, 3, 4, 16237) 10. QUESTION BOX CONSTRUCTIVE ORGANIZATIONS
('78', 8, 4, 5, 16281) Q. Since you have excluded politics from the Gandhi Seva Sangh, 2 what do you say of the Harijan Sevak Sangh ?
('78', 8, 4, 6, 16392) Should they fly the national flag on their various institutions ?
('78', 8, 5, 7, 16458) A. I have no hesitation in sayin that all theconstructive organizations should eschew politics as we at present know it.
('78', 8, 5, 8, 16579) It may sound strange but it is true that the more these organizations devote themselves exclusively to their own particular missions, the morethey will flourishandthe more they will serve the national cause.It should be enough that these organization are mostly manned by Congressmen or Congress minded men.
('78', 8, 5, 9, 16887) But they are and should be untouched by party politics.
('78', 8, 5, 10, 16943) They would and ought to welcome the co operation of all parties.
('78', 8, 5, 11, 17008) They provide a non political meeting ground for persons representing diverse schools of political opinion.
('78', 8, 5, 12, 17115) When party politics separate us from one another even in non controversial matters, it is a sure sign that something is wrong in the State of Denmark.
('78', 8, 5, 13, 17266) It is a sure sign of intolerance.
('78', 8, 5, 14, 17300) It follows from what I have said that these constructive institutions ought not to fly the national flag, especially so when it has become a cause of quarrel between Muslims and Hindus.
('78', 8, 6, 15, 17486) CALCUTTA, February 26, 1940 Harijan, 2 3 1940
('78', 8, 7, 16, 17532) 11. WHAT I SAW IN SANTINIKETAN
('78', 8, 8, 17, 17563) The visit to Santiniketan was a pilgrimage for me.
('78', 8, 8, 18, 17614) I had long intended to go there, but the opportunity offered itself only on my way to malikanda.
('78', 8, 8, 19, 17711) Santiniketan is not new to me.
('78', 8, 8, 20, 17742) I was first there in

('78', 9, 1, 2, 17940) 1915 when it was yet taking shape, not that it is not doing so even now.
('78', 9, 1, 3, 18013) Gurudev is himself growing.
('78', 9, 1, 4, 18041) Old age has made no difference to the elasticity of his mind.
('78', 9, 1, 5, 18103) Santiniketan will therefore never cease to grow so long as Gurudevs spirit broods over it.
('78', 9, 1, 6, 18194) He is in everyone and everything in Santiniketan.
('78', 9, 1, 7, 18244) The veneration in which he is held by everyone is uplifting because it is spontaneous.
('78', 9, 1, 8, 18331) It certainly uplifted me.
('78', 9, 1, 9, 18357) The title the grateful students and staff gave him accurately describes the position he commands in Santiniketan.
('78', 9, 1, 10, 18471) He does so because he has lost himself to the place and the congregation.
('78', 9, 1, 11, 18545) I saw that he was living for his dearest creation : Visvabharati.
('78', 9, 1, 12, 18611) He wants it to prosper and to feel sure of its future.
('78', 9, 1, 13, 18666) He had a long talk about it with me but that was not enough for him, and so as we parted he put into my hands the following precious letter :
('78', 9, 2, 14, 18808) DEAR MAHATMAJI,
('78', 9, 3, 15, 18824) You have just had a birds eye view this morning of our Visvabharati
('78', 9, 4, 16, 18892) centre of activities.
('78', 9, 4, 17, 18914) I do not know what estimate you have formed of its merit.
('78', 9, 5, 18, 18972) You know that though this institution is national in its immediate aspect it is
('78', 9, 6, 19, 19052) international in its spirit, offering according to the best of its means Indias

('78', 10, 2, 6, 20465) 12. MY ADVICE TO NOAKHALI HINDUS Manoranjan Babu and other friends from Noakhali came to see me during my stay in Malikanda about the difficulties of the Hindus in their locality.
('78', 10, 2, 7, 20645) Manoranjan Babu has been in correspondence with me in the matter for some time.
('78', 10, 2, 8, 20725) I have not examined the grievances.
('78', 10, 2, 9, 20761) I had neither the time nor the wish to do so.
('78', 10, 2, 10, 20807) That is the special province of the Provincial Congress Committee and finally the central body.
('78', 10, 2, 11, 20903) But I had no difficulty in giving general advice.
('78', 10, 2, 12, 20953) Their case is more or less like the Sukkur case.
('78', 10, 2, 13, 21002) 2 There is a great difference in degree.
('78', 10, 2, 14, 21043) But I feel sure that no popularly elected Government can successfully cope with widespread goondaism as it is alleged to be in Noakhali.
('78', 10, 2, 15, 21180) It is essentially a case of self defence.
('78', 10, 2, 16, 21222) Self respect and honour cannot be protected by others.
('78', 10, 2, 17, 21277) They are for each individual himself or herself to guard.
('78', 10, 2, 18, 21335) Governments can at best punish offenders after the offence has been committed.
('78', 10, 2, 19, 21414) They cannot assure prevention except in so far as punishment acts as a deterrent.
('78', 10, 2, 20, 21496) Self defence can be violent or non violent.
('78', 10, 2, 21, 21540) I have always advised and insisted on non violent defence.
('78', 10, 2, 22, 21599) But I recognize that it has to be learnt like violent defence.
('78', 10, 2, 23, 21662) It requires a different training from that which is required for violent defence.
('78', 10, 2, 24, 21744) Therefore, if the capacity for non violent self defence is lacking, there need be no hesitation in using violent means.But Manoranjan Babu being an old Congressman said, You say I cannot retaliate even in self defence ? That is certainly my view,I replied.There was, however, a resolution passed by the Gaya Congress 3 that the use of force in self defence was permissible to Congressmen.
('78', 10, 2, 25, 22133) I have never justified the resolution.
('78', 10, 2, 26, 22172) Non violence becomes meaningless if violence is permitted for self defence.
('78', 10, 2, 27, 22248) What is it but self defence in national resistance against an aggressor nation?
('78', 10, 2, 28, 22328) I would therefore advise secession from the Congress, if you contemplate the use of force in defending yourselves in the circumstances described by you. But, said Manoranjan Babu, supposing I adopt the Gaya resolution, would I be accused of communalism if I defended the
('78', 10, 3, 29, 22599) 1 Vide What I Saw In Santiniketan, 2 3 1940 2 Vide Sind Tragedy 6 1 1940
('78', 10, 4, 30, 22672) 3 In 1922
('78', 11, 0, 1, 22682) 12 THE COLLECTED WORKS OF MAHATMA GANDHI
('78', 11, 1, 2, 22723) aggrieved Hindu ? Certainly not, I replied.
('78', 11, 1, 3, 22767) In the first place, you do not cease to be Hindu because you are a Congressman.
('78', 11, 1, 4, 22847) You will, however, be guilty of communalism, if you sided with Hindus right or wrong.
('78', 11, 1, 5, 22933) In the case in point you will defend Hindus not because they are Hindus but because they are afflicted.
('78', 11, 1, 6, 23037) I would expect you to defend Muslims if you found them molested by Hindus.
('78', 11, 1, 7, 23112) A Congressman recognizes or should recognize [no] communal distinction. The interviewers then discussed the Congress dissensions and told me that many Hindus despairing of Congress aid had joined the Hindu Mahasabha, and asked whether they could do likewise.
('78', 11, 1, 8, 23371) I told them that in theory I could see no objection.
('78', 11, 1, 9, 23424) Whether the local circumstances justified the step or not I could not judge.
('78', 11, 1, 10, 23501) But if I was a Congressman and found that as such I could not act effectively, I should not hesitate to join an organization which could render effective assistance.
('78', 11, 1, 11, 23667) I added,however, that no responsible Congressman could hold office in a Congress organization and yet be a member of the Hindu Mahasabha which is frankly a communal organization.
('78', 11, 1, 12, 23846) The whole question bristles with difficulties.
('78', 11, 1, 13, 23893) The occasion demands calmness, truthfulness and boldness.
('78', 11, 1, 14, 23951) Communalism is bound to win, if the Congress cannot become effectively non violent.
('78', 11, 1, 15, 24035) It will itself become communal in action if it plays with non violence.
('78', 11, 1, 16, 24107) For the majority of Congressmen who are Hindus are bound to drift into violence, if they do not know the effective use of non violence.
('78', 11, 1, 17, 24243) I am quite clear in my mind that the Congress can remain non communal only if it becomes truly non violent in all matters.
('78', 11, 1, 18, 24366) It cannot be non violent only towards the rulers and violent towards others.
('78', 11, 1, 19, 24443) That way lie disgrace and disaster.

('78', 11, 3, 22, 24525) 13. THE RIGHT STEP It was not without a pang that I advised the important step taken by the Gandhi Seva Sangh 1.The harakiri was performed when the Sangh was in full bloom of life.
('78', 11, 3, 23, 24706) Kishorelal Mashruwala is one of our rare workers.
('78', 11, 3, 24, 24756) He is indefatigable.
('78', 11, 3, 25, 24777) He is conscientious to a fault.
('78', 11, 3, 26, 24809) No detail escapes his vigilant eye.
('78', 11, 3, 27, 24845) He is a philosopher and popular writer in Gujarati.
('78', 11, 3, 28, 24897) He is as good a Marathi scholar as he is a Gujarati scholar.
('78', 11, 4, 29, 24958) 1 At its meeting on February 22, 1940; vide Resolution at Gandhi Seva Sangh, 12 2 1940
('78', 12, 0, 1, 25045) VOL. 78 : 23 FEBRUARY, 1940 15 JULY, 1940 13
('78', 12, 1, 2, 25090) He is singularly free from race, caste or provincial pride or prejudice.
('78', 12, 1, 3, 25163) He is an independent thinker.
('78', 12, 1, 4, 25193) He is no politician.
('78', 12, 1, 5, 25214) He is a born reformer.
('78', 12, 1, 6, 25237) He is a student of all religions.
('78', 12, 1, 7, 25271) There is no trace of bigotry in him.
('78', 12, 1, 8, 25308) He avoids responsibility and publicity.
('78', 12, 1, 9, 25348) And yet there is no man who having undertaken responsibility would discharge it with greater thoroughness than he.
('78', 12, 1, 10, 25463) It was with great difficulty that I succeeded in persuading him to become President of the Gandhi Seva Sangh.
('78', 12, 1, 11, 25573) His industry and single minded devotion brought the Sangh the importance and usefulness it has shown.
('78', 12, 1, 12, 25675) In utter disregard of his health (I count this no merit but a demerit in a public worker), he made himself available to all seekers at all times.
('78', 12, 1, 13, 25821) No wonder he became indispensable to the Sangh.
('78', 12, 1, 14, 25869) With infinite care he produced a constitution for the Sangh which can be used as a model by any such organization.
('78', 12, 1, 15, 25984) I mention these details not to glorify Kishorelal.
('78', 12, 1, 16, 26035) He needs no glori fying.
('78', 12, 1, 17, 26060) I mention them for my own satisfaction and to show the reader and especially the retiring members and the numerous sympathizers of the Sangh that the step was not taken without the utmost deliberation.
('78', 12, 1, 18, 26262) For the past two years we, its builders, have been groping.
('78', 12, 1, 19, 26322) We have been fee ling that it was not performing the function worthy of its ideals.
('78', 12, 1, 20, 26406) It has ever remained untouched by party or power politics.
('78', 12, 1, 21, 26465) It was born to supp ort and popularize the constructive part of the Congress programme Kish orelal was wearing himself out to make it effective.
('78', 12, 1, 22, 26610) But we were not sati sfied with the result.
('78', 12, 1, 23, 26654) With our vaunted boast that as votaries of the Gita we were not concerned with results, there should have been no internal dissatisfaction.
('78', 12, 1, 24, 26794) But it was there.
('78', 12, 1, 25, 26812) The cause, as it has turned out, was not poverty of results but poverty of the mission.
('78', 12, 1, 26, 26900) We were, at least I was, groping for the exact mission of the Sangh apart from its function of being a distributing agency for funds donated orcollected by Jamnalalji for the support of constructive Congress workers.
('78', 12, 1, 27, 27117) It was in Malikanda that I discovered the central disease and the remedy.
('78', 12, 1, 28, 27191) The Sangh was a superfluity so far as the mere carrying out of the constructive programme was concerned.
('78', 12, 1, 29, 27296) For the necessity had brought into being the A. I. S. A., the Harijan Sevak Sangh, the A. I. V. I. A., and the Talimi Sangh.
('78', 12, 1, 30, 27421) Was there nothing else for the Sangh to do which would be worthy of the ability and sacrifice of workers like Kishorelal ?
('78', 12, 1, 31, 27544) Painfully the answer came in Malikanda.
('78', 12, 1, 32, 27584) The Sangh has to explore the possibilities of ahimsa in all walks of life.
('78', 12, 1, 33, 27659) It has to find out whether in reality the activities known as constructive have vital connection with, or are inevitable consequences of, the application of
('78', 13, 0, 1, 27816) 14 THE COLLECTED WORKS OF MAHATMA GANDHI
('78', 13, 1, 2, 27857) ahimsa to national life.
('78', 13, 1, 3, 27882) Ahimsa in theory no one knows.
('78', 13, 1, 4, 27913) It is as indefinable as God.
('78', 13, 1, 5, 27942) But in its working we get glimpses of it as we have glimpses of the Almightly in His working amongst and through us.
('78', 13, 1, 6, 28059) It is the function of the Sangh to apply their mind as scientists to this laborious task.The constructive activities of the different organizations furnish the Sangh with ample data for its investigations.
('78', 13, 1, 7, 28265) When the mission was discovered we found that we were poor in missionaries for shouldering the tremendous responsibility.
('78', 13, 1, 8, 28387) It is good that the discovery has been made.Without the past five years incessant labour it might not have been made.
('78', 13, 1, 9, 28505) The Sangh has been kept alive in the hope that the right men, maybe women, would be forthcoming to approach the mission than which no nobler is to be found.
('78', 13, 1, 10, 28662) Let the retiring members know that for them, too, the work has only now begun.
('78', 13, 1, 11, 28741) Let them become unseen and silent workers in the research laboratory and send their results to the Sangh.
('78', 13, 1, 12, 28847) Their legal connection with Kishorelal is finished.
('78', 13, 1, 13, 28899) The purer and unbreakable connection has only now begun.
('78', 13, 1, 14, 28956) In the new president the Sangh has an equally well tried and equally conscientious worker.
('78', 13, 1, 15, 29047) Jajuji is no philosopher, he is no writer.
('78', 13, 1, 16, 29090) But he is more practical.
('78', 13, 1, 17, 29116) He has been in charge of the Maharashtra branch of the A. I. S. A. His labours have made of it the success it is.
('78', 13, 1, 18, 29230) The reconstruction is a right step.
('78', 13, 1, 19, 29266) It must bear the right fruit.
('78', 13, 1, 20, 29296) CALCUTTA, February 26, 1940

('78', 15, 4, 10, 31898) 19. STATEMENT TO THE PRESS 3
('78', 15, 5, 11, 31927) CALCUTTA, March 2, 1940 The question has come from London whether the Congress has closed the door to negotiation and compromise.
('78', 15, 5, 12, 32057) My interpretation of the resolution 4 is that the Congress has not closed the door.
('78', 15, 5, 13, 32141) It has been closed by Lord Zetland.
('78', 15, 5, 14, 32177) 5 There can be no negotiation on his terms so far as the Congress is concerned.
('78', 15, 5, 15, 32257) India will not be a helpless partner in her own exploitation and foreign domination.The Congress will not rest till India is a free country as Britain is.
('78', 15, 5, 16, 32412) And if India accepts non violence as her settled policy, she will be freer than Britain.
('78', 15, 5, 17, 32501) Britain, which has ruled the waves, is in danger of losing her liberty.
('78', 15, 5, 18, 32573) I have prescribed a remedy which is fool proof.
('78', 15, 5, 19, 32621) Whether the Congress will be instrumental in gaining Indias freedom or not is a different question.
('78', 15, 5, 20, 32721) The resolution states in unequivocal terms that the Congress will enter into no compromise that gives India less.
('78', 15, 5, 21, 32835) The other thing that the Congress has made clear is that the British aim being known to be no other than the consolidation of the British Empire, the India that is influenced by the Congress can be no party to the war.
('78', 15, 5, 22, 33054) In other words, the Congress cannot give Britain its moral support.
('78', 15, 5, 23, 33122) The third thing the resolution makes clear is that the fight,

('78', 16, 3, 6, 34026) 20. WHEN THE BRITISH WITHDRAW 1
('78', 16, 4, 7, 34058) Unless you adopt an all party form of government, you are paving the way towards sowing Hindu Muslim conflict after the British protection is withdrawn.
('78', 16, 4, 8, 34211) It was not non violence but your tremendous magnetism plus the backing of British bayonet that kept the congress in power.
('78', 16, 4, 9, 34334) Try non violence without the latter for two or three months, and the truth of the above will be realized.
('78', 16, 4, 10, 34440) Thus writes an esteemed correspondent.
('78', 16, 4, 11, 34479) I have no difficulty in endorsing the remark that it was the British bayonet that kept the Congress ministries inpower.Mymagnetismmay have had something to do with the victory at the polls.
('78', 16, 4, 12, 34669) But it proved utterly useless to keep the ministries in power.
('78', 16, 4, 13, 34732) The sustaining force was the British bayonet.
('78', 16, 4, 14, 34778) This only shows that the people at large have not yet imbibed the lesson of non violence.
('78', 16, 4, 15, 34868) The remedy is not an all party government.Such will be no government of the people, for the people.It will be the government of a caucus for its own ends.
('78', 16, 4, 16, 35023) The caucus will have no smoother sailing than the Congress ministries had.
('78', 16, 4, 17, 35098) It will also have to rely upon the British bayonet.
('78', 16, 4, 18, 35150) There can be no manly peace in the land unless the British bayonet is withdrawn.
('78', 16, 4, 19, 35231) The risk of riots has to be run.
('78', 16, 4, 20, 35264) Non violence will be born out of such risks, if at all it is to be part of national life.
('78', 16, 4, 21, 35354) It is daily becoming crystal clear that real unity will not come so long as the British bayonet crushes the free spirit of the people.
('78', 16, 4, 22, 35489) The peace it imposes is the peace of the grave.
('78', 16, 4, 23, 35537) I feel that riots will be a welcome relief, if that is the price we have to pay for freedom.
('78', 16, 4, 24, 35630) For out of them I can conceive the possibility of peace coming, not out of the present unreality.
('78', 16, 4, 25, 35728) The way out of riots on the one hand and British bayonets on the other is frank acceptance of non violence.

('78', 18, 10, 13, 37153) 24. A VERY USEFUL PUBLICATION
('78', 18, 11, 14, 37183) Shri Satis Chandra Das Gupta of Khadi Pratishthan has just
('78', 18, 12, 15, 37242) published a volume called Home and Village Doctor (price Rs. 5 cloth bound, Rs. 6 leather bound).
('78', 18, 12, 16, 37340) It contains 1,384 pages, has 18 chapters on the human body, care of systems, nutrition, hygiene and sanitation, nursing, accidents,home treatment, cheap remedies, diseases of the various organs, care of pregnant mother and child, infections and constitutional diseases as well as those relating specially to women.
('78', 18, 12, 17, 37655) Particular contents are exhaustive, and it has a copious index at the end covering 32 pages.
('78', 18, 12, 18, 37748) There are 219 instructive illustrations.
('78', 18, 12, 19, 37789) It was during my second imprisonment here that I wrote and asked medical friends to give me a book after the style of the excellent publication Moores Family Medicine.
('78', 18, 12, 20, 37957) I wanted, however, something better and more indigenous in the sense that a layman serving in villages could handle with ease.
('78', 18, 12, 21, 38084) A book was promised but the promise could not be fulfilled.
('78', 18, 12, 22, 38144) Satis Babu came to the rescue and with his amazing industry has produced a book which should meet my requirements.
('78', 18, 12, 23, 38259) As he says in his introduction he would not publish it till I had read it through and certified it as satisfactory.
('78', 18, 12, 24, 38375) He supplied me with the chapters as they were getting ready; then when he had finished the whole volume he bound it and sent it to me.
('78', 18, 12, 25, 38510) I carried it with me for one year or longer but could never get the time required.
('78', 18, 12, 26, 38593) In despair I wrote to Satis Babu to publish the book as it was.
('78', 18, 12, 27, 38657) He was quite content to leave the work unpublished, but I could not think of
('78', 18, 13, 28, 38734) 1 From the G.N. Register
('78', 19, 0, 1, 38759) 20 THE COLLECTED WORKS OF MAHATMA GANDHI
('78', 19, 1, 2, 38800) allowing such labour of love given with infinite care to be lost.
('78', 19, 1, 3, 38866) I confess that I do not quite like the bulk of the volume.

('78', 19, 3, 9, 39265) 25. LETTER TO BALKRISHNA BHAVE After 1230 a.m., March 5, 1940
('78', 19, 4, 10, 39327) BALKRISHNA, I have got up to write to Vinoba.
('78', 19, 4, 11, 39373) I am, therefore, writing to you also.
('78', 19, 4, 12, 39411) I have written to Vinoba about the Gandhi Seva Sangh.
('78', 19, 4, 13, 39465) The answer to your question is as follows : No general rule can be laid down regarding discharges.
('78', 19, 4, 14, 39564) If the nerves have become weak, discharges would occur even when no desire was felt.
('78', 19, 4, 15, 39649) This would be a condition of extreme weakness.
('78', 19, 4, 16, 39696) If discharges are the result of physical urge, they must be conquered.
('78', 19, 4, 17, 39767) In either case, however, we have no option but to endure them.
('78', 19, 4, 18, 39830) It is but obvious that the fewer the discharges the better for the person.
('78', 19, 4, 19, 39905) To the question how many may be considered safe, there can be no reply.
('78', 19, 4, 20, 39977) Some may be debilitated even by one.
('78', 19, 4, 21, 40014) Some feel no visible effect even if they get one every week.
('78', 19, 4, 22, 40075) I would, therefore, advise you not to worry about their number but go on, patiently and with faith, taking measures to control them.
('78', 19, 4, 23, 40208) Action alone is thy province, never the fruits thereof 1 applies completely in this case, too.
('78', 19, 5, 24, 40303) Blessings from
('78', 19, 6, 25, 40318) BAPU [PS.] I cannot conceive of any circumstances in which you may be justified in retiring to the Himalayas.
('78', 19, 6, 26, 40428) For the present, at any rate, there is no question of your going to jail.
('78', 19, 6, 27, 40502) I have not as yet thought over the subject from all points of view.

('78', 20, 1, 2, 40690) 26. QUESTION BOX IS IT VOLUNTARY ?
('78', 20, 2, 3, 40725) Q. The local officials have been collecting money from the people in aid of the war fund.
('78', 20, 2, 4, 40815) But the way in which they have been raising money, though it is supposed to be voluntary giving, seems to be practical coercion.
('78', 20, 2, 5, 40944) They arranged for a drama, but under instructions from the officials the village teachers (some of whom get about 12 or 15 rupees per month), the village munsif, bazaar keepers, all had to buy tickets varying in price from one to fifteen rupees each.
('78', 20, 2, 6, 41195) A petty shop keeper whose income is only about Rs. 15 had to pay Rs. 5 for a ticket though the man never attended the drama.
('78', 20, 2, 7, 41320) He told me he paid the money because the local Sub collector, Tehsildar, Circle Inspector of Police were all there in person to collect the money.
('78', 20, 2, 8, 41467) I am told Rs. 3,500 were raised in one night in my village.
('78', 20, 2, 9, 41527) Will you advise what to do
('78', 20, 3, 10, 41554) A. If what you say is true, it is naked coercion.
('78', 20, 3, 11, 41604) There is nothing voluntary in the peoples action.
('78', 20, 3, 12, 41654) I can only hope that the higher authorities do not know anything about such high handed procedure.
('78', 20, 3, 13, 41753) Your duty is clear.
('78', 20, 3, 14, 41773) You must tell the people that they ought not to submit to coercion.
('78', 20, 3, 15, 41841) They are as free to refuse to buy tickets as they are free to buy them.
('78', 20, 3, 16, 41913) You and they should run the risk involved; you in instructing the people, and they in refusing to pay.
('78', 20, 3, 17, 42016) A YOUNG MANS DILEMMA
('78', 20, 4, 18, 42037) Q. I am a young man of 22 years.
('78', 20, 4, 19, 42070) Is it legitimate for me to refuse to oblige my father in the matter of marriage if I do not wish to marry ?
('78', 20, 5, 20, 42178) A. According to the Shastras and also reason, children when they reach the age of discretion, which the former prescribe as 16, become their parents friends, i.e., are free from parental dictation.
('78', 20, 5, 21, 42376) They are still bound to consult them and defer to their wishes wherever they can.
('78', 20, 5, 22, 42458) You are full grown, and in a matter so vital as marriage you should respectfully refuse to marry if the match is not to your liking or for any other valid reason.
('78', 20, 5, 23, 42621) A DOMESTIC DIFFICULTY
('78', 20, 6, 24, 42643) Q. I am a young man of 23 years.
('78', 20, 6, 25, 42676) For the last two years, I have been using pure khadi only.
('78', 20, 6, 26, 42735) Fro the last 28 days I have been spinning regularly in my leisure time.
('78', 20, 6, 27, 42807) But my wife refuses to wear khadi.
('78', 20, 6, 28, 42842) She says it is too coarse.
('78', 20, 6, 29, 42869) Should I compel her to use khadi ?
('78', 20, 6, 30, 42904) I may also mention that I find our temperaments are incompatible.
('78', 20, 7, 31, 42970) A. This is the common lot of life in India.
('78', 20, 7, 32, 43014) I have often said that the husband, being the stronger and more educated party, has to act as tutor to his wife and put up with her defects, if any.
('78', 20, 7, 33, 43163) In your case you have to bear the incompatibility and conquer your wife by
('78', 21, 0, 1, 43238) 22 THE COLLECTED WORKS OF MAHATMA GANDHI
('78', 21, 1, 2, 43279) love, never by compulsion.
('78', 21, 1, 3, 43306) It follows that you cannot compel your wife to use khadi.
('78', 21, 1, 4, 43364) But you should trust your love and example to make her do the right thing.
('78', 21, 1, 5, 43439) Remember your wife is not your property any more than you are hers.
('78', 21, 1, 6, 43507) She is your better half.
('78', 21, 1, 7, 43532) Treat her as such.
('78', 21, 1, 8, 43551) You will not regret the experiment.
('78', 21, 1, 9, 43587) ANOTHER DOMESTIC DIFFICULTY
('78', 21, 2, 10, 43615) Q. I am married.
('78', 21, 2, 11, 43632) My wife is a good woman.
('78', 21, 2, 12, 43657) We have children.
('78', 21, 2, 13, 43675) We have lived together in peace hitherto.
('78', 21, 2, 14, 43717) Unfortunately she came across someone whom she has adopted as her guru.
('78', 21, 2, 15, 43789) She has received gurumantra 1 from her and her life has become a closed book for me.
('78', 21, 2, 16, 43874) This has given rise to coolness between us.
('78', 21, 2, 17, 43918) I do not know what I should do.
('78', 21, 2, 18, 43950) Rama, as portrayed by Tulsidas, is my ideal hero.
('78', 21, 2, 19, 44000) Should I not do what Rama did, and cut off all connection with my wife ?
('78', 21, 2, 20, 44073) A. Tulsidas has taught us that we may not indiscriminately imitate the great.
('78', 21, 2, 21, 44151) What they may do with impunity we may not.
('78', 21, 2, 22, 44194) Think of Ramas love for Sita.
('78', 21, 2, 23, 44224) Tulsidas tells us that before the appearance of the golden deer the real Sita at the behest of Rama disappeared in the clouds and the mere shadow remained.
('78', 21, 2, 24, 44380) This fact was a close secret even from Lakshmana.
('78', 21, 2, 25, 44430) The poet further tells us that Rama had a purpose which was divine.
('78', 21, 2, 26, 44498) It was with this shadow of Sita that Rama dealt, after the appearance of the golden deer on the scene.
('78', 21, 2, 27, 44601) Even so Sita never resented any single act of Rama.
('78', 21, 2, 28, 44653) All such data would be lacking in any mundane case, as they are lacking in yours.
('78', 21, 2, 29, 44735) Therefore my advice to you would be to bear with your wife and not interfere with her so long as you have no cause of complaint against her conduct.If you adopted someone as your guru and had your gurumantra and if you did not impart the secret to your wife, I am sure you would not relish her resenting your refusal to disclose the secret.
('78', 21, 2, 30, 45076) I admit that between husband and wife there should be no secrets from one another.
('78', 21, 2, 31, 45159) I have a very high opinion of the marriage tie.
('78', 21, 2, 32, 45207) I hold that husband and wife merge in each other.
('78', 21, 2, 33, 45257) They are one in two or two in one.But these thingscannot b regulated mechanically.
('78', 21, 2, 34, 45340) All things considered, therefore, since you are a liberal minded husband, you should have no difficulty in respecting your wifes reluctance to share the secret with you.
('78', 21, 2, 35, 45510) MUSLIM WEAVERS AND MILL YARN
('78', 21, 3, 36, 45539) Q. By insisting on the use of certified khadi only, you have delivered a very severe blow to the Muslim weavers on the one hand who are mostly using mill yarn, and on the other to the consumer who is thus induced to purchase certified khadi which is notoriously dear.
('78', 21, 3, 37, 45807) I am a Muslim working for the uplift of the weaver class.
('78', 21, 3, 38, 45865) I appeal to you to remove this double hardship by sanctioning the use of hand woven
('78', 21, 4, 39, 45949) 1 A mystic formula prescribed by a guru
('78', 22, 0, 1, 45989) VOL. 78 : 23 FEBRUARY, 1940 15 JULY, 1940 23
('78', 22, 1, 2, 46034) mill yarn khadi.
('78', 22, 2, 3, 46051) A. There is no communalism in khadi.
('78', 22, 2, 4, 46088) The A.I.S.A. has thousands of Muslim spinners and hundreds of Muslim weavers on its books.
('78', 22, 2, 5, 46179) Khadi has as yet made little impression upon mill yarn weavers.
('78', 22, 2, 6, 46243) What it has done is to provide occupation to those Hindu and Muslim weavers who were thrown out of employment by mill competition.
('78', 22, 2, 7, 46374) Those weavers who do not take to weaving hand spun are cutting their own throats because the natural consequence of the spread of mills will be the destruction of weavers as it has been that of hand spinners.
('78', 22, 2, 8, 46583) The handloom weavers who have held their own are pattern weavers.
('78', 22, 2, 9, 46649) If khadi became universal, Muslim and other weavers who are today weaving mill yarn would, as a matter of course, take to weaving hand spun.
('78', 22, 2, 10, 46790) Thus there is no case of khadi ever hitting a single weaver.
('78', 22, 2, 11, 46851) In fact it is his sole protection.
('78', 22, 2, 12, 46886) A TICKLISH QUESTION
('78', 22, 3, 13, 46906) Q. I am a Hindu student.
('78', 22, 3, 14, 46931) I have been great friends with a Muslim, but we have
('78', 22, 4, 15, 46984) fallen out over the question of idol worship.

('78', 22, 6, 22, 47403) If your friend has real love for you, he will conquer his prejudice against idol worship.
('78', 22, 6, 23, 47493) A friendship which exacts oneness of opinion and conduct is not worth much.
('78', 22, 6, 24, 47569) Friends have to tolerate one anothers ways of life and thought even though they may be different, except where the difference is fundamental.
('78', 22, 6, 25, 47711) Maybe your friend has come to think that it is sinful to associate with you as you are an idolater.
('78', 22, 6, 26, 47811) Idolatry is bad, not so idol worship.
('78', 22, 6, 27, 47849) An idolater makes a fetish of his idol.
('78', 22, 6, 28, 47889) An idol worshipper sees God even in a stone and therefore takes the help of an idol to establish his union with God.
('78', 22, 6, 29, 48006) Every Hindu child knows that the stone in the famous temple in Benares is not Kashi Vishwanath.
('78', 22, 6, 30, 48102) But he believes that the Lord of the Universe does reside specially in that stone.
('78', 22, 6, 31, 48185) This play of the imagination is permissible and healthy.
('78', 22, 6, 32, 48242) Every edition of the Gita on a book stall has not that sanctity which I ascribe to my own copy.
('78', 22, 6, 33, 48338) Logic tells me there is no more sanctity in my copy than in any other.
('78', 22, 6, 34, 48409) The sanctity is in my imagination.
('78', 22, 6, 35, 48444) But that imagination brings about marvellous concrete results.
('78', 22, 6, 36, 48507) It changes mens lives.
('78', 22, 6, 37, 48530) I am of opinion that, whether we admit
('78', 23, 0, 1, 48569) 24 THE COLLECTED WORKS OF MAHATMA GANDHI
('78', 23, 1, 2, 48610) it or not, we are all idol worshippers or idolaters, if the distinction I have drawn is not allowed.
('78', 23, 1, 3, 48711) A book, a building, a picture, a carving are surely all images in which God does reside, but they are not God.
('78', 23, 1, 4, 48822) He who says they are errs.
('78', 23, 1, 5, 48849) EDUCATED UNEMPLOYMENT
('78', 23, 2, 6, 48871) Q. The problem of unemployment among the educated is assuming alarming proportions.
('78', 23, 2, 7, 48955) You of course condemn higher education, but those of us who have been to the University realize that we do develop mentally there.
('78', 23, 2, 8, 49086) Why should you discourage anyone from learning ?
('78', 23, 2, 9, 49135) Would not a better solution be for unemployed graduates to go in for mass education and let the villagers give them food in return ?
('78', 23, 2, 10, 49268) And could not Provincial Governments come to their aid and help them with some money and clothing ?
('78', 23, 2, 11, 49368) A. I am not against higher education.
('78', 23, 2, 12, 49406) But I am against only a few lakhs of boys and girls receiving it at the expense of the poor tax payer.
('78', 23, 2, 13, 49509) Moreover I am against the type of higher education that is given.
('78', 23, 2, 14, 49575) It is much cry and little wool.
('78', 23, 2, 15, 49607) The whole system of higher education and for that matter all education needs radical overhauling.
('78', 23, 2, 16, 49705) But your difficulty is about unemployment.
('78', 23, 2, 17, 49748) In this you have my sympathy and co operation.
('78', 23, 2, 18, 49795) On the principle that every labourer is worthy of his hire, every graduate who goes to a village to serve it is entitled to be housed, fed and clothed by the villagers.
('78', 23, 2, 19, 49964) And they do it too.
('78', 23, 2, 20, 49984) But they will not when the graduate lives like saheb log and costs them ten times as much as they can afford.
('78', 23, 2, 21, 50094) His life must accord as nearly as possible with that of the villagers and his mission must find appreciation among them.

('78', 24, 2, 5, 51097) 28. WHEN ?
('78', 24, 3, 6, 51108) Everybody is asking me not whether but when I am to call the country to civil disobedience.
('78', 24, 3, 7, 51200) Some of my questioners are the most sober among co workers.
('78', 24, 3, 8, 51260) To them the Patna resolution 1 has no other meaning than that the struggles coming is a question of days.
('78', 24, 3, 9, 51366) It is proof that the country, or that part of it that has hitherto taken part in the struggle for freedom, is tired of waiting and suspense.
('78', 24, 3, 10, 51507) It is heartening to think that there are in the country so many persons who count no sacrifice too dear for gaining independence.
('78', 24, 3, 11, 51637) While, therefore, I admire the zeal of my questioners, I must warn them against being impatient.
('78', 24, 3, 12, 51734) There is nothing in the resolution to warrant the belief that the atmosphere is suitable for declaring civil disobedience.
('78', 24, 3, 13, 51857) It will be suicidal to declare it when there is so much indiscipline and violence within the Congress itself.
('78', 24, 3, 14, 51967) Congress men will make a serious mistake if they do not give full weight to my words.
('78', 24, 3, 15, 52053) I cannot, will not, start mass civil disobedience so long as I am not convinced that there is enough discipline and enough non violence inCongress ranks.The apathy about theconstructive programme, i.e., spinning and sales of khadi, I take to be positive signs of unbelief.
('78', 24, 3, 16, 52326) Battle through such instruments is foredoomed to failure.
('78', 24, 3, 17, 52384) Such persons should know that I am not their man.
('78', 24, 3, 18, 52434) If there is no hope of attaining the necessary measure of discipline and non violence, it would be better to let me retire from leadership.
('78', 24, 3, 19, 52574) Let it be clearly understood that I cannot be hustled into precipitating the struggle.
('78', 24, 3, 20, 52661) They err grievously who think that I can ever declare civil disobedience, having been driven thereto by the so called leftists.
('78', 24, 3, 21, 52789) I make no such distinction between rightists and leftists.
('78', 24, 3, 22, 52848) Both are my co workers and friends.
('78', 24, 3, 23, 52884) He will be a bold man who can with any measure of certainty draw the line of demarcation between leftists and rightists.
('78', 24, 3, 24, 53005) Congressmen and non Congressmen should also

('78', 25, 1, 2, 53109) know that, even if the whole country were to turn against me, I must, when the time comes, fight single handed.
('78', 25, 1, 3, 53221) The others have or may have weapons besides non violence.
('78', 25, 1, 4, 53279) I have no choice.
('78', 25, 1, 5, 53297) Being the author of non violent technique in the political field, I am bound to fight when I feel the urge from within.
('78', 25, 1, 6, 53417) It is inherent in the technique that I never know the time table in advance.

('78', 25, 1, 8, 53525) It need not be described as from God.
('78', 25, 1, 9, 53563) The inner urge is a current phrase easily understood.
('78', 25, 1, 10, 53617) Everybody sometimes acts upon the inner urge.
('78', 25, 1, 11, 53663) Such action need not always be right.
('78', 25, 1, 12, 53701) But there is no other explanation possible for certain actions.
('78', 25, 1, 13, 53765) The thought often comes to me that it would be a good thing if the Congress could forget me.

('78', 25, 1, 16, 54122) But I know that this severance cannot be brought about mechanically or violently.

('78', 33, 6, 9, 64777) Thus writes a very responsible Englishman to a common friend.
('78', 33, 6, 10, 64839) The receiver sends it to me for answer : 1
('78', 33, 7, 11, 64882) I have just been reading with very real concern the text of the resolution 2
('78', 33, 8, 12, 64959) which the Working Committee adopted yesterday.
('78', 33, 8, 13, 65006) I am writing as a very ordinary
('78', 33, 9, 14, 65038) Englishman who has been interested in India for a good many years.
('78', 33, 9, 15, 65105) I do not
('78', 33, 10, 16, 65114) believe that my sympathy with or attitude towards Indian aspirations is in any way
('78', 33, 11, 17, 65197) peculiar to myself; the views I hold .
('78', 33, 11, 18, 65236) are pretty generally held by a large number of
('78', 33, 12, 19, 65283) Englishmen.
('78', 33, 12, 20, 65295) I can speak with some confidence on this point as I am in fairly close
('78', 33, 13, 21, 65366) touch with several people who exercise some influence over English opinion and
('78', 33, 14, 22, 65445) have been working with increasing success to create an atmosphere favourable to
('78', 33, 15, 23, 65525) granting Indias demand for full dominion status.
('78', 33, 15, 24, 65574) What are we to make of the
('78', 33, 16, 25, 65601) Committees
('78', 33, 17, 26, 65612) latest move and of what appears to be the rather sudden and drastic
('78', 33, 18, 27, 65680) change from a demand for dominion status to one for complete independence ?
('78', 33, 19, 28, 65756) far too great a respect for Gandhiji and the other Congress leaders I have met to
('78', 33, 20, 29, 65838) believe it is either bluff or arises from a hasty resentment at our regrettably
('78', 33, 21, 30, 65918) unforthcoming attitude during the early negotiations.
('78', 33, 21, 31, 65972) They ought to know us well
('78', 33, 22, 32, 65999) enough by now to realize how difficult we find it to do the handsome thing in a
('78', 33, 23, 33, 66079) handsome way; and yet on the whole I think it is our manners which are at fault more
('78', 33, 24, 34, 66164) often than our intentions.

('78', 35, 32, 46, 71142) And yet it betrays a tragic ignorance of Indian thought.
('78', 35, 32, 47, 71199) Thus the writer says, What are we to
('78', 36, 0, 1, 71236) VOL. 78 : 23 FEBRUARY, 1940 15 JULY, 1940 37
('78', 36, 1, 2, 71281) make of the Committees latest move and of what appears to be the rather sudden and drastic change from a demand for dominion status to one for complete independence ? Now complete independence has been the definite goal of the Congress since 1929, 1 and has been repeated every year from thousands of platforms.
('78', 36, 1, 3, 71593) From that year to this the Congress has never even so much as mentioned Dominion Status.
('78', 36, 1, 4, 71682) There is, therefore, no change whatsoever in the Congress demand.
('78', 36, 1, 5, 71748) The question of suddenness or drasticness simply does not arise.
('78', 36, 1, 6, 71813) Confusion arises from my oft quoted letter to Mr. H. S. L. Polak wherein I said in 1937, that if Dominion Status with the right to secede was offered, I for one would accept it.

('78', 45, 1, 2, 92235) tolerated as a necessary evil while it lasts.
('78', 45, 1, 3, 92281) But I would not deliberately contaminate women with the evil.
('78', 45, 2, 4, 92343) ROMAN SCRIPT
('78', 45, 3, 5, 92356) Q. Why may not the illiterate masses be taught the Roman script ?
('78', 45, 3, 6, 92422) This would eliminate the existing controversy between Urdu and Hindi.
('78', 45, 4, 7, 92492) A. To teach the Roman script in the place of Hindi and Urdu would be like putting the cart before the horse.
('78', 45, 4, 8, 92601) Our children have first to learn both Hindi and Urdu scripts.
('78', 45, 4, 9, 92663) Difficult questions cannot be solved by ignoring them or suggesting apparently easy substitutes.
('78', 45, 4, 10, 92760) So long as hearts are divided the Roman scripts will not cement them.
('78', 45, 4, 11, 92830) It would be an additional burden.
('78', 45, 4, 12, 92864) The learning of the two scripts is the best and the easiest way of at least solving the national language riddle.
('78', 45, 4, 13, 92978) It opens Hindi and Urdu thought to both Hindu and Muslim boys and girls who will be the men and women of the future generation.
('78', 45, 4, 14, 93106) The Roman script will be learnt at its proper time, i.e., when our boys and girls are taught the English language, as some undoubtedly will be.
('78', 45, 4, 15, 93250) HOW TO BEGIN ?
('78', 45, 5, 16, 93265) Q. Congress clamours for unity, but the principles which must be followed
('78', 45, 6, 17, 93339) to attain that unity, viz., Hindu Muslim fellow feeling, no caste distinctions, no
('78', 45, 7, 18, 93422) hatred towards each other and towards foreigners, co operative endeavour, all these
('78', 45, 8, 19, 93506) are presented to audiences through the microphone but not acted upon.
('78', 45, 8, 20, 93576) Tell me, what
('78', 45, 9, 21, 93590) are the duties of a Congress member ?
('78', 45, 9, 22, 93628) I would love to join and will put forth all my
('78', 45, 10, 23, 93675) energy to do my bit for the country.
('78', 45, 11, 24, 93712) A. You need not mind what others do or ought to do.
('78', 45, 11, 25, 93764) Charity begins at home.
('78', 45, 11, 26, 93788) Let yours begin with yourself.
('78', 45, 11, 27, 93819) Abolish all caste and religious or race distinctions from your heart.
('78', 45, 11, 28, 93889) Be true to everyone Hindu, Muslim Harijan, English, etc., as you are, I hope, to yourself, and you will find that so far as you are concerned your difficulty will be solved and your example will be copied by others.
('78', 45, 11, 29, 94105) Be sure that you have banished all hate from your heart, and that you have no political or other objective in loving and serving your neighbour as if he was your own self.
('78', 45, 11, 30, 94277) SEVAGRAM, March 12, 1940 Harijan, 16 3 1940

('78', 47, 1, 2, 95731) 54. LETTER TO SHRIKRISHNADAS JAJU
('78', 47, 2, 3, 95765) SEVAGRAM, March 12, 1940
('78', 47, 3, 4, 95790) JAJUJI, The khadi problem has always been before me right from the beginning.
('78', 47, 3, 5, 95868) In the past I used to insist that those who do sacrificial spinning must spin a fine count.
('78', 47, 3, 6, 95960) We had come up to 40 count.
('78', 47, 3, 7, 95988) Later I stopped insisting on it.
('78', 47, 3, 8, 96021) The first thing now is that we must revive the practice and, secondly, we must teach the women spinners and ourselves to spin fine count yarn of good quality.
('78', 47, 3, 9, 96180) We should also effect improvements in the means necessary for fine spinning.
('78', 47, 3, 10, 96257) Anannual conference would of course be a good thing.
('78', 47, 3, 11, 96310) I see no objection to its being held under the auspices of the Gandhi Seva Sangh.
('78', 47, 3, 12, 96392) Why and where should we search for another body for that purpose ?
('78', 47, 3, 13, 96459) You are right in what you say about the expenses.
('78', 47, 3, 14, 96509) The centre must not bear them.
('78', 47, 3, 15, 96540) The province which wishes to do so may bear them.
('78', 47, 3, 16, 96590) The delegates expenses, if any, should be borne by the respective provinces.
('78', 47, 3, 17, 96667) This will ensure greater selflessness.
('78', 47, 3, 18, 96706) Communicate these fresh conditions and reply to all those who have asked for [the conference].
('78', 47, 3, 19, 96801) We will decide the venue after we hear from them.
('78', 47, 3, 20, 96851) I will try to attend.
('78', 47, 3, 21, 96873) Replacing Kishorelal by Gopabandhu Babu 1 will be all right.
('78', 47, 3, 22, 96934) I should like to point out the following, if not more, for research.
('78', 47, 4, 23, 97003) (1) The problem, of how to popularize khadi, etc., is there, no doubt.
('78', 47, 4, 24, 97074) (2) Is there any necessary connection between village crafts like spinning, etc., and ahimsa ?
('78', 47, 4, 25, 97169) If there is, what is the nature of that connection.
('78', 47, 4, 26, 97221) (3) What are the crafts which cannot be carried on without ahimsa ?
('78', 47, 4, 27, 97289) And what are the ones in which violence is unavoidable ?
('78', 47, 4, 28, 97346) Or is there no such distinction ?
('78', 47, 4, 29, 97380) (4) Does India have any special gift in regard to ahimsa ?
('78', 47, 5, 30, 97439) Blessings from BAPU [From Gujarati]

('78', 48, 1, 2, 97641) 55. DISCUSSION WITH CHRISTIAN MISSIONARIES 1
('78', 48, 2, 3, 97686) SEVAGRAM, [March 12, 1940] 2
('78', 48, 3, 4, 97715) [Q.] What started you on your career of leadership ?
('78', 48, 3, 5, 97768) [A.] It came to me, unsought, unasked.
('78', 48, 3, 6, 97807) I do not know, though, what sort of leader I am, and whether what I am doing is leadership or service.
('78', 48, 3, 7, 97910) But whatever it is, it came to me unasked.
('78', 48, 4, 8, 97953) But the friends who came were sure that they were leaders, and they asked for
('78', 48, 5, 9, 98031) guidance as leaders of Christian thought.
('78', 48, 5, 10, 98073) All I can say is that there should be less of theology and more of truth in all that you say and do.
('78', 48, 6, 11, 98174) Will you kindly explain it ?
('78', 48, 6, 12, 98203) How can I explain the obvious ?
('78', 48, 6, 13, 98235) Amongst agents of the many untruths that are propounded in the world one of the foremost is theology.
('78', 48, 6, 14, 98337) I do not say that there is no demand for it.
('78', 48, 6, 15, 98382) There is a demand in the world for many a questionable thing.
('78', 48, 6, 16, 98444) But even those who have to do with theology as part of their work have to survive their theology.
('78', 48, 6, 17, 98542) I have two good Christian friends 3 who gave up theology and decided to live the gospel of Christ.
('78', 48, 7, 18, 98641) Are you sure that no great result has come through your own study of Jesus ?
('78', 48, 7, 19, 98718) There is no doubt that it has come, but not, let me tell you, through theology or through the ordinary interpretation of theologists.
('78', 48, 7, 20, 98852) For many of them contend that the Sermon on the Mount does not apply to mundane things, and that it was only meant for the twelve disciples.
('78', 48, 7, 21, 98993) Well, I do not believe this.
('78', 48, 7, 22, 99022) I think the Sermon on the Mount has no meaning if it is not of vital use in everyday life to everyone.
('78', 48, 8, 23, 99125) Is there not to be found a solution to the present day problems in the teaching of Jesus ?
('78', 48, 8, 24, 99216) Well, you are now dragging me in deeper waters, and you will drown me.
('78', 48, 9, 25, 99287) What is the present trend of the thought of young India ?
('78', 48, 9, 26, 99345) It would take a brave and knowing man to answer this question.
('78', 48, 10, 27, 99408) 1 Reproduced from Mahadev Desais Occasional Notes.
('78', 48, 10, 28, 99459) 2 The discussion took place on March 12, the day Gandhiji left for Ramgarh.

('78', 49, 1, 3, 99677) 1 And if you go on questioning and cross questioning me, I dare say you will floor me without being any the wiser for having done so.

('78', 49, 17, 22, 100451) ON TRAIN TO RAMGARH, March 13, 1940
('78', 49, 18, 23, 100487) MY DEAR FRIEND, I have read yours 4 of 23rd February many times.
('78', 49, 18, 24, 100552) There should never be any difference of opinion between us, for
('78', 49, 19, 25, 100616) 1 Gandhiji had promised the missionaries five minutes although he was busy preparing to leave for Ramgarh.
('78', 49, 19, 26, 100723) 2 The source has March 14.

('78', 50, 0, 1, 100985) VOL. 78 : 23 FEBRUARY, 1940 15 JULY, 1940 51
('78', 50, 1, 2, 101030) there is complete heart contact and agreement as to the end and the means.
('78', 50, 1, 3, 101105) If therefore there is any difference left, it can be due only to an incomplete appreciation of facts.
('78', 50, 1, 4, 101207) The Congress does not dictate or claim to be infallible.
('78', 50, 1, 5, 101264) It does, however, deny dictatorship to the Muslim League, for example, and even dares to deny it to the British Government though as a matter of fact the latter is the dictator.
('78', 50, 1, 6, 101442) Hence if the British Government will not resign the dictatorship, the Congress has perforce to use its only non violent sanction to dislodge it from the position it should never have occupied.
('78', 50, 1, 7, 101635) What does the Congress ask ?
('78', 50, 1, 8, 101664) It asks that all the interested parties appoint a tribunal which cannot err as to what is right, viz., a constituent assembly of representatives elected on the basis of adult suffrage or an equivalent.
('78', 50, 1, 9, 101866) Independence or even dominion status of the sincere type means nothing if it does not mean self determination by the people of India.
('78', 50, 1, 10, 102000) The minorities represented on the Assembly will practically dictate their own safe guards.
('78', 50, 1, 11, 102091) Neither the Congress nor the Muslim League can be allowed to obstruct the proceedings of such an elected Assembly.
('78', 50, 1, 12, 102206) Whoever does, adopts the role of a dictator.
('78', 50, 1, 13, 102251) There remain the Princes.
('78', 50, 1, 14, 102277) They are free to come if they are elected not by the common vote but by the vote of their [own] 1 people on the basis of adult suffrage.
('78', 50, 1, 15, 102414) Pray remember they are a creation of the British Government.
('78', 50, 1, 16, 102475) The treaties that are adverse to the rights of the people have no value but the Congress has not suggested any breach of treaty obligations.
('78', 50, 1, 17, 102616) The page of British History in India is soiled with narratives of broken treaties, pledges and promises.
('78', 50, 1, 18, 102721) But I personally recognize the British Governments difficulty in the matter.
('78', 50, 1, 19, 102798) They have raised a monster, they cannot all of a sudden abolish him.
('78', 50, 1, 20, 102867) There[fore] I have said : Deal with British India only. The British Government have without reference to the Princes given to Provinces, i.e., British India, not real autonomy but a kind of glorified municipal self government as it has turned out to be in practice.
('78', 50, 1, 21, 103133) Let them now allow the people of British India the right of determining their mode of government through representatives elected as suggested above.
('78', 50, 1, 22, 103282) You have said a small private but very responsible conference
('78', 50, 2, 23, 103344) 1 Illegible in the source
('78', 51, 0, 1, 103370) 52 THE COLLECTED WORKS OF MAHATMA GANDHI
('78', 51, 1, 2, 103411) of a dozen representative Indian men work out to agreement 1 the main points of the desired constitution.
('78', 51, 1, 3, 103517) The suggestion was discussed by the Viceroy.
('78', 51, 1, 4, 103562) The difficulty is who will select the men ?
('78', 51, 1, 5, 103606) Anything short of elected men will lead to nothing new in the present artificial atmosphere.
('78', 51, 1, 6, 103699) Such a committee will naturally be elected by the larger constituent assembly.
('78', 51, 1, 7, 103778) What I have said can only be done by agreement, never by dictation.
('78', 51, 1, 8, 103846) The question shorn of all camouflage resolves itself into this.
('78', 51, 1, 9, 103910) Are the British Government prepared to make a declaration to convene at the earliest opportunity, not latter than the termination of the war, a constituent assembly of representatives elected on the basis of adult suffrage or an equivalent for the purpose of determining the mode of the Government of India including Princes India, if possible, and without if they wont agree ?
('78', 51, 1, 10, 104288) Pending the convening of such an assembly the Government of India will be conducted, as far as possible, as if it was responsible to the Central Assembly without the official 2 bloc and the Viceroys Council shall contain a majority of elected representatives from the Assembly.
('78', 51, 1, 11, 104566) If in all I have said above you see dictation or want of the spirit of accommodation or disinclination to recognize British difficulty, you will please say so and tell me in what way the test fails and I shall try to give you satisfaction.
('78', 51, 1, 12, 104806) There is no desire on the part of responsible Congressmen to pick a quarrel with the British Government.
('78', 51, 1, 13, 104911) On the contrary there is keen desire to explore every means of conciliation.
('78', 51, 2, 14, 104988) Yours sincerely,
('78', 51, 3, 15, 105005) M. K. GANDHI
