('78', 60, 5, 21, 122995) 66. ANOTHER ENGLISHMANS LETTER
('78', 60, 6, 22, 123026) Last week I dealt with a letter from a well known Englishman who is in India 3 .
('78', 60, 6, 23, 123107) Now I have a letter from a responsible English friend 4 in England, from which I give below all that the readers need to know:
('78', 60, 7, 24, 123234) We are quite certain that no such thing as banging the door has happened.
('78', 60, 7, 25, 123308) The Government still anxiously desires a settlement to be reached.
('78', 60, 7, 26, 123375) Even if normally it did not want this, it is bound to do so at the present time, in view of the terrific war in which this country is engaged.
('78', 60, 7, 27, 123518) The feeling, however, is growing amongst Government people that the Congress is increasingly regarding settlement as meaning what it alone considers right.
('78', 60, 7, 28, 123674) Apart from the fact that that is not of the nature of a settlement, but rather of a one sided dictation, I am bound to remind you that a war condition does not
('78', 60, 8, 29, 123834) 1 I n 1917 2 The meeting was then addressed by Jawaharlal Nehru, Abul Kalam Azad and C. Rajagopalachari.
('78', 60, 8, 30, 123939) 3 Vide For Englishmen, For Englishmen, 11 3 1940. 4 Vide Letter to Carl Heath, 13 3 1940.
('78', 61, 0, 1, 124029) THE COLLECTED WORKS OF MAHATMA GANDHI 62
('78', 61, 1, 2, 124070) increase the liberal mindedness of men, but on the contrary tends to strengthen a certain fear and rigidity in politics, when men become of necessity concentrated on the terrible effort in hand, and more and more unable to allow for opposition.
('78', 61, 2, 3, 124315) Hence, if the Congress rejects conciliation and follows a line of immovable opposition, it is more than probable that the British War Cabinet will do the same.
('78', 61, 2, 4, 124475) The time for peaceful settlement will passa disaster for both India and Great Britain.
('78', 61, 2, 5, 124562) I need not labour this.
('78', 61, 2, 6, 124586) Its consequences are obvious.
('78', 61, 2, 7, 124616) But I may say that it is felt here, by many most sympathetic to the cause of freedom in India, that the Congress is not wise in taking so rigid a position and ignoring the grave and indeed enormous problems Great Britain is facing that make so difficult a satisfactory answer to the Congress claim.
('78', 61, 3, 8, 124915) India claims her freedom in the sense, first, of self determination.
('78', 61, 3, 9, 124984) Here the question is asked : What is this Government of India that all India wants
('78', 61, 4, 10, 125067) Congress Party, Muslims and other communities, and Princes included ?
('78', 61, 4, 11, 125137) The Congress demands a Constituent Assembly to determine this.
('78', 61, 4, 12, 125200) But it seems clear that before such an Assembly could usefully attempt to tackle this question, with any hope of reaching agreement, prior work has to be done.
('78', 61, 4, 13, 125360) Should not, first, a small, private but very responsible conference of a dozen representative Indian men work out to agreement the main points of the desired constitution ?
('78', 61, 5, 14, 125533) Given that this small conference was representative, and was accepted by both India and Great Britain as a responsible body, and given the reaching of reasonable agreement, it is practically certain that the British Government would accept its decision.
('78', 61, 5, 15, 125787) And it is to be supposed that a national assembly of all India, whatever the minor modifications it might desire, would substantially do so too.
('78', 61, 6, 16, 125932) This would not be all that the Congress High Command is envisaging.
('78', 61, 6, 17, 126000) But unless the Congress is prepared for war there must be some meeting of the views of other parties, and some willingness to meet the de facto
('78', 61, 7, 18, 126144) Government on procedure.
('78', 61, 8, 19, 126169) There is a great desire and willingness here to reach a solution.
('78', 61, 8, 20, 126235) Everything demands it, and there never was a greater amount of discussion over British Indian relations than at the present time.
('78', 61, 8, 21, 126365) On the other hand, there is developing a certain grim determination not to accept dictation from what, it is otherwise agreed of course, is the major political party in India,but whose decision can neither oust Great Britain from participation in the solution, nor release her from treaties, undertakings and promises.
('78', 61, 8, 22, 126684) The gravity of the situation now is such that I most deeply pray you not to turn from the wonderful path of patient seeking of understanding that has
('78', 62, 0, 1, 126834) VOL 78 : 23 FEBRUARY, 1940 15 JULY, 1940 63
('78', 62, 1, 2, 126878) always been yours and return to a past situation of a kind we both equally hate.
('78', 62, 1, 3, 126959) May I add as a long friend of Indian freedom my deep conviction that this struggle must and can be ended in friendship and equalityaccepting all the implications of both these words.
('78', 62, 1, 4, 127142) For this, England has to return to India the domination and control she has exercised, not asking a price; and India has to claim Englands consent, not demand her surrender.
('78', 62, 1, 5, 127316) So only can a lasting peace be reached.
('78', 62, 1, 6, 127356) But if this is so, the steps thereto must be agreed steps.
('78', 62, 1, 7, 127415) I can well believe that the Government people did not wish to bang the door, but Lord Zetlands interview left no room for doubt.
('78', 62, 1, 8, 127544) These were his words:
('78', 62, 2, 9, 127566) Referring to Mr. Gandhis statement that, if the British Government would leave the framing of the constitution to Indians themselves, the questions of defence, minorities, Princes and European interests would automatically be resolved, Lord Zetland said that, while he greatly admired Mr. Gandhis optimism, he was unhappily quite unable to share it and felt that, as long as the leaders of the Congress maintained their present attitude, the obstacles in the way of an honourable understanding would be greatly increased.
('78', 62, 3, 10, 128088) Lord Zetland said that it was unfortunate that Congress spokesmen made a fetish of the word independence, since he was convinced that this had created a false impression in Great Britain of the aim which the vast majority of Indians had in view.
('78', 62, 3, 11, 128334) That they desire freedom to govern themselves I do not doubt; that they contemplate India swinging from the orbit of British Commonwealth, I do not for a moment believe.
('78', 62, 3, 12, 128504) In a mad world, they are far too appreciative of the protection afforded to them by the armed strength of Great Britain on land and sea. My correspondent is a careful student of contemporary events in India.
('78', 62, 3, 13, 128712) He chooses his words before using them.
('78', 62, 3, 14, 128752) Yet he has evidently felt unable to correct the impression in Government circles that the Congress is increasingly regarding settlement as meaning what it alone considers right.
('78', 62, 3, 15, 128930) The Congress has never taken up an uncompromising attitude and within the four corners of its demand has always shown its readiness for a settlement.
('78', 62, 3, 16, 129080) Its demand is unequivocal.
('78', 62, 3, 17, 129107) It says to the British Government : If you really mean to part with power and your war is not for consolidating your Empire but for democracy all round, then you will declare India a free country and let a Constituent Assembly elected on the basis of adult suffrage decide upon the form and content of her own Government.
('78', 62, 3, 18, 129429) No doubt there are difficulties, e.g., about defence, about minorities, and the Princes.
('78', 62, 3, 19, 129518) The burden of solving these difficulties will be shifted from you to the Constituent Assembly.
('78', 62, 3, 20, 129613) If the Assembly cannot solve these satisfactorily, it will prove its insolvency.
('78', 62, 3, 21, 129694) You will have done
('78', 63, 0, 1, 129713) THE COLLECTED WORKS OF MAHATMA GANDHI 64
('78', 63, 1, 2, 129754) your duty. Surely in this there is no one sided dictation.
('78', 63, 1, 3, 129813) The writer reminds me of the war condition and suggests in effect that it does not improve ones temper.
('78', 63, 1, 4, 129917) I should say that a problem like India is a direct issue in the war; perhaps the fortunes of war will turn upon the conduct of nationalist India.
('78', 63, 1, 5, 130063) People engaged in a war do not lose temper over matters which affect the fortunes of war.
('78', 63, 1, 6, 130153) I have no difficulty in endorsing the suggestion that some work prior to the Constituent Assembly should be done.
('78', 63, 1, 7, 130267) The writer suggests a very responsible conference of a dozen representatives.
('78', 63, 1, 8, 130345) The difficulty is of choosing the representatives.
('78', 63, 1, 9, 130396) Who will choose them ?
('78', 63, 1, 10, 130419) They cannot command confidence unless they are duly elected.
('78', 63, 1, 11, 130480) Such a committee, so far as I can see, can only be appointed by the members of the Constituent Assembly.
('78', 63, 1, 12, 130585) I think the day is gone when any party worth the name will accept as representatives Government nominees as was done at the Round Table Conference.
('78', 63, 1, 13, 130733) The Congress has to be and is prepared for war.
('78', 63, 1, 14, 130781) But it wants to avoid war.
('78', 63, 1, 15, 130808) It will not wantonly act so as to be the cause of endless suffering to the people.
('78', 63, 1, 16, 130891) The Congress is ever ready to meet the de facto Government on procedure.
('78', 63, 1, 17, 130964) Is the latter willing and ready to recognize India as a free country ?
('78', 63, 1, 18, 131035) The Congress history shows that it has always met and is today ready to meet the views of other parties on most matters.
('78', 63, 1, 19, 131156) What it is not ready to do is to alter the goal.
('78', 63, 1, 20, 131205) It must be content to be reduced to a hopeless minority for the sake of preserving its goal.
('78', 63, 1, 21, 131298) It is a trust which it cannot abandon without being disloyal to its past.
('78', 63, 1, 22, 131372) The end of non violent war is always an agreement, never dictation, much less humiliation of the opponent.
('78', 63, 1, 23, 131479) There can be no question of the Congress asking or expecting Britain to dishonour just obligations or treaties.
('78', 63, 1, 24, 131591) What, however, I miss is a sincere desire on the part of Britain to do unto India what she would wish done to her if the position were reversed.
('78', 63, 1, 25, 131736) The Congress is unreasonable, if it is wrong for it to refuse to abate the passion for freedom for which Dadabhai laboured, which Tilak taught India to regard as her birthright, and for which thousands of men and women have cheerfully suffered imprisonment and loss of their possessions.
('78', 63, 1, 26, 132024) If it is allowed as a worthy passion, the Congress has no fear as to the verdict of being regarded as eminently reasonable in everything else.

('78', 64, 1, 2, 132254) 67. QUESTION BOX
('78', 64, 2, 3, 132271) PRINCES
('78', 64, 3, 4, 132279) Q. You have, I fear, evaded the question of the Princes.
('78', 64, 3, 5, 132336) Generally you go
('78', 64, 4, 6, 132353) straight to your subject, but somehow or other you seem to have walked round this
('78', 64, 5, 7, 132435) subject.
('78', 64, 6, 8, 132444) A. Apparently, but not really, there is some truth in the taunt.
('78', 64, 6, 9, 132509) The fact is that the Princes have never before now been presented as a difficulty.
('78', 64, 6, 10, 132592) They are a new arrow from the British quiver.
('78', 64, 6, 11, 132638) It is British India that is fighting for freedom.
('78', 64, 6, 12, 132688) The States people are fighting their own battle in their own States against overwhelming odds.
('78', 64, 6, 13, 132783) The people in the States and in British India are one.
('78', 64, 6, 14, 132838) For them the artificial boundaries do not exist.
('78', 64, 6, 15, 132887) But for the administrators the boundaries are very real.
('78', 64, 6, 16, 132944) British law has allowed the Princes to regard as foreigners people from British India going to the States or people from one State to another.
('78', 64, 6, 17, 133087) And yet the Princes exist only on British sufferance.
('78', 64, 6, 18, 133141) They cannot move without British Permission.
('78', 64, 6, 19, 133186) Their heirs have to be approved by the British Raj.
('78', 64, 6, 20, 133238) Their tuition is also under the same supervision.
('78', 64, 6, 21, 133288) They can be deposed at will.
('78', 64, 6, 22, 133317) Thus so far as the British control is concerned, they are worse off than the ordinary British subject.
('78', 64, 6, 23, 133420) But so far as their people are concerned, the Princes have unlimited control over them.
('78', 64, 6, 24, 133508) They can imprison them at will and even put them to death.
('78', 64, 6, 25, 133567) Theoretically British Raj has a duty by the people also.
('78', 64, 6, 26, 133624) But it is rarely exercised.
('78', 64, 6, 27, 133652) Therefore the people of the States labour under a double handicap.
('78', 64, 6, 28, 133719) It must be clear to you from the foregoing narrative that the Congress cannot influence the Princes except through the British Government.
('78', 64, 6, 29, 133858) Indeed, the latter will not permit any real approach to the Princes.
('78', 64, 6, 30, 133927) I personally do not desire the extinction of the Princely order.
('78', 64, 6, 31, 133992) But I do want the Princes to recognize the signs of the times and shed a large part of their autocracy.
('78', 64, 6, 32, 134096) In spite of the powerful British bayonet, the march of the people of both the Indias cannot be stayed.
('78', 64, 6, 33, 134199) I am hoping that the combined wisdom of all, including the Princes and the present rulers, will prevent the march from running mad, which it is bound to do unless a smooth passage is made for it.
('78', 64, 6, 34, 134395) I am putting forth the best non violent effort I can, but my non violence, because of my imperfections, may fail.
('78', 64, 6, 35, 134509) I ask for the helping hand of those who
('78', 65, 0, 1, 134549) THE COLLECTED WORKS OF MAHATMA GANDHI 66
('78', 65, 1, 2, 134590) would see India win her goal without a blood bath.
('78', 65, 1, 3, 134641) But if the Princes will not listen, I do not ask for their coercion.
('78', 65, 1, 4, 134710) Let British India have her independence, and I know, the Princes know, that true freedom of British India means freedom of their people also.
('78', 65, 1, 5, 134852) For as I have said the two are one.
('78', 65, 1, 6, 134888) No power on earth can keep them in separation for all time.
('78', 65, 1, 7, 134948) USE OF FORCE AGAINST MUSLIMS
('78', 65, 2, 8, 134977) Q. You talk of complete independence from Britain and at the same time of
('78', 65, 3, 9, 135051) settling the question of minorities through a Constituent Assembly.

('78', 65, 6, 21, 135974) Indian solution of even specially Muslim questions.
('78', 65, 6, 22, 136026) But if the hope is frustrated, the Congress cannot forcibly resist the express will of the Muslims of India.
('78', 65, 6, 23, 136135) Needless to say the Congress can never seek the assistance of British forces to resist the vivisection.
('78', 65, 6, 24, 136239) It is the Muslims who will impose their will by force singly or with British assistance on an unresisting India.
('78', 65, 6, 25, 136352) If I can carry the Congress with me, I would not put the Muslims to the trouble of using force.
('78', 65, 6, 26, 136448) I would be ruled by them for it would still be Indian rule.
('78', 65, 6, 27, 136508) In other words, the Congress will have only a non violent approach to every question and difficulty arising.

('78', 65, 6, 29, 136813) In that event, the British will be where they are, only they will be wooed by both the parties alternately and will remain the architects of Indias

('78', 66, 1, 2, 137005) destiny.
('78', 66, 1, 3, 137014) For then, with the Congress swept away, non violence will be blown to the winds and naturally the infinitely superior violence of the British aided by the willing co operation of the wooing party will easily rule India.
('78', 66, 1, 4, 137234) For the only force matched against British force is that of non violence, incomplete though it is, of the Congress.
('78', 66, 1, 5, 137350) NEGLECT OF SANSKRIT
('78', 66, 2, 6, 137370) Q. Do you know that the Patna University has practically tabooed the study of Sanskrit ?
('78', 66, 2, 7, 137459) Do you approve of the step ?
('78', 66, 2, 8, 137488) If you do not, will you express your opinion in Harijan ?
('78', 66, 3, 9, 137546) A. I do not know what the Patna University has done.
('78', 66, 3, 10, 137599) But I quite agree with you that the study of Sanskrit is being sadly neglected.
('78', 66, 3, 11, 137679) I belong to a generation which believed in the study of the ancient languages.
('78', 66, 3, 12, 137758) I do not believe that such a study is a waste of time and effort.
('78', 66, 3, 13, 137824) I believe it is an aid to the sutdy of modern languages.
('78', 66, 3, 14, 137881) This is truer of Sanskrit than of any other ancient language so far as India is concerned, and every nationalist should study it because it makes a study of the provincial languages easier than otherwise.
('78', 66, 3, 15, 138086) It is the language in which our forefathers thought and wrote.
('78', 66, 3, 16, 138149) No Hindu boy or girl should be without a knowledge of the rudiments of Sanskrit, if he will imbibe the spirit of his religion.
('78', 66, 3, 17, 138276) Thus the Gayatri 1
('78', 66, 4, 18, 138295) is untranslatable.
('78', 66, 4, 19, 138314) No translation can give the music of the original which I hold has a meaning all its own.
('78', 66, 4, 20, 138404) The Gayatri is but one example of what I have said.

('78', 67, 1, 18, 140707) THE NATIONAL WEEK From 6th April to 13th April has been observed as the National Week from year to year.
('78', 67, 1, 19, 140812) On the 6th April 1919 the masses of India found their feet 1 .
('78', 67, 1, 20, 140875) It was the inauguration of Civil Disobedience.
('78', 67, 1, 21, 140922) Its non violent character was signalized by fasting and prayer.
('78', 67, 1, 22, 140986) Hindus and Muslims fraternized as they had never done before.
('78', 67, 1, 23, 141048) The vow of swadeshi was taken by tens of thousands.
('78', 67, 1, 24, 141100) The 13th April 1919 saw the Jallianwala massacre in which Hindu, Muslim and Sikh blood flowed promiscuously.
('78', 67, 1, 25, 141209) The National Week is observed as a week of self purification, in which sales of khadi and other products of village industries are organized on a large scale.
('78', 67, 1, 26, 141368) I have said and I repeat that there is no swaraj for the masses except through khadi and other village crafts.
('78', 67, 1, 27, 141479) For there is no non violent disobedience without sustained constructive effort.
('78', 67, 1, 28, 141559) A living, continuous mass contact is impossible without some constructive programme requiring almost daily contact of the workers with the masses.
('78', 67, 1, 29, 141706) I hope, therefore, that the forthcoming Week will be celebrated by all earnest workers with due

('78', 75, 4, 6, 159526) MAZHARPURI, RAMGARH, March 18, 1940
('78', 75, 5, 7, 159562) Addressing the gathering after prayer, Mr. Gandhi stressed the importance of khadi and said for those who were not regular members of the Congress, an exhibition held on such occasions was a substitute for the Congress.
('78', 75, 5, 8, 159782) Members of the Congress might attend the Congress Session out of a sense of duty but an exhibition provided at least an attraction for those who were not Congressmen.
('78', 75, 5, 9, 159949) Such men could come and buy something for their use at the exhibition.
('78', 75, 6, 10, 160020) This Exhibition is the real Congress for the masses.
('78', 75, 6, 11, 160073) Our chosen delegates will attend the Congress, and pass resolutions there as to what we have to do during the year.
('78', 75, 6, 12, 160189) But what are the masses to do ?
('78', 75, 6, 13, 160221) The Exhibition serves to provide intellectual pabulum for the masses, and those who visit the Exhibition owe it to them to take to them what they learn here.
('78', 75, 6, 14, 160379) There is no institution where 35 crores of our people can go.
('78', 75, 6, 15, 160441) The Kumbh Mela 4 is attended by several lakhs of people, but what is that number in a population of 35 crores ?
('78', 75, 6, 16, 160553) But if you who attend the Exhibition can take some of the crafts which are being demonstrated here to the villagers, you can reach the millions who inhabit the villages and revolutionize their lives.

('78', 85, 11, 24, 180742) 84. HOW TO EVOKE THE BEST ?
('78', 85, 12, 25, 180770) An Indian protagonist of Britain writes : 1
('78', 85, 13, 26, 180814) If our aim is to arouse the best in Englishmen through our non 
('78', 85, 14, 27, 180878) violence and thus create mutual trust, we have signally failed.
('78', 85, 14, 28, 180942) Our best
('78', 85, 15, 29, 180951) period of non violence .
('78', 85, 15, 30, 180976) was the period of Congress regime in
('78', 85, 16, 31, 181013) provinces.
('78', 85, 16, 32, 181024) Now the whole atmosphere is again getting surcharged
('78', 85, 17, 33, 181077) with nothing but hatred towards England.
('78', 85, 17, 34, 181118) Cordiality is being replaced by
('78', 85, 18, 35, 181150) 1 Only excerpts are reproduced here.
('78', 86, 0, 1, 181187) VOL. 78 : 23 FEBRUARY, 1940 15 JULY, 1940 87
('78', 86, 1, 2, 181232) bitterness and trust by distrust.
('78', 86, 1, 3, 181266) What visible demonstration have we
('78', 86, 2, 4, 181301) given of our non violence or of our desire to cultivate goodwill ?
('78', 86, 3, 5, 181368) not a compromise based on give and take a more appropriate machinery
('78', 86, 4, 6, 181437) for (1) creating a non violent atmosphere, (2) creating goodwill, (3)
('78', 86, 5, 7, 181507) rousing the best in the Englishmen, and (4) creating a short cut to
('78', 86, 6, 8, 181575) independence through mutual co operation ?
('78', 86, 6, 9, 181618) The argument does credit to the heart of the writer, but he misses the method of non violence.
('78', 86, 6, 10, 181713) He has started with a half premise.
('78', 86, 6, 11, 181749) Our aim is not merely to arouse the best in Englishmen but to do so whilst we are prosecuting our cause.
('78', 86, 6, 12, 181854) If we cease to pursue our course, we do not evoke the best in him but we pander to the evil in him.
('78', 86, 6, 13, 181954) The best must not be confounded with good temper.
('78', 86, 6, 14, 182004) When we are dealing with any evil, we may have to ruffle the evil doer.
('78', 86, 6, 15, 182076) We have to run the risk, if we are to bring the best out of him.
('78', 86, 6, 16, 182141) I have likened non violence to aseptic and violence to antiseptic treatment.
('78', 86, 6, 17, 182218) Both are intended to ward off the evil, and therefore cause a kind of disturbance which is often inevitable.
('78', 86, 6, 18, 182327) The first never harms the evil doer.
('78', 86, 6, 19, 182364) Whilst I agree with the critic that our non violence has not been unadulterated, I must dissent from the view that we have signally failed.
('78', 86, 6, 20, 182504) I am unable to agree that the best period of non violence was the period of Congress regime.
('78', 86, 6, 21, 182597) During that period non violence was inactive.
('78', 86, 6, 22, 182643) For each tried to please the other.
('78', 86, 6, 23, 182679) Both were seemingly pursuing a common policy, though each had known reservations.
('78', 86, 6, 24, 182761) The visible demonstration we have given of non violence is that violent action has been successfully and entirely avoided through Congress influence.
('78', 86, 6, 25, 182911) Being too near the event we are not able to have a true measure of the great restraint exercised by millions of men and women.
('78', 86, 6, 26, 183038) I grant that we have not yet shed violence of the heart.
('78', 86, 6, 27, 183095) But the amazing self restraint exercised by the people fills me with the hope that violence of the heart will in due course give place to goodwill towards the opponent.
('78', 86, 6, 28, 183264) It will never come if the critics plan of the policy of timidity, as I should call it, is pursued.
('78', 86, 6, 29, 183363) Hatred will melt when restraint has been exercised sufficiently long to starve it.
('78', 86, 6, 30, 183446) The effect of it on the English mind will also be equally wholesome in the long run.
('78', 86, 6, 31, 183531) Englishmen will perceive that non violence was real in so far as it went, and that masses of people could act with great restraint in spite of their nursing a grievance against them.
('78', 86, 6, 32, 183714) All compromise is based on give and take, but there can be no give and take on fundamentals.
('78', 86, 6, 33, 183807) Any compromise on fundamentals is a surrender.
('78', 86, 6, 34, 183854) For it is all give and no take.
('78', 86, 6, 35, 183886) The time for compromise can only come when both are of one mind
('78', 87, 0, 1, 183950) 88 THE COLLECTED WORKS OF MAHATMA GANDHI
('78', 87, 1, 2, 183991) on fundamentals, i.e., when the British Government have made up their mind that not they but Indians will determine the constitution under which the latter will be governed.
('78', 87, 1, 3, 184165) There is a dangerous snag in the reluctance to refer the question of constitution to an assembly of elected Indian representatives.
('78', 87, 1, 4, 184297) Minorities need have no fear, for they will determine their own safeguards through their own representatives.
('78', 87, 1, 5, 184407) The Princes need have none, for they need not come in, if they do not wish to.
('78', 87, 1, 6, 184486) The only party that can effectively obstruct and does obstruct is the dominating i.
('78', 87, 1, 7, 184570) e., the ruling party.
('78', 87, 1, 8, 184592) There will be no compromise until that party has sincerely come to the conclusion that it cannot or does not want to rule.
('78', 87, 1, 9, 184715) SEVAGRAM, March 24, 1940 Harijan, 30 3 1940
('78', 87, 2, 10, 184759) 85. A CHIEF JUDGE DESCENDS
('78', 87, 3, 11, 184786) A correspondent sends me a newspaper report of a speech delivered by the Chief Judge of Mysore at a meeting recently held in Bangalore to help the war.
('78', 87, 3, 12, 184938) He is reported to have said : 1
('78', 87, 4, 13, 184970) The Allies were not fighting for democracy or any particular form of government.
('78', 87, 4, 14, 185051) They were fighting to put an end to all forms of aggression by one nation against others.
('78', 87, 4, 15, 185141) The leaders of a certain political party in this country had decided that this was the proper occasion for them to bargain for their political ends, had thereatened that, if what they asked for was not granted, they would create trouble in India and so help the enemy.
('78', 87, 4, 16, 185410) He was sure that when the history of India came to be written, Indian children of the future would skip over with shame that part relating to the tactics of such politicians as he had referred to.
('78', 87, 4, 17, 185607) It is hardly likely that His Honour the Chief Judge knows of the secrets of the British Cabinet.
('78', 87, 4, 18, 185704) In any event, if Britain is fighting against mere aggression, it can hardly be called a worthy aim.
('78', 87, 4, 19, 185804) Having been the foremost aggressor in the world, Britain could not justify her fight against Germany on the pretext put forth by the learned Chief Judge.
('78', 87, 4, 20, 185958) My correspondent in sending the cutting says in his covering letter :
('78', 87, 5, 21, 186028) 1. He ought not to have entered into matters of political controversy at a non party meeting convened under royal auspices.
('78', 87, 6, 22, 186152) 2. He, being the Chief Justice of a High Court, overstepped the bounds of propriety in publicly attacking the politics of a particular
('78', 87, 7, 23, 186287) 1 Only excerpts are reproduced here.
('78', 88, 0, 1, 186324) VOL. 78 : 23 FEBRUARY, 1940 15 JULY, 1940 89
('78', 88, 2, 2, 186369) 3. He, being a judicial officer of an Indian State, ought not to have gone out of the way and meddled with the party politics of British India.
('78', 88, 2, 3, 186513) I think the criticism is just.
('78', 88, 2, 4, 186544) The Congress will survive the attack.
('78', 88, 2, 5, 186582) But I do not know whether the Paramount Power should not take notice of the Chief Judges extraordinary utterance.
('78', 88, 2, 6, 186696) Surely he misuses the word bargain when he applies it to the Congress policy.
('78', 88, 2, 7, 186774) What is there to be ashamed of in the Congress seeking the deliverance of the country from foreign rule even when the foreigner is in distress ?
('78', 88, 2, 8, 186919) If the Congress was not committed to the method of peace, it would have been not only justified but would have deemed it its duty to take advantage of Britains difficulty by creating a state of rebellion in the country by every means at its disposal.
('78', 88, 2, 9, 187170) But the Congress has adopted the policy of peace.
('78', 88, 2, 10, 187220) No doubt it would have done better if it could have honestly accepted my advice.
('78', 88, 2, 11, 187301) The choice before the Congress was not between two evils but between good and better.
('78', 88, 2, 12, 187387) The better was beyond its ability and would therefore have harmed and weakened it.
('78', 88, 2, 13, 187470) Thus good was the best for the Congress, and so I threw in my lot with it.
('78', 88, 2, 14, 187545) I would have been a traitor if, having led the Congress to accept non violence as its policy, I had remained on my pedestal and refused to guide the great organization.
('78', 88, 2, 15, 187714) It ill becomes those who believe in war as an accepted institution to charge the Congress with the spirit of bargaining.
('78', 88, 2, 16, 187835) The word is a misfit when it is applied to the life and death struggle of a nation bent upon vindicating its right to freedom.
('78', 88, 2, 17, 187962) SEVAGRAM, March 25, 1940
('78', 88, 3, 18, 187987) Harijan, 30 3 1940
('78', 88, 4, 19, 188006) 86. EVERY CONGRESS COMMITTEE A SATYAGRAHA COMMITTEE
('78', 88, 5, 20, 188058) When I said at the Subjects Committee meeting 1 at Ramgarh that every Congress Committee should become a Satyagraha Committee, I meant every word of what I said, as I meant every word of everything else I said.
('78', 88, 5, 21, 188269) I would like every Congressman who desires to serve in the Satyagraha Sena 2 to read my two
('78', 88, 6, 22, 188361) 1 On March 18 2 Army
('78', 89, 0, 1, 188382) 90 THE COLLECTED WORKS OF MAHATMA GANDHI
('78', 89, 1, 2, 188423) speeches 1 made at Ramgarh as well as whatever else I may write in Harijan on the struggle, and to carry out the instructions meant for him or her.
('78', 89, 1, 3, 188571) In the coming struggle, if it must come, no half hearted loyalty will answer the purpose.
('78', 89, 1, 4, 188661) Imagine a General marching to battle with doubting, ill prepared soldiers.
('78', 89, 1, 5, 188736) He will surely march to defeat.
('78', 89, 1, 6, 188768) I will not consciously make any such fatal experiment.
('78', 89, 1, 7, 188823) This is not meant to frighten Congressmen.
('78', 89, 1, 8, 188866) If they have the will, they will not find my instructions difficult to follow.
('78', 89, 1, 9, 188945) Correspondents tell me that, though they have no faith in me or the charkha, they ply the latter for the sake of discipline.
('78', 89, 1, 10, 189070) I do not understand this language.
('78', 89, 1, 11, 189105) Can a General fight on the strength of soldiers who, he knows, have no faith in him ?
('78', 89, 1, 12, 189191) The plain meaning of this language is that the correspondents believe in mass action but do not believe in the connection I see between it and the charkha, etc., if the action is to be non violent.
('78', 89, 1, 13, 189389) They believe in my hold on the masses, but they do not believe in the things which I believe have given me that hold.
('78', 89, 1, 14, 189507) They merely want to exploit me and will grudgingly pay the price which my ignorance or obstinacy (according to them) demands.
('78', 89, 1, 15, 189633) I do not call this discipline.
('78', 89, 1, 16, 189664) True discipline gives enthusiastic obedience to instructions even though they do not satisfy reason.
('78', 89, 1, 17, 189765) A volunteer exercises his reason when he chooses his General, but after having made the choice, he does not waste his time and energy in scanning every instruction and testing it on the anvil of his reason before following it.
('78', 89, 1, 18, 189992) His is not to reason why.
('78', 89, 1, 19, 190018) Now for my instructions.
('78', 89, 1, 20, 190043) Every Congress Committee should become a Satyagraha Committee and register such Congressmen who believe in the cultivation of the spirit of goodwill towards all, who have no untouchability in them in any shape or form, who would spin regularly, and who habitually use khadi to the exclusion of all other cloth.
('78', 89, 1, 21, 190354) I would expect those who thus register their names with their Committees to devote the whole of their spare time to the constructive programme.
('78', 89, 1, 22, 190498) If the response is sincere, these Satyagraha Committees would become busy spinning depots.
('78', 89, 1, 23, 190589) They will work in conjunction with and under the guidance of A.I.S.A. branches in a businesslike manner so that there remain, in the jurisdiction of the Committees, no Congressmen who have not adopted khadi for exclusive use.
('78', 89, 1, 24, 190815) I shall expect businesslike reports to be sent from provincial headquarters to the A.I.C.C. as to the progress of the work of the Satyagraha Committees.
('78', 89, 1, 25, 190968) Seeing that
('78', 89, 2, 26, 190980) 1 Vide Speech at Subjects Committee, Speech at Subjects Committee, 18 3 1940, and Speech at Congress Session, 20 3 1940.
('78', 90, 0, 1, 191101) VOL. 78 : 23 FEBRUARY, 1940 15 JULY, 1940 91
('78', 90, 1, 2, 191146) this registration is to be purely voluntary, the reports would mention the numbers both of those who give their names for registration and those who do not.
('78', 90, 1, 3, 191303) The registered satyagrahis will keep a diary of the work that they do from day to day.
('78', 90, 1, 4, 191390) Their work, besides their own spinning, will consist in visiting the primary members and inducing them to use khadi, spin and register themselves.
('78', 90, 1, 5, 191537) Whether they do so or not, contact should be maintained with them.
('78', 90, 1, 6, 191604) There should be visits paid to Harijan homes and their difficulties removed so far as possible.
('78', 90, 1, 7, 191700) Needless to say that names should be registered only of those who are willing and able to suffer imprisonment.
('78', 90, 1, 8, 191811) No financial assistance is to be expected by satyagrahi prisoners whether for themselves or their dependents.
('78', 90, 1, 9, 191921) So much for the active satyagrahis.
('78', 90, 1, 10, 191957) But there is a much larger class of men and women who, though they will not spin or court or suffer imprisonment, believe in the two cardinal principles of satyagraha and welcome and wish well to the struggle.
('78', 90, 1, 11, 192167) These I will call passive satyagrahis.
('78', 90, 1, 12, 192206) They will help equally with the active ones, if they will not interfere with the course of the struggle by themselves courting imprisonment or aiding or precipitating strikes of labourers or students.
('78', 90, 1, 13, 192407) Those who out of overzeal or for any other cause will act contrary to these instructions will harm the struggle and may even compel me to suspend it.
('78', 90, 1, 14, 192557) When the forces of violence are let loose all over the world and when nations reputed to be most civilized cannot think of any force other than that of arms for the settlement of their disputes, I hope that it will be possible to say of India that she fought and won the battle of freedom by purely peaceful means.
('78', 90, 1, 15, 192872) I am quite clear in my mind that, given the co operation of politically minded India, the attainment of Indias freedom is perfectly possible through unmixed non violence.
('78', 90, 1, 16, 193043) The world does not believe our pretension of non violence.
('78', 90, 1, 17, 193102) Let alone the world, I, the self styled General, have repeatedly admitted that we have violence in our hearts, that we are often violent to one another in our mutual dealings.
('78', 90, 1, 18, 193278) I must confess that I will not be able to fight so long as we have violence in our midst.
('78', 90, 1, 19, 193368) But I will fight if the proposed register is honest and if those who courageously keep out will not disturb the even course of the struggle.
('78', 90, 1, 20, 193509) Non violent action means mobilization of world opinion in our favour.
('78', 90, 1, 21, 193579) I know that a growing number of thinking men and women of the world are sick of the war spirit, they are longing for a way of peace, and they are looking to India to point that way.
('78', 91, 0, 1, 193761) 92 THE COLLECTED WORKS OF MAHATMA GANDHI
('78', 91, 1, 2, 193802) We cannot have that opinion on our side if we are not honestly non violent.
('78', 91, 1, 3, 193878) Let me repeat what I have said in these columns, that I shall be able to fight with a very small army of honest satyagrahis and shall feel powerless and embarrassed if I have a huge army in which I can have no trust or as to whose behaviour I am not always sure.
('78', 91, 1, 4, 194141) I expect the A.I.C.C. to organize Satyagraha Committees and report to me from time to time of the progress made.
('78', 91, 1, 5, 194254) If there is an enthusiastic response, inside of one month it should be possible to forecast the exact period required to put the Satyagraha Committees in working order.
('78', 91, 1, 6, 194423) SEVAGRAM, March 25, 1940

('78', 91, 3, 8, 194467) 87. MY ANSWER TO QUAID E AZAM
('78', 91, 4, 9, 194497) Quaid e Azam Jinnah is reported to have said 1 :
('78', 91, 5, 10, 194546) Mr. Gandhi has been saying for the last 20 years that there cannot be any swaraj without Hindu Muslim unity.
('78', 91, 5, 11, 194655) Mr. Gandhi is fighting for a Constituent Assembly.
('78', 91, 5, 12, 194706) May I point out to Mr. Gandhi and the Congress that they are fighting for a Constituent Assembly which we cannot accept ?
('78', 91, 5, 13, 194828) Therefore, the idea of a Constituent Assembly is impracticable and unacceptable.
('78', 91, 5, 14, 194909) Mr. Gandhi wants a Constituent Assembly for purposes of ascertaining the views of Muslims, and if they do not agree, he would then give up all hope and then would agree with us.
('78', 91, 5, 15, 195087) 2 If there exists the will to come to a settlement with the Muslim League, then why does not Mr. Gandhi, as I have said more than once, honestly agree that the Congress is a Hindu organization and that it does not represent anything but the solid body of Hindus ?
('78', 91, 5, 16, 195351) Why should Mr. Gandhi not be proud to say : I am a Hindu and the Congress is a Hindu body ?
('78', 91, 5, 17, 195443) I am not ashamed of saying that I am a Muslim and that the Muslim League is the representative of Muslims.
('78', 91, 5, 18, 195550) Why all this camouflage, why this threat of civil disobedience, and why this fight for a Constituent Assembly ?
('78', 91, 6, 19, 195662) Why should not Mr. Gandhi come as a Hindu leader and let me meet him proudly representing the Mussalmans ?
('78', 91, 6, 20, 195769) My position is and has been clear.
('78', 91, 6, 21, 195804) I am proud of being a Hindu, but I have never gone to anybody as a Hindu to secure Hindu Muslim unity.
('78', 91, 6, 22, 195907) My Hinduism demands no pacts.
('78', 91, 6, 23, 195937) My support of the Khilafat was unconditional.
('78', 91, 6, 24, 195983) I am no politician in
('78', 91, 7, 25, 196005) 1 In his Presidential address at the Lahore session of the All India Muslim League on March 22 2 Vide Speech at Subjects Committee, 18 3 1940.
('78', 92, 0, 1, 196148) VOL. 78 : 23 FEBRUARY, 1940 15 JULY, 1940 93
('78', 92, 1, 2, 196193) the accepted sense.
('78', 92, 1, 3, 196213) But whatever talks I had with Quaid e Azam or any other have been on behalf of the Congress which is not a Hindu organization.
('78', 92, 1, 4, 196340) Can a Hindu organization have a Muslim divine as President, and can its Working Committee have four Muslim members out of 15 ?
('78', 92, 1, 5, 196467) I still maintain that there is no swaraj without Hindu Muslim unity.
('78', 92, 1, 6, 196536) I can never be party to the coercion of Muslims or any other minority.
('78', 92, 1, 7, 196607) The Constituent Assembly as conceived by me is not intended to coerce anybody.
('78', 92, 1, 8, 196686) Its sole sanction will be an agreed solution of communal questions.
('78', 92, 1, 9, 196754) If there is no agreement, the Constituent Assembly will be automatically dissolved.
('78', 92, 1, 10, 196838) The Constituent Assembly or any body of elected representatives can alone have a fully representative status.
('78', 92, 1, 11, 196948) The Congress representative capacity has been and can be questioned.
('78', 92, 1, 12, 197017) But who can question the sole representative capacity of the elected delegates to the Constituent Assembly ?
('78', 92, 1, 13, 197126) I cannot understand the Muslim opposition to the proposed Constituent Assembly.
('78', 92, 1, 14, 197206) Are the opponents afraid that the Muslim League will not be elected by Muslim voters ?
('78', 92, 1, 15, 197293) Do they not realize that any Muslim demand made by the Muslim delegates will be irresistible ?
('78', 92, 1, 16, 197388) If the vast majority of Indian Muslims feel that they are not one nation with their Hindu and other brethren, who will be able to resist them ?
('78', 92, 1, 17, 197532) But surely it is permissible to dispute the authority of the 50,000 Muslims who listened to Quaid e Azam to represent the feeling of eight crores of Indian Muslims.

('78', 97, 2, 3, 204358) SEVAGRAM, March 30, 1940
('78', 97, 3, 4, 204383) Just now you recited the eleven vows as part of your prayers.
('78', 97, 3, 5, 204445) It is our formula for gaining internal and external emancipation.
('78', 97, 3, 6, 204511) Working within its orbit success may appear at times difficult, but there need be no despair, if we have faith.
('78', 97, 3, 7, 204623) The greater the difficulties, the greater should be our faith.
('78', 97, 3, 8, 204686) Even so, faith is needed for the prosecution of the khadi programme.
('78', 97, 3, 9, 204755) Although the people of Sevagram gave an invitation and I agreed to the holding of the yatra here, that does not mean that I consider this place to be fit for the holding of such yatra.
('78', 97, 3, 10, 204940) My test would require a high percentage of adoption of khadi.
('78', 97, 3, 11, 205002) As it is, perhaps, not more than 20 per cent of the Sevagram folk wear khadi.
('78', 97, 3, 12, 205080) Those that do, have not adopted it fully and with an understanding of all its implications.
('78', 97, 3, 13, 205172) The adoption of khadi with all its implications means revolution in ones life.
('78', 97, 3, 14, 205251) It means purity in its wide sense and a readiness to lay down ones life for the sake of the countrys freedom.
('78', 97, 3, 15, 205361) Do the people of Sevagram come up to that test ?
('78', 97, 3, 16, 205410) I am afraid, not.
('78', 97, 3, 17, 205428) I confess the failure is partly mine.
('78', 97, 3, 18, 205466) I have not put forth sufficient effort to give them the needed education.
('78', 97, 3, 19, 205540) I would like you to hold the next yatra in a place which comes at least within a measurable distance of the ideal that I have laid down.
('78', 97, 3, 20, 205677) At Malikanda we reduced the size and scope of the Gandhi Seva Sangh and turned it into an institute for carrying out experimental research intothe principles for which the Sangh stands, as for instance, truth, ahimsa, khadi, and their interrelation ship.
('78', 97, 3, 21, 205932) I have said that there is a vital connection between khadi and ahimsa.
('78', 97, 3, 22, 206003) But I have not fully proved it.
('78', 97, 3, 23, 206035) My reason follows my heart.
('78', 97, 3, 24, 206063) Without the latter it would go astray.
('78', 97, 3, 25, 206102) Faith is the function of the heart It mus be enforced by reason.The two are not antagonistic as some think.
('78', 97, 3, 26, 206210) The more intense ones faith is, the more it whets ones reason.
('78', 97, 3, 27, 206273) And so, although my faith in khadi is daily growing, I have not put my reason in cold storage.
('78', 97, 3, 28, 206368) I listen carefully to all adverse criticism with an open and receptive mind, extract from it what is worth extracting and
('78', 97, 4, 29, 206490) 1 Reproduced from the article Sevagram Khadi Yatra.

('78', 98, 1, 2, 206759) reject the chaff.
('78', 98, 1, 3, 206777) I am always ready to correct my mistakes.
('78', 98, 1, 4, 206819) A full and candid admission of ones mistake should make one proof against its repetition.
('78', 98, 1, 5, 206909) A full realization of ones mistake is also the highest form of expiation.

('78', 98, 1, 9, 207172) We must find out why the progress in khadi is slow.
('78', 98, 1, 10, 207224) It may be that we have erred in detail, we may find that we have hereafter to place more emphasis on self spinning than on production for sale.

('78', 98, 1, 12, 207497) But under the advice of experienced khadi workers, we satisfied ourselves with three annas standard wage for the time being, keeping the higher figure before us as our goal.
('78', 98, 1, 13, 207671) Even this rise is phenomenal.

('78', 98, 1, 18, 207929) The link between khadi economics, politics and sociology cannot depend on unreasoned faith.
('78', 98, 1, 19, 208021) The wheel is the one thing that can become universal and replace the use of arms.
('78', 98, 1, 20, 208103) If the millions co operate in plying the charkha for the sake of their economic liberation, the mere fact will give them an invincible power to achieve political independence.
('78', 98, 1, 21, 208279) You must have noticed how insistent I have become about the fulfilment of the khadi programme as a condition precedent to the launching of civil disobedience.
('78', 98, 1, 22, 208438) If our preparation is complete, the struggle may be rendered unnecessary.
('78', 98, 1, 23, 208512) And if it does become necessary, it will be invincible and of a short duration.
('78', 98, 1, 24, 208592) But if only a few take to the charkha, it becomes necessary for them to sacrifice their all in order to quicken the conscience of their compatriots and the English rulers.
('78', 98, 1, 25, 208764) The efficacy of their sacrifice will depend upon the degree of their purity and innocence.
('78', 98, 1, 26, 208855) Mere wearing of khadi without knowing its implications cannot help.
('78', 98, 1, 27, 208923) For, when it becomes the vogue even evil doers will wear it.
('78', 98, 1, 28, 208984) Khadi like Gods sunshine and air is for all alike, but all do not thereby become eligible for satyagraha.
('78', 98, 1, 29, 209090) Khadi, purity and readiness to sacrifice oneself are the three essential conditions for a satyagrahi.
('78', 98, 1, 30, 209192) The charkha is the external symbol.
('78', 98, 1, 31, 209228) Without it your sacrifice will not be non violent.
('78', 98, 1, 32, 209279) I have no cut and dry plan of fight before me.
('78', 98, 1, 33, 209326) I only know that I must be ready for it unless I am a hypocrite or a fool.

('78', 99, 1, 3, 209602) The experiment will exercise your faith and your reason and may give you the key for making khadi universal.

('78', 101, 5, 6, 212858) 103. DISCUSSION AT KHADI YATRA 1
('78', 101, 6, 7, 212891) SEVAGRAM,
('78', 101, 7, 8, 212901) March 31, 1940
('78', 101, 8, 9, 212916) Q. Has takli been introduced into the basic education scheme with the
('78', 101, 9, 10, 212986) economic, i.e., self support, or the educative end in view ?
('78', 101, 10, 11, 213047) A. Anything introduced in basic education can only have one end in view, i.e., the educative.
('78', 101, 10, 12, 213141) The object of basic education is the physical, intellectual and moral development of the children through the medium of a handicraft.
('78', 101, 10, 13, 213275) But I hold that any scheme, which is sound from the educative point of view and is efficiently managed, is bound to be sound economically.
('78', 101, 10, 14, 213414) For instance, we can teach our children to make clay toys that are to be destroyed afterwards.
('78', 101, 10, 15, 213509) That too will develop their intellect.
('78', 101, 10, 16, 213548) But it will neglect a very important moral principle, viz., that human labour and material should never be used in a wasteful or unproductive way.
('78', 101, 10, 17, 213695) The emphasis laid on the principle of spending every minute of ones life usefully is the best education for citizenship and incidentally makes basic education self sufficient.
('78', 101, 11, 18, 213871) Q. How can khadi and spinning lead to swaraj ?
('78', 101, 12, 19, 213918) A. If millions co operate, it cannot but generate tremendous strength which can be put to any use one likes.
('78', 101, 12, 20, 214027) The charkha provides the best medium for such co operation.
('78', 101, 12, 21, 214087) It provides dignified employment and food and clothing for Daridranarayana.
('78', 101, 12, 22, 214163) This cannot but produce mass consciousness and non violent strength for gaining swaraj.
('78', 101, 13, 23, 214251) Q. Must one who takes to khadi take to spinning as well ?
('78', 101, 14, 24, 214309) A. From the economic point of view it is enough to take to khadi.
('78', 101, 14, 25, 214375) But if khadi is to be our weapon for winning swaraj, spinning is of equal necessity.
('78', 101, 14, 26, 214460) Khadi gives us economic self sufficiency, whereas spinning links us with the lowest paid labour.
('78', 101, 15, 27, 214557) 1 Reproduced from the article Sevagram Khadi Yatra.
('78', 101, 15, 28, 214609) The report is prefaced as follows : The khadi yatra was over at 5 p.m.
('78', 101, 15, 29, 214680) on 31st March, but as Gandhiji had agreed to answer questions, if there were any, after the evening prayer, many people stayed on for the night.
('78', 102, 0, 1, 214825) VOL. 78 : 23 FEBRUARY, 1940 15 JULY, 1940 103
('78', 102, 1, 2, 214871) In militarized countries everyone gives a certain time for military purposes.
('78', 102, 1, 3, 214949) Ours being a non violent basis, everyone should do sacrificial spinning for a minimum period from year to year.
('78', 102, 1, 4, 215061) Maulana Mohamed Ali used to call the takli and the yarn our arms and ammunition for winning swaraj.
('78', 102, 1, 5, 215161) The analogy is telling.
('78', 102, 1, 6, 215185) Is it too much for us to give half an hour or one hour per day to spinning as a measure of voluntary conscription ?
('78', 102, 1, 7, 215301) I remember, at the beginning of the last war when I was in England I was given pyjama suits to stitch for the soldiers.
('78', 102, 1, 8, 215421) Many others from the most aristocratic families including some venerable old ladies and gentlemen were doing such work.
('78', 102, 1, 9, 215541) We all finished our quota of work as we were required to.
('78', 102, 1, 10, 215599) No one considered it beneath his or her dignity to do so.
('78', 102, 1, 11, 215657) Towards the end of the war far more work was given by the whole nation.
('78', 102, 1, 12, 215729) Yet no one complained.
('78', 102, 1, 13, 215752) I warn you that, although today I am asking you only to give half an hour or one hour per day to spinning, I may have to be more exacting as the situation develops.
('78', 102, 2, 14, 215917) Q. Should civil resister prisoners offer satyagraha in order to get the permission to wear khadi and spin regularly in jail ?
('78', 102, 3, 15, 216043) A. A satyagrahi willingly submits to all jail discipline.
('78', 102, 3, 16, 216101) He never wishes to embarrass the authorities.
('78', 102, 3, 17, 216147) To insist on being allowed to spin in jail when you do not do so with religious regularity outside, would be a species of violence.
('78', 102, 3, 18, 216279) I would not recommend that course to anybody although I can conceive of exceptional cases.
('78', 102, 3, 19, 216370) Appa Patwardhan for instancewho might go to the extreme length in order to secure that permission.
('78', 102, 3, 20, 216469) 1 We have not behaved as ideal prisoners in the past.
('78', 102, 3, 21, 216523) There has been violence and untruth in our actions.
('78', 102, 3, 22, 216575) I do not want that to be repeated.
('78', 102, 3, 23, 216610) We may plead with the jail authorities.
('78', 102, 3, 24, 216650) I would be faced with a dilemma if I were not allowed these facilities.
('78', 102, 3, 25, 216722) What I have said of spinning applies equally to khadi.
('78', 102, 4, 26, 216777) Replying to another question, Gandhiji said that workers should mix with villagers, identify with them, endear them and serve them.
('78', 102, 4, 27, 216909) If we get a number of sevaks (workers) we can have swaraj early.
('78', 102, 5, 28, 216974) Q. Do you like cheering when you enter or speak and also shouts of Mahatma Gandhi ki Jai ?
('78', 102, 6, 29, 217065) A. I have a small organization here.
('78', 102, 6, 30, 217102) No cheering or jai takes place here in Sevagram.
('78', 102, 6, 31, 217151) What you say does not sound nice.
('78', 102, 6, 32, 217185) It is a rude thing and also avoidable.
('78', 102, 6, 33, 217224) There is no need of praising in a family.
('78', 102, 6, 34, 217266) I regard my country as a big family.
('78', 102, 6, 35, 217303) I am not a

('78', 103, 0, 1, 217458) 104 THE COLLECTED WORKS OF MAHATMA GANDHI
('78', 103, 1, 2, 217500) mahatma but try to be a true servant.
('78', 103, 1, 3, 217538) God alone can testify to this.
('78', 103, 2, 4, 217569) Q. Should the truth of one man be considered as such by all ?
('78', 103, 3, 5, 217631) A. Truth is indefinable.
('78', 103, 3, 6, 217656) Truth is another form of God.
('78', 103, 3, 7, 217686) To serve GodTruth is satyagraha.
('78', 103, 3, 8, 217719) Truth is a relative term.
('78', 103, 3, 9, 217745) For worshipping liberty we require truth and non violence as our means.
('78', 103, 3, 10, 217817) We can reach or realize truth by non violence.
('78', 103, 4, 11, 217864) Q. Will you insist on charkha even after swaraj ?
('78', 103, 5, 12, 217914) A. As soon as swaraj is won, I cease to be your General.
('78', 103, 5, 13, 217971) You will then be called upon to elect your President.
('78', 103, 5, 14, 218025) After that you may or may not decide to spin.
('78', 103, 5, 15, 218071) But if I am alive then, I will insist on it.
('78', 103, 5, 16, 218116) Because you know we cannot give up the means by which we achieve our independence.
('78', 103, 5, 17, 218199) This is illustrated from the example of England, or Germany which never gave up arms (violent means) after she conquered her enemies.
('78', 103, 5, 18, 218333) The charkha is our ammunitionguns and artilleryand so we cannot afford to forsake it.
('78', 103, 5, 19, 218419) If you dont ply the charkha you cannot enlist in my army.
('78', 103, 5, 20, 218477) There is no compulsion.
('78', 103, 5, 21, 218501) But these are my conditions when you have selected me as your General.
('78', 103, 6, 22, 218572) Replying to a question whether several families devoting to spinning whole time could maintain themselves and educate their children, etc., Gandhiji said : I never say this, nor is it possible.
('78', 103, 6, 23, 218766) It is likely that we can maintain ourselves by khadi wages, but if all take to it, khaddar will be dearer.
('78', 103, 6, 24, 218873) It is not possible to provide work for all.
('78', 103, 6, 25, 218917) We should spin in spare time.
('78', 103, 6, 26, 218947) Khadi is our Annapurna 1 (supplier of food), i.e., we can purchase some things out of its earning.
('78', 103, 6, 27, 219046) If one crore people spin it will be great power and strength.
('78', 103, 7, 28, 219108) Answering a query whether he was opposed to machinery, Gandhiji said : We should not use machinery for producing things which we can produce without its aid and have got the capacity to do so.
('78', 103, 7, 29, 219301) As machinery makes you its slave, we want to be independent and self supporting; so we should not take the help of machinery when we can do without it.
('78', 103, 7, 30, 219453) We want to make our villages free and self sufficient and through them achieve our goallibertyand also protect it.
('78', 103, 7, 31, 219568) I have no interest in the machine nor [do] I oppose it.
('78', 103, 7, 32, 219624) If I can produce my things myself, I become my master and so need no machinery.

('78', 104, 1, 2, 219832) 104. QUESTION BOX
('78', 104, 2, 3, 219850) ARE YOU NOT MOVED ?
('78', 104, 3, 4, 219870) Q. You have written about Shri Jayaprakash Narayan.
('78', 104, 3, 5, 219922) 1 But are you not moved by his sentence ?
('78', 104, 3, 6, 219964) Is it not a call to arms ?
('78', 104, 3, 7, 219991) Will you even now wait till your impossible conditions are fulfilled ?
('78', 104, 4, 8, 220062) A. I fear I must wait till my conditions are fulfilled.
('78', 104, 4, 9, 220118) You should allow me to know more than you of the way in which satyagraha works.
('78', 104, 4, 10, 220198) Of course I am moved by the sentence pronounced against that brave co worker.
('78', 104, 4, 11, 220276) I wish I could move you as I am moved.
('78', 104, 4, 12, 220315) If you were, you would silently and more persistently spread the charkha cult by yourself spinning full heartedly and by taking its message to your neighbours.
('78', 104, 4, 13, 220475) Jayaprakash having gone to jail, has had his reward.
('78', 104, 4, 14, 220528) He had the inner urge.
('78', 104, 4, 15, 220551) He deserved the reward.
('78', 104, 4, 16, 220575) Believe me, it will produce its own effect.
('78', 104, 4, 17, 220619) If I become impatient and resort to precipitate action, the good done by Jayaprakashs imprisonment is likely to be undone partly or wholly.
('78', 104, 4, 18, 220759) I will not be party to producing an anarchical condition in India, nor will any good purpose be served by my inviting individuals to follow Jayaprakashs example and court imprisonment.
('78', 104, 4, 19, 220944) This jail going in satyagraha does not admit of arithmetical application.
('78', 104, 4, 20, 221018) Only one persons going may be most appropriate.
('78', 104, 4, 21, 221066) Suffice it to say that Jayaprakashs imprisonment is engaging my serious attention.
('78', 104, 4, 22, 221149) I wish all Congressmen would follow with redoubled zeal the task set before them.

('78', 104, 6, 27, 221673) A. Those who argue like you do not know the value of constructive work.
('78', 104, 6, 28, 221745) It is any day superior to civil disobedience.

('78', 104, 6, 33, 222091) A soldier in reserve is as good as one on active duty.
('78', 104, 6, 34, 222146) If the battle must come, I may say at once that my present plan is to disturb the constructive

('78', 105, 1, 5, 222708) KHADI AND POLITICS
('78', 105, 2, 6, 222727) Q. Are you not endangering the khadi movement by identifying it with the political programme, especially the civil disobedience part of it ?
('78', 105, 3, 7, 222868) A. Most certainly not.
('78', 105, 3, 8, 222891) I would be, if khadi was confined only to Congressmen or civil resisters.
('78', 105, 3, 9, 222965) Khadi is prescribed as national wear for all, whether Congressmen or others.
('78', 105, 3, 10, 223042) It is used even by some Englishmen, Americans and other Westerners.
('78', 105, 3, 11, 223110) Your objection, if it was valid, would apply even to communal unity, removal of untouchability and temperance.
('78', 105, 3, 12, 223221) These four have gained importance and momentum since they were incorporated in the Congress constructive programme.
('78', 105, 3, 13, 223337) They can all become illegal if they become mixed up with violence.
('78', 105, 3, 14, 223404) If they did become illegal, it would be found that the movements as such were not suppressed but the organizations masquerading under innocent labels were in reality covering violence.
('78', 105, 3, 15, 223589) CONFUSION OF THOUGHT
('78', 105, 4, 16, 223610) Q. You will be responsible for a gross injustice if you persist in giving to India a majority Government with only safeguards for the minorities.
('78', 105, 4, 17, 223756) The latter ought to have an effective part in the actual government of the country.
('78', 105, 5, 18, 223840) A. You have evidently confused majority rule with Hindu rule implying that the Hindu majority is irremovable.
('78', 105, 5, 19, 223950) The fact is that the majority in all the provinces is a mixed majority.
('78', 105, 5, 20, 224022) The parties are not Muslims and Hindus; they are Congressmen, independents, Muslim Leaguers, Muslim independents, labourites, etc.
('78', 105, 5, 21, 224153) The Congress majority everywhere is a mixed majority and could be better balanced if there was no tension.
('78', 105, 5, 22, 224260) The tension is a distemper.
('78', 105, 5, 23, 224288) A distemper can never be a permanent feature of any growing society which India is.
('78', 105, 5, 24, 224372) Whatever the outcome of the Muslim League demonstration and its claim, some day or other there will be a solution of the issues raised.
('78', 105, 5, 25, 224508) The outcome will never be pure Muslim or Hindu majorities in any single province.
('78', 105, 5, 26, 224590) The parties will be mixed and aligned according to different policies, unless democracy is crushed and autocracy reigns supreme in India as a whole or India is vivisected into two or more dead parts.
('78', 105, 6, 27, 224790) 1 Harijan Sevak Sangh 2 Hindustani Talimi Sangh
('78', 106, 0, 1, 224838) VOL. 78 : 23 FEBRUARY, 1940 15 JULY, 1940 107
('78', 106, 1, 2, 224884) If you have followed my argument, it must be clear to you that there will never be a denial of power to any party or group so far as the Congress is concerned.
('78', 106, 1, 3, 225044) Minorities are entitled to full protection of their rights, for so long as they have to divide power with others, they run the risk of their special rights being adulterated.
('78', 106, 1, 4, 225219) A DILEMMA
('78', 106, 2, 5, 225229) Q. My father is an employee in the S.I. Railway.
('78', 106, 2, 6, 225278) He has four children, all younger than I. He wants me to take an apprenticeship course.
('78', 106, 2, 7, 225366) If I take part in the coming civil disobedience struggle, he may be dismissed and the family will starve.
('78', 106, 2, 8, 225472) He says I can serve the nation by doing my share of constructive work.
('78', 106, 2, 9, 225543) What is your advice ?
('78', 106, 3, 10, 225565) A. Your father is right.
('78', 106, 3, 11, 225590) If you are the only bread winner, you cannot leave the family to its fate for the sake of taking part in civil disobedience.
('78', 106, 3, 12, 225715) You will certainly serve the nation quite as effectively as civil resisters if you zealously carry out the constructive programme.
('78', 106, 3, 13, 225846) VAIN REPETITIONS
('78', 106, 4, 14, 225863) Q. All agree that mechanical repetition of prayers is worse than useless.
('78', 106, 4, 15, 225937) It acts as an opiate on the soul.
('78', 106, 4, 16, 225971) I often wonder why you encourage repetition morning and evening of the eleven great vows as a matter of routine.
('78', 106, 4, 17, 226084) May not this have a dulling effect on the moral consciousness of our boys ?
('78', 106, 4, 18, 226160) Is there no better way of inculcating these vows ?
('78', 106, 5, 19, 226211) A. Repetitions when they are not mechanical produce marvellous results.
('78', 106, 5, 20, 226283) Thus I do not regard the rosary as a superstition.
('78', 106, 5, 21, 226334) It is an aid to the pacification of a wandering brain.
('78', 106, 5, 22, 226389) Daily repetition of the vows falls under a different category.
('78', 106, 5, 23, 226452) It is a daily reminder to the earnest seeker as he rises and retires that he is under the eleven vows which are to regulate his conduct.
('78', 106, 5, 24, 226589) No doubt it will lose its effect if a person repeats the vows mechanically under the delusion that the mere repetition will bring him merit.
('78', 106, 5, 25, 226730) You may ask : Why repeat the vows at all ? You know that you have taken them and are expected to observe them.
('78', 106, 5, 26, 226841) There is force in the argument.
('78', 106, 5, 27, 226873) But experience has shown that a deliberate repetition gives stimulus to the resolution.
('78', 106, 5, 28, 226961) Vows are to the weak mind and soul what tonics are to a weak body.
('78', 106, 5, 29, 227028) Just as a healthy body needs no tonics, a strong mind may retain its health without the need of vows and the daily reminder thereof.
('78', 106, 5, 30, 227161) An examination of the vows will, however, show that most of us are weak enough to need their assistance.
('78', 106, 5, 31, 227266) ON BEHALF OF DISABLED PEOPLE
('78', 106, 6, 32, 227295) Q. You stand for the poor and helpless.
('78', 106, 6, 33, 227335) Would you not include the
('78', 107, 0, 1, 227361) 108 THE COLLECTED WORKS OF MAHATMA GANDHI
('78', 107, 1, 2, 227403) providing of at least one daily meal to disabled beggars as an item of the daily
('78', 107, 2, 3, 227484) routine of a constructive worker  ?
('78', 107, 2, 4, 227520) A large number of the former are lepers.
('78', 107, 3, 5, 227561) There is not a city in India of any note without its quota of these hapless
('78', 107, 4, 6, 227637) creatures.
('78', 107, 4, 7, 227648) Their condition is deserving of your pity and consideration.
('78', 107, 5, 8, 227709) A. Valuable as this work undoubtedly is, it cannot become part of the constructive programme.
('78', 107, 5, 9, 227803) It is not every form of social relief that can be made part of the Congress constructive programme.
('78', 107, 5, 10, 227903) Such programme can only cover that part, the omission of which would make the attainment of swaraj through non violence impossible.
('78', 107, 5, 11, 228035) Who can deny that Hindu Muslim unity, removal of untouchability, temperance and the charkha are essential for achieving our object ?
('78', 107, 5, 12, 228168) My answer, however, does not mean that disabled humanity does not need any attention.
('78', 107, 5, 13, 228254) No man or woman, whether of the Congress or not, can be worth much if he or she neglects to do his or her part of social service in the widest sense of the term.
('78', 107, 5, 14, 228416) SEVAGRAM, April 1, 1940
('78', 107, 6, 15, 228440) Harijan, 6 4 1940
('78', 107, 7, 16, 228458) 105. A BAFFLING SITUATION
('78', 107, 8, 17, 228484) A question has been put to me :
('78', 107, 9, 18, 228516) Do you intend to start general civil disobedience although Quaid e Azam Jinnah has declared war against Hindus and has got the Muslim League to pass a resolution 1 favouring vivisection of India into two ?
('78', 107, 9, 19, 228722) If you do, what becomes of your formula that there is no swaraj without communal unity ?
('78', 107, 9, 20, 228811) I admit that the step taken by the Muslim League at Lahore creates a baffling situation.
('78', 107, 9, 21, 228900) But I do not regard it so baffling as to make civil disobedience an impossibility.
('78', 107, 9, 22, 228983) Supposing that the Congress is reduced to a hopeless minority, it will still be open to it, indeed it may be its duty, to resort to civil disobedience.
('78', 107, 9, 23, 229135) The struggle will not be against the majority, it will be against the foreign ruler.
('78', 107, 9, 24, 229220) If the struggle succeeds, the fruits thereof will be reaped as well by the Congress as by the opposing majority.
('78', 107, 9, 25, 229333) Let me, however, say in parenthesis that, until the conditions I have mentioned for starting civil disobedience are fulfilled, civil disobedience cannot be started in any case.
('78', 107, 9, 26, 229510) In the present instance there is nothing to prevent the imperial rulers from declaring their will in unequivocal terms that henceforth India will govern herself
('78', 107, 10, 27, 229671) 1 At its Lahore session in March; vide Appendix Resolution Passed by All India Muslim League, 23 3 1940.
('78', 108, 0, 1, 229776) VOL. 78 : 23 FEBRUARY, 1940 15 JULY, 1940 109
('78', 108, 1, 2, 229822) according to her own will, not that of the rulers as has happened hitherto.
('78', 108, 1, 3, 229898) Neither the Muslim League nor any other party can oppose such a declaration.
('78', 108, 1, 4, 229975) For the Muslims will be entitled to dictate their own terms.
('78', 108, 1, 5, 230036) Unless the rest of India wishes to engage in internal fratricide, the others will have to submit to Muslim dictation if the Muslims will resort to it.
('78', 108, 1, 6, 230187) I know no non violent method of compelling the obedience of eight crores of Muslims to the will of the rest of India, however powerful a majority the rest may represent.
('78', 108, 1, 7, 230357) The Muslims must have the same right of self determination that the rest of India has.
('78', 108, 1, 8, 230444) We are at present a joint family.
('78', 108, 1, 9, 230478) Any member may claim a division.
('78', 108, 1, 10, 230511) Thus, so far as I am concerned, my proposition that there is no swaraj without communal unity holds as good today as when I first enunciated it in 1919. But civil disobedience stands on a different footing.
('78', 108, 1, 11, 230718) It is open even to one single person to offer it, if he feels the call.
('78', 108, 1, 12, 230790) It will not be offered for the Congress alone or for any particular group.
('78', 108, 1, 13, 230865) Whatever benefit accrues from it will belong to the whole of India.
('78', 108, 1, 14, 230933) The injury, if there is any, will belong only to the civil disobedience party.
('78', 108, 1, 15, 231012) But I do not believe that Muslims, when it comes to a matter of actual decision, will ever want vivisection.
('78', 108, 1, 16, 231121) Their good sense will prevent them.
('78', 108, 1, 17, 231157) Their self interest will deter them.
('78', 108, 1, 18, 231194) Their religion will forbid the obvious suicide which the partition would mean.
('78', 108, 1, 19, 231273) The two nations theory is an untruth.
('78', 108, 1, 20, 231311) The vast majority of Muslims of India are converts to Islam or are descendants of converts.
('78', 108, 1, 21, 231403) They did not become a separate nation as soon as they became converts.
('78', 108, 1, 22, 231474) A Bengali Muslim speaks the same tongue that a Bengali Hindu does, eats the same food, has the same amusements as his Hindu neighbour.
('78', 108, 1, 23, 231609) They dress alike.
('78', 108, 1, 24, 231627) I have often found it difficult to distinguish by outward sign between a Bengali Hindu and a Bengali Muslim.
('78', 108, 1, 25, 231736) The same phenomenon is observable more or less in the South among the poor who constitute the masses of India.
('78', 108, 1, 26, 231847) When I first met the late Sir Ali Imam I did not know that he was not a Hindu.
('78', 108, 1, 27, 231926) His speech, his dress, his manners, his food were the same as of the majority of the Hindus in whose midst I found him.
('78', 108, 1, 28, 232046) His name alone betrayed him.
('78', 108, 1, 29, 232075) Not even that with Quaid e Azam Jinnah.
('78', 108, 1, 30, 232115) For his name could be that of any Hindu.
('78', 108, 1, 31, 232156) When I first met him, I did not know that he was a Muslim.
('78', 108, 1, 32, 232215) I came to know his religion when I had his full name given to me.
('78', 108, 1, 33, 232281) His nationality was written in his face and manner.
('78', 108, 1, 34, 232333) The reader will be surprised to know that for days, if not months, I used to think of the late Vithalbhai Patel as a Muslim as he used to sport a beard and a Turkish cap.
('78', 108, 1, 35, 232504) The Hindu law of inheritance governs many
('78', 109, 0, 1, 232546) 110 THE COLLECTED WORKS OF MAHATMA GANDHI
('78', 109, 1, 2, 232588) Muslim groups.
('78', 109, 1, 3, 232603) Sir Mohammed Iqbal used to speak with pride of his Brahmanical descent.
('78', 109, 1, 4, 232675) Iqbal and Kitchlew are names common to Hindus and Muslims.
('78', 109, 1, 5, 232734) Hindus and Muslims of India are not two nations.
('78', 109, 1, 6, 232783) Those whom God has made one, man will never be able to divide.
('78', 109, 1, 7, 232846) And is Islam such an exclusive religion as Quaid e Azam would have it ?
('78', 109, 1, 8, 232918) Is there nothing in common between Islam and Hinduism or any other religion ?
('78', 109, 1, 9, 232996) Or is Islam merely an enemy of Hinduism ?
('78', 109, 1, 10, 233038) Were the Ali Brothers and their associates wrong when they hugged Hindus as blood brothers and saw so much in common between the two ?
('78', 109, 1, 11, 233173) I am not now thinking of individual Hindus who may have disillusioned the Muslim friends.
('78', 109, 1, 12, 233263) Quaid e Azam has, however, raised a fundamental issue.
('78', 109, 1, 13, 233318) This is his thesis 1 :
('78', 109, 2, 14, 233341) It is extremely difficult to appreciate why our Hindu friends fail to understand the real nature of Islam and Hinduism.
('78', 109, 2, 15, 233461) They are not religions in the strict sense of the word, but are, in fact, different and distinct social orders, and it is a dream that the Hindus and Muslims can ever evolve a common nationality.
('78', 109, 2, 16, 233657) This misconception of one Indian nation has gone far beyond the limits and is the cause of most of our troubles and will lead India to destruction if we fail to revise our notions in time.
('78', 109, 3, 17, 233846) The Hindus and Muslims have two different religious philosophies, social customs, literatures.
('78', 109, 3, 18, 233941) They neither intermarry, nor dine together, and indeed, they belong to two different civilizations which are based mainly on conflicting ideas and conceptions.
('78', 109, 3, 19, 234101) Their aspects on life and of life are different.
('78', 109, 3, 20, 234150) It is quite clear that Hindus and Mussalmans derive their inspiration from different sources of history.
('78', 109, 3, 21, 234255) They have different epics, their heroes are different, and they have different episodes.
('78', 109, 3, 22, 234344) Very often the hero of one is a foe of the other and, likewise, their victories and defeats overlap.
('78', 109, 3, 23, 234445) To yoke together two such nations under a single State, one as a numerical minority and the other as majority, must lead to growing discontent and final destruction of any fabric that may be so built up for the government of such a State.
('78', 109, 3, 24, 234684) He does not say some Hindus are bad; he says Hindus as such have nothing in common with Muslims.
('78', 109, 3, 25, 234781) I make bold to say that he and those who think like him are rendering no service to Islam; they are misinterpreting the message inherent in the very word Islam.
('78', 109, 3, 26, 234942) I say this because I feel deeply hurt over what is now going on in the name of the Muslim League.
('78', 109, 3, 27, 235040) I should be failing in my duty, if I did not warn the Muslims of India against the untruth that is being propagated amongst them.
('78', 109, 3, 28, 235170) This warning is a duty because I have faithfully served them in their hour of need and because Hindu Muslim unity has been and is my lifes mission.
('78', 109, 3, 29, 235318) SEVAGRAM, April 1, 1940
('78', 109, 4, 30, 235342) Harijan, 6 4 1940

('78', 110, 0, 1, 235413) VOL. 78 : 23 FEBRUARY, 1940 15 JULY, 1940 111
('78', 110, 1, 2, 235459) 106. AN UNJUDICIAL DICTUM 1
('78', 110, 2, 3, 235487) A correspondent sends me a Press cutting containing a report of an Allahabad judgement of two English judges sitting as appellate court.
('78', 110, 2, 4, 235624) In delivering their judgment allowing the appeal their Lordships are reported to have said :
('78', 110, 3, 5, 235717) The case is unsatisfactory because we have no less than five persons
('78', 110, 4, 6, 235786) who were in effect, if their evidence can be relied upon, eye witnesses, and
('78', 110, 5, 7, 235863) yet, having regard to the slight value placed upon truth in this country, we
('78', 110, 6, 8, 235940) have seriously to apply our minds as to whether they can be believed.
('78', 110, 6, 9, 236010) This is an extraordinary pronouncement from a bench of judges.
('78', 110, 6, 10, 236073) What legal basis had these two judges for the sweeping statement made by them as to the character of a whole nation ?
('78', 110, 6, 11, 236191) The inference is that in other countries a higher value is placed upon truth.
('78', 110, 6, 12, 236269) Now if this was a universally accepted proposition, perhaps the judges would have been justified in taking legal notice of it.
('78', 110, 6, 13, 236396) There is, however, not only no such acceptance but experienced observers have testified that, on the whole, greater value is put upon truth in India than elsewhere.
('78', 110, 6, 14, 236561) But no judge should be influenced one way or the other by such observations as have no judicial value.
('78', 110, 6, 15, 236664) I would go further and say that such observations ought not to be made by any responsible person, even on political platforms.
('78', 110, 6, 16, 236791) They can never be proved.
('78', 110, 6, 17, 236817) But when they are made by judges they vitiate their judgments and may lead to miscarriage of justice.
('78', 110, 6, 18, 236919) Be it noted that the Allahabad judges have made use of their bias in coming to their decision and have thus proved their incapacity to hold responsible posts.
('78', 110, 6, 19, 237078) The case in which the observation was made affected poor people.
('78', 110, 6, 20, 237143) But the fact that only poor persons were involved makes it all the more necessary to take public notice of the judges strictures.
('78', 110, 6, 21, 237273) Who knows in how many cases this bias of theirs has resulted in defeating justice ?
('78', 110, 6, 22, 237357) SEVAGRAM, April 2, 1940
('78', 110, 7, 23, 237381) Harijan, 4 5 1940
('78', 110, 8, 24, 237399) 1 Though written on April 2, this was published only on May 4; vide Letter to Sri Prakasa, 11 4 1940.
