('78', 252, 6, 8, 493045) SEGAON, WARDHA, May 26, 1940
('78', 252, 7, 9, 493074) DEAR LORD LINLITHGOW, Many thanks for your letter of 19th instant, Enclosed herewith you will find copied of the wires that have passed between Sir Sikan dar and myself.
('78', 252, 7, 10, 493244) 1 My [wire] represents only my personal position.
('78', 252, 7, 11, 493294) I feel that so long as Britain refuses to make an unquivocal declaration, her moral position must remain doubtful.
('78', 252, 7, 12, 493409) But my object in writing this letter is not to ventilate my grievances.
('78', 252, 7, 13, 493481) It is to place before you my reaction to the war situation.
('78', 252, 7, 14, 493541) The latest development seems to be most serious.
('78', 252, 7, 15, 493590) Want of truthful news is tantalizing.
('78', 252, 7, 16, 493628) I suppose it is inevitable.
('78', 252, 7, 17, 493656) But assuming that things are as black as they appear to be for the Allied cause, is it not time to sue for peace for the sake of humanity?
('78', 252, 7, 18, 493795) I do not believe Herr Hitler to be as bad as he is portrayed.
('78', 252, 7, 19, 493857) He might even have been a friendly power as he may still be.
('78', 252, 7, 20, 493918) It is due to suffering humanity that this mad slaughter should stop.
('78', 252, 7, 21, 493987) If there is anything in my proposition and if the British Cabinet desire it, I am prepared to go to Germany or anywhere required to plead for peace not for this interest or that but for the good of mankind.
('78', 252, 7, 22, 494194) This may be a visionarys idea.
('78', 252, 7, 23, 494225) But as your friend I owe it to pass it to you.
('78', 252, 7, 24, 494272) Perchance it may be wisdom more than a vision.
('78', 252, 8, 25, 494319) 1 Vide Telegram to Sikandar Hyat Khan, 25 5 1940

('78', 254, 1, 2, 496419) 293. KERALA CONGRESS 1
('78', 254, 2, 3, 496442) Mian iftikharuddin after his visit to Kerala reported to me that the differences between rival groups that were hampering real progress in Kerala had been settled.
('78', 254, 2, 4, 496606) I was happy to have the report.
('78', 254, 2, 5, 496638) But letters since received from Kerala go to show that the settlement was superficial.
('78', 254, 2, 6, 496725) I have before me a long resolution passed by the Kerala Provincial Congress Committee which condemns almost all my acts and writings, ridicules the constructive programme, and yet to fulfil the letter of the Congress law half heartedly endorses the con gress resolution.
('78', 254, 2, 7, 496996) I suggest to the Kerala Congressmen who are respon sible for the resolution that this is neither good soldiership nor sports manship.
('78', 254, 2, 8, 497130) The letter killeth, the spirit giveth life.
('78', 254, 2, 9, 497174) Congressmen should understand the spirit of the resolution and carry it out.
('78', 254, 2, 10, 497251) They will put life into me the themselves.
('78', 254, 2, 11, 497294) If they cannot, it will be brave and hono urable to resist in a dignified manner the present leadership and pro gramme.
('78', 254, 2, 12, 497414) The resolution before me merely confounds the people to whom it is addressed.
('78', 254, 2, 13, 497492) I hope that the leaders of the majority group in Kerala will realize their mistake and retrace their steps.
('78', 254, 2, 14, 497600) But whether they do so or not, the minority who have faith in the programme should quietly pursue it and by their solid work impress the people with their sincerity.

('78', 255, 5, 11, 498921) 295. NOT YET
('78', 255, 6, 12, 498934) The reader will find in another column Dr. Ram Manohar Lohias plea for immediate civil disobedience, I endorse his prescri ption for ensuring world peace.
('78', 255, 6, 13, 499089) For enforcing the acceptance of his prescription he would have immediate civil disobedience.
('78', 255, 6, 14, 499182) Here I must join issue.
('78', 255, 6, 15, 499206) If Dr. Lohia subscribes to my conception of the working of non violence, he will at once admit that the present is no atmosph ere for influencing the Britisher in the right direction through civil disobedience.
('78', 255, 6, 16, 499417) Dr. Lohia agrees that the British Government should not be embarrassed.
('78', 255, 6, 17, 499489) I fear that any step towards direct action is bound to cause them embarrassment.
('78', 255, 6, 18, 499570) If I start now, The whole purpose of civil disobedience will be defeated.
('78', 255, 6, 19, 499644) I would unhesitatingly declare civil disobedience if the country was demonstrably non violent and disciplined.
('78', 255, 6, 20, 499755) But unfortunately we have many groups outside the Congress who believe in neither non violence nor civil disobedience.
('78', 255, 6, 21, 499874) In the Congress itself there are all shades of opinion about the efficacy of non violence.
('78', 255, 6, 22, 499965) Congressmen who believe in the application of non violence for the defence of India can be counted on the finger tips.
('78', 255, 6, 23, 500084) Though we have made great strides towards non violence, we have not arrived at a stage when we can hope to be unconquerable.
('78', 255, 6, 24, 500209) Any false step at the present time may end in the loss of the great moral prestige the Congress has gained.
('78', 255, 6, 25, 500317) We have sufficiently demonstrated that the Congress has done with
('78', 256, 0, 1, 500383) VOL,78 : 23 FEBRUARY, 1940 15 JULY, 1940 257
('78', 256, 1, 2, 500428) imperialism, and that it will not be satisfied with anything less than the unfettered right of self determination.
('78', 256, 1, 3, 500543) If the British Government will not suo motu declare India as a free country having the right to determine her own status and constitution, I am of opinion that we should wait till the heat of the battle in the heart of the Allied countries subsides and the future is clearer than it is.
('78', 256, 1, 4, 500830) We do not seek our independence out of Britains ruin.
('78', 256, 1, 5, 500884) That is not the way of non violence.
('78', 256, 1, 6, 500921) But we shall have many opportunities of demonstrating our power if we really have it.
('78', 256, 1, 7, 501007) We can make it felt at the time of peace which must come whichever party wins.
('78', 256, 1, 8, 501086) Have we got the power?
('78', 256, 1, 9, 501109) Is India at ease without having up to date arms?
('78', 256, 1, 10, 501158) Does not India feel helpless without the ability to defend herself against aggression?
('78', 256, 1, 11, 501245) Do even Congressmen feel secure?
('78', 256, 1, 12, 501278) Or do they not feel that for some years to come at any rate India will have to be helped by Britain or some other Power?
('78', 256, 1, 13, 501399) If such is our unfortunate plight, how can we hope to make an effective contribution towards an honourable peace after the war or universal disarmament?
('78', 256, 1, 14, 501552) We must first demonstrate the efficacy of non violence of the strong in our own country before we can expect to influence the tremendously armed Powers of the West.
('78', 256, 1, 15, 501717) But many Congressmen are playing at non violence.
('78', 256, 1, 16, 501767) They think in terms of civil disobedience anyhow meaning the filling of jails.
('78', 256, 1, 17, 501846) This is a childish interpretation of the great force that civil disobedience is.
('78', 256, 1, 18, 501927) I must continue to repeat, even though it may cause nausea, that prison going without the backing of honest constructive effort and goodwill in the heart for the wrongdoer is violence and therefore forbidden in satyagraha.
('78', 256, 1, 19, 502150) Force generated by non violence is infinitely greater than the force of all the arms invented by mans ingenuity.
('78', 256, 1, 20, 502263) Non violence, therefore, is the decisive factor in civil disobedience.
('78', 256, 1, 21, 502334) At this the most critical moment in Indias history, I will not play with the force whose hidden possibilities I have been humbly trying to explore now for nearly half a century.
('78', 256, 1, 22, 502512) Fortunately in the last resort I have myself to fall back upon.
('78', 256, 1, 23, 502576) I have been told that people cannot be non violence overnight.
('78', 256, 1, 24, 502639) I have never contended they can.
('78', 256, 1, 25, 502672) But I have held that by proper training they can be, if they have the will.
('78', 256, 1, 26, 502748) Active non violence is necessary for those who will offer civil disobedience, but the will and proper training are enough for the people to co operate with those who are chosen for civil disobedience, The constructive work prescribed by the Congress is the proper
('78', 257, 0, 1, 503012) 258 THE COLLECTED WORKS OF MAHATMA GANDHI
('78', 257, 1, 2, 503054) training.
('78', 257, 1, 3, 503064) Given the preparation, the congress will make perhaps the most effective contribution towards ending the war in the right way.
('78', 257, 1, 4, 503191) Disarmament of India though compulsory in origin, if it is voluntarily adopted by the nation as a virtue and if India makes a declaration that she will not defend herself with arms, can materially influence the European situation.
('78', 257, 1, 5, 503422) Those therefore, who wish to see India realize her destiny through non violence should devote every ounce of their energy towards the fulfilment of the constructive programme in right earnest without any thought of civil disobedience.

('78', 257, 3, 8, 503698) 296. QUESTION BOX
('78', 257, 4, 9, 503716) WHOLE OF SPARE TIME
('78', 257, 5, 10, 503736) Q. You say an active satyagrahi should devote the whole of his spare time to
('78', 257, 6, 11, 503813) constructive work.
('78', 257, 6, 12, 503832) What is you conception of spare time?
('78', 257, 7, 13, 503870) A. Every minute that is not required for my necessary private work would be spare time.
('78', 257, 7, 14, 503958) A merchant whose whole time is occupied in making moneynothing inherently wrong in it, if it is honestly made and equally honestly spentnaturally has no spare time.
('78', 257, 7, 15, 504123) He cannot become an active satyagrahi.
('78', 257, 7, 16, 504162) An active satyagrahi will give the least time to his private work.
('78', 257, 7, 17, 504229) The balance is his spare time.
('78', 257, 7, 18, 504260) For an active satyagrahi time is more than money.
('78', 257, 7, 19, 504310) He should therefore be able to give a good account of every minute.
('78', 257, 7, 20, 504378) In these matters the ultimate judge is oneself.
('78', 257, 7, 21, 504426) HOW TO USE VACATION
('78', 257, 8, 22, 504446) Q. What can students do during vacation?
('78', 257, 8, 23, 504487) They do not want to study and would get tired of constant spinning.
('78', 257, 9, 24, 504555) A. If they get tired of spinning, It shows that they have not understood its life giving property and its intrinsic fascination.
('78', 257, 9, 25, 504684) What is the difficulty in understanding that every yard spun adds to the national wealth?
('78', 257, 9, 26, 504774) A yard of yarn is not much, but as it is the easiest form of labour it can be easily multiplied.
('78', 257, 9, 27, 504871) Thus the potential value of spinning is very great.
('78', 257, 9, 28, 504923) Students are expected to understand the mechanism of the charkha and keep it in good order.
('78', 257, 9, 29, 505015) Those who do so, will find a peculiar fascination in spinning.
('78', 257, 9, 30, 505078) I refuse, therefore, to
('78', 258, 0, 1, 505102) VOL,78 : 23 FEBRUARY, 1940 15 JULY, 1940 259
('78', 258, 1, 2, 505147) suggest any other occupation.
('78', 258, 1, 3, 505177) But of course spinning may give place to more pressing work I mean more pressing in point of time.
('78', 258, 1, 4, 505276) Their help may be required in putting the neighbouring villages in a good sanitary condition and in attending to the sick or in educating Harijan children, etc.
('78', 258, 1, 5, 505437) HONEST DOUBT
('78', 258, 2, 6, 505450) Q. Some of us belong to that section of Congress workers who are not firmly of the opinion that the charkha is no good and has to be discarded along with your leadership at the earliest possible date.
('78', 258, 2, 7, 505651) Nor do we belong to that happy band of your followers who have an unshakable faith in the political, economical and spiritual mission of the charkha.
('78', 258, 2, 8, 505801) We believe in khadi at any rate in the present circumstances of our country.
('78', 258, 2, 9, 505878) But we cannot truthfully say that we understand the necessity of ourselves spinning.
('78', 258, 2, 10, 505963) We are city people, and there is very little scope for the charkha here as a bread giver.
('78', 258, 2, 11, 506053) However, we are anxious to be enrolled as satyagrahis.
('78', 258, 2, 12, 506108) We can promise that we shall conscientiously spin as required by you, but we are not in a position to promise that faith in it which you desire.
('78', 258, 2, 13, 506253) It is possible that as we ply the charkha the faith may come.
('78', 258, 2, 14, 506315) But, for the present, it is as we have stated.
('78', 258, 2, 15, 506362) Can we honestly sign the satyagraha pledge?
('78', 258, 3, 16, 506406) A. Of course you can be enrolled.
('78', 258, 3, 17, 506440) All those who spin do not do so because of the bread giving property of the wheel.
('78', 258, 3, 18, 506523) Many spin for sacrifice, to set a good example, and to create the spinning atmosphere.
('78', 258, 3, 19, 506610) TEST FOR ALL MEMBERS
('78', 258, 4, 20, 506631) Q. I am one of the secretaries of a Congress committee.
('78', 258, 4, 21, 506687) I have a feeling that some of those who have signed the pledge are not carrying it outparticularly the clause about spinning.
('78', 258, 4, 22, 506813) Can we put to them the question whether they spin or not?
('78', 258, 4, 23, 506871) And, if we feel that their answers are evasive or untrue, is it part of our duty to hold an enquiry into the matter?
('78', 258, 4, 24, 506988) Some of us feel that we must accept their word, and not be too searching.
('78', 258, 5, 25, 507062) A. As secretaries it is your duty to devise rules so that there would be an automatic test for all members, not merely for doubtful ones, spinning or not spinning.
('78', 258, 5, 26, 507226) One test will be that the members deliver to a depot the yarn they spin.
('78', 258, 5, 27, 507299) Every member is expected to keep a daily record of his output.
('78', 258, 5, 28, 507362) But a nagging inquiry should undoubtedly be avoided.
('78', 258, 5, 29, 507415) RECRUITMENT v.
('78', 258, 5, 30, 507430) CONSTRUCTIVE WORK
('78', 258, 6, 31, 507448) Q. Which would you preferwhether we should devote all our time to recruiting satyagrahis or set about organizing constructive work with the satyagrahis that we already have on hand?
('78', 259, 0, 1, 507630) 260 THE COLLECTED WORKS OF MAHATMA GANDHI
('78', 259, 1, 2, 507672) A. Of course you will organize constructive work with those you have.
('78', 259, 1, 3, 507742) This will by itself attract recruits.
('78', 259, 1, 4, 507780) MEN AND WOMEN
('78', 259, 2, 5, 507794) Q. I should like to know whether you would approve of men and women satyagrahis mixing promiscuously and working together, or whether they should be organized into separate units with a clear delimitation of the field of each.
('78', 259, 2, 6, 508021) My exper ience is that the former must lead, as it has led, to a lot indiscipline and corruption.
('78', 259, 2, 7, 508119) If you agree with me, what rules would you suggest to combat the potential evil?
('78', 259, 3, 8, 508200) A. I should like to have separate units.
('78', 259, 3, 9, 508241) Women have more than enough work amongst women.
('78', 259, 3, 10, 508289) Our womenfolk are terribly neglected, and hundreds of intelligent women workers of sterling honesty are required to work among them.
('78', 259, 3, 11, 508422) On principle too I believe I the two sexes functioning separately.
('78', 259, 3, 12, 508489) But I would lay down no hard and fast rules.
('78', 259, 3, 13, 508534) Good sense must govern the relations between the two.
('78', 259, 3, 14, 508588) There should be no barrier erected between the two.
('78', 259, 3, 15, 508640) Their mutual behaviour should be natural and spontaneous.
('78', 259, 3, 16, 508698) KHADI AND ADVERTISEMENT
('78', 259, 4, 17, 508722) Q. Do you approve of the policy that is being following by the Charkha Sangh in some places, of pushing the sale of khadi by the use, for instance, of loud speakers, popular gramophone records and the like?
('78', 259, 4, 18, 508929) Dont you think that advertising apart from supplying the necessary information about the marketing of khadi is undignified and incompatible with the khadi spirit?
('78', 259, 5, 19, 509092) A. I see nothing wrong or undignified in making use of loud speakers, etc., to popularize khadi.
('78', 259, 5, 20, 509189) Through these means too one does no more than give the prices and other information about khadi.
('78', 259, 5, 21, 509286) It will be certainly undignified and worse if false information is given whether with or without the use of loud speakers and the like.
('78', 259, 5, 22, 509422) WILL TO LIVE
('78', 259, 6, 23, 509435) Q. It has been said that the will to live is irrational, being born of a deluded attachment to life.
('78', 259, 6, 24, 509536) Why is then suicide a sin?
('78', 259, 7, 25, 509563) A. The will to live is not irrational.
('78', 259, 7, 26, 509602) It is also natural.
('78', 259, 7, 27, 509622) Attachment to life is not a delusion, it is very real.
('78', 259, 7, 28, 509677) Above all, life has a purpose.
('78', 259, 7, 29, 509708) To seek to defeat that purpose is a sin.
('78', 259, 7, 30, 509749) Therefore suicide is very rightly held to be a sin.
('78', 259, 7, 31, 509801) SEVAGRAM, May 28, 1940
('78', 259, 8, 32, 509824) Harijan, 1 6 1940
('78', 260, 0, 1, 509842) VOL,78 : 23 FEBRUARY, 1940 15 JULY, 1940 261
('78', 260, 1, 2, 509887) 297. BIDAR
('78', 260, 2, 3, 509898) Five gentlemen from Hyderabad Deccan have sent me an offer to which there is a long preface containing all kinds of innuendoes against me.
('78', 260, 2, 4, 510037) I need not burden these columns with their preface.
('78', 260, 2, 5, 510089) If the adjectives used against me are deserved, they will stand whether I advertise them or not.
('78', 260, 2, 6, 510186) If they are due to the ignorance of the authors, as I know they are, it is well for me not to notice them.
('78', 260, 2, 7, 510293) Here is the offer:
('78', 260, 3, 8, 510312) Will Gandhiji agree that the whole Samajist movement which led to this and
('78', 260, 4, 9, 510387) many other incidents should be thoroughly investigated by a Commission, whose
('78', 260, 5, 10, 510465) head should be a Parsi or a Christian, with an equal number of Hindus and Muslim
('78', 260, 6, 11, 510546) members?
('78', 260, 6, 12, 510555) We are even prepared if Gandhiji agrees to arbitrate himself, as we are
('78', 260, 7, 13, 510627) confident that the evidence with us will prove the case.
('78', 260, 7, 14, 510684) As a preliminary, congenial
('78', 260, 8, 15, 510712) atmosphere to conduct such an enquiry is all that is required.
('78', 260, 8, 16, 510775) We, therefore, suggest
('78', 260, 9, 17, 510798) that Gandhiji will not hesitate to demand that all the cases pending in court in
('78', 260, 10, 18, 510879) connection with the Bidar conflagration should be withdrawn.
('78', 260, 10, 19, 510940) We do not, of course,
('78', 260, 11, 20, 510962) plead that cases of a serious nature, as that of murder or cases having no connection
('78', 260, 12, 21, 511048) with the conflagration, should be included.
('78', 260, 13, 22, 511092) Gandhiji is also of opinion that compensation should be given to those who
('78', 260, 14, 23, 511167) have suffered.
('78', 260, 14, 24, 511182) 1 we fail to understand the logic behind it.
('78', 260, 14, 25, 511227) If communal incidents are to
('78', 260, 15, 26, 511256) be compensated, what would be the burden on the Exchequer?
('78', 260, 15, 27, 511315) Would the riots not be
('78', 260, 16, 28, 511338) employed as a weapon to bring financial failure upon the Government?
('78', 260, 16, 29, 511407) Is it a remedy
('78', 260, 17, 30, 511422) or an encouragement?
('78', 260, 17, 31, 511443) It is a novel demand indeed.
('78', 260, 17, 32, 511472) We hope Gandhiji will accept our
('78', 260, 18, 33, 511505) I have no difficulty about accepting the offer unreservedly.
('78', 260, 18, 34, 511566) If the writers succeed in persuading the Government of H. E. H. likewise to accept the offer, they will have established a precedent which may well be followed in all such cases.
('78', 260, 18, 35, 511745) Needless to say, if the court suggested by my correspondents comes into being, the composition and terms of reference will have to be by agreement.
('78', 260, 18, 36, 511893) I am asked to demand the withdrawal of the cases instituted against persons suspected of complicity.
('78', 260, 18, 37, 511994) They were not instituted at my instance, and I presume they will not be withdrawn on my demand.
('78', 260, 18, 38, 512090) But I should have no hesitation in approving of all withdrawals if the court of inquiry is appointed.
('78', 260, 18, 39, 512192) I assure my friends
('78', 260, 19, 40, 512212) 1 Vide : Wanton Destruction in Bidar 30 4 1940.

('78', 261, 1, 2, 512302) that I am interested in elucidation of truth, not in the punishment of the guilty.

('78', 261, 3, 12, 512863) 298. CURSE OF UNTOUCHABILITY
('78', 261, 4, 13, 512892) Several correspondents protest against my referring to the arguments advanced in favour of partition.
('78', 261, 4, 14, 512994) They say that Islam is not exclusive, and that it teaches universal brotherhood and toleration.
('78', 261, 4, 15, 513090) I have never denied this claim.
('78', 261, 4, 16, 513122) It was because of my knowledge of Islam that I felt grieved over the arguments which go to prove the contrary.
('78', 261, 4, 17, 513233) Almost every Muslim writing I take up nowadays contains disparagement of Hindus and Hinduism.
('78', 261, 4, 18, 513327) It cannot be otherwise if the case for partition is to be proved.
('78', 261, 4, 19, 513393) But my correspondents are angry when I point out the anomaly.
('78', 261, 4, 20, 513455) They say I have hastily come to the conclusion from isolated writings of unimportant Muslims.
('78', 261, 4, 21, 513549) Unfortu nately, the arguments referred to by me have proceeded from impor tant Muslims.
('78', 261, 4, 22, 513637) But where the writers score over me is in regard to Hindu untouchability.
('78', 261, 4, 23, 513711) They say in effect: You should be ashamed of bringing the charge of untouchability against the Muslim League.
('78', 261, 4, 24, 513821) First cast out the beam from the Hindu eye before you attempt to deal with the mote in the Muslim eye.
('78', 261, 4, 25, 513924) Has not the Hindu maintained for a thousand years complete boycott of Muslims?
('78', 261, 4, 26, 514003) He will not drink or eat with him.
('78', 261, 4, 27, 514038) He will not intermarry.
('78', 261, 4, 28, 514062) He will not even let his house to him.
('78', 261, 4, 29, 514101) Can you conceive a more effective isolation of a whole community that the Hindu has carried out?
('78', 261, 4, 30, 514198) Will it not be a just nemesis if the Muslim now turns round and pays you in your own coin?
('78', 262, 0, 1, 514289) VOL,78 : 23 FEBRUARY, 1940 15 JULY, 1940 263
('78', 262, 1, 2, 514334) I have admitted as much.
('78', 262, 1, 3, 514359) Whatever the Muslims do by way of retaliation will be richly deserved by Hindus.
('78', 262, 1, 4, 514440) My question was and is, should they do so?
('78', 262, 1, 5, 514483) Does it behove a great political party to play upon religious prejudices?
('78', 262, 1, 6, 514557) Whatever the Muslim League does or does not do, it behoves thoughtful Hindus to take note of the deserved taunt and purge Hinduism of its exclusiveness.
('78', 262, 1, 7, 514710) It will not be protected by artificial barriers which have no sanction in ancient Hinduism or reason.
('78', 262, 1, 8, 514812) Well did Maulana Abul Kalam Azad say the other day how sick he was of hearing the cry at railway stations of Hindu and Muslim tea or water.
('78', 262, 1, 9, 514952) I know this touch me notism is deeprooted in Hinduism as it is prac tised today.
('78', 262, 1, 10, 515033) But there is no reason why it should be tolerated by Con gressmen.
('78', 262, 1, 11, 515100) If they will be correct in their behaviour, they will pave the way for a radical transformation of Hindu society.
('78', 262, 1, 12, 515214) The message of anti untouchability does not end in merely touching the so called untouchables.
('78', 262, 1, 13, 515309) It has a much deeper meaning.
('78', 262, 1, 14, 515339) SEVAGRAM, May 28, 1940

('78', 276, 11, 27, 533479) That the Christian Missions have been working in Assam with the sole view to convert the Hill tribes to Christianity with the help of Government grants is very apparent from the Quinquennial Education Report of the Assam Government for the Year 1932 37 as submitted

('78', 277, 1, 3, 534114) In his review of the report he wrote in April 1938, p.
('78', 277, 1, 4, 534169) 63: The general policy at present is for Government to take over the responsibility for education from the Missions as early as possible.
('78', 277, 1, 5, 534307) While acknowledgement must be made of the debt owed to the Missions for their work as pioneers in the field of education, it must also be recognized that the Missions have interested themselves in education solely with the object of Christianizing the children.

('78', 281, 8, 24, 542395) PEACE IN SIROHI
('78', 281, 9, 25, 542411) Some time ago I had regretfully to comment on happenings in Sirohi.
('78', 281, 9, 26, 542479) 1 I am therefore happy to be able to note that there is now peace between the State and the people.
('78', 281, 9, 27, 542579) The credit may be equally divided between the State and the satyagrahis.
('78', 281, 9, 28, 542652) The satyagrahis were ably led by Acharya Gokulnhai who is a firm believer in the principles of satyagraha.
('78', 281, 9, 29, 542759) Let me hope that the relations between the two will daily become more and more cordial and that there never will be any cause for quarrel between the State and the people.
('78', 281, 9, 30, 542931) UNTOUCHABILITY
('78', 281, 10, 31, 542946) Shri T. S. Jadhav, President, District Local Board.
('78', 281, 10, 32, 542998) Sholapur, writes: 2
('78', 281, 11, 33, 543018) 1 Vide Notes, 18 9 1939
('78', 281, 12, 34, 543042) 2 Only extracts from the letter are reproduced here.
('78', 282, 0, 1, 543095) VOL.78 : 23FEBRUARY, 1940 JULY, 1940 283
('78', 282, 1, 2, 543136) I have been incessantly making efforts to five facilities to the Harijans especially with regard to their immediate needs in respect of water supply, education, etc.
('78', 282, 1, 3, 543302) The Congress Board has opened a good number of wells to the Harijans, and has also arranged to put up notices to that effect at these wells.
('78', 282, 1, 4, 543443) But it is a matter of regret that the Harijans are not inclined to take advantage of this facility for fear of being put to trouble by the touchables.
('78', 282, 1, 5, 543594) During my tours in the district, I have been requesting the latter to allow Harijans the exercise of this legitimate right.
('78', 282, 1, 6, 543718) I go myself to a public well in a village after a public meeting with some Harijans, touchable Congress workers, and a few other prominent villagers, and all of us drink water from the well after it has been drawn by a Harijan.
('78', 282, 1, 7, 543946) But it is found that the touchables who take part in this function are often boycotted and the Harijans visited with various kinds of troubles by the touchables who do not participate in the function .
('78', 282, 1, 8, 544148) Can you suggest anything more?
('78', 282, 1, 9, 544179) This certainly is good work.
('78', 282, 1, 10, 544208) Removal of untouchability is a question of double education, that of touchables as well as un touchables.
('78', 282, 1, 11, 544314) Touchables have to be taught patiently by precept and example that untouchability is a sin against God and humanity, and the untouchables that they should cease to fear the touchables and shed untouchability among themselves.
('78', 282, 1, 12, 544540) I know that that is very easily said.
('78', 282, 1, 13, 544578) But I have found nothing else.
('78', 282, 1, 14, 544609) Living in the midst of both, I know how hard the work is among both.
('78', 282, 1, 15, 544678) If Hinduism is to live, the work has to be done, however difficult and even hopeless it may appear to be.
('78', 282, 1, 16, 544784) HAND MADE PAPER
('78', 282, 2, 17, 544800) Shri Jadhav further writes:
('78', 282, 3, 18, 544828) Secondly, I have been using hand made paper for the use of the District Local Board office since the advent of the Congress Party in the Board.
('78', 282, 3, 19, 544972) Use of mill paper or foreign paper is absolutely discontinued, and as far as my information goes, ours is the only Board in Maharashtra which has been using hand made paper for its office use to the complete exclusion of other paper.
('78', 282, 3, 20, 545206) I had sent a circular letter to the Presidents of the other Boards in Maharashtra, requesting them to follow this practice of our Board, and I am glad a few of them have agreed to do so.
('78', 282, 3, 21, 545393) But I think it will be better if you yourself request the presidents of the Congress Boards in India to use hand made paper for their office purposes.
('78', 282, 3, 22, 545544) This can well be done through the columns of Harijan, and I am sure it will go a long way in bringing into
('78', 282, 4, 23, 545651) reality your dream of revival of village industries as far as writing paper is concerned.
('78', 283, 0, 1, 545741) THE COLLECTED WORKS OF MAHATMA GANDHI 284
('78', 283, 1, 2, 545783) I gladly support this plea.
('78', 283, 1, 3, 545811) Indeed I have often enough said the same thing in these columns.
('78', 283, 1, 4, 545876) Shri Jadhavs example should be copied by all Local Boards not merely in the matter of hand made paper but all village products.
('78', 283, 1, 5, 546004) With a little care, the Boards should be able to manage these things within their budget.
('78', 283, 1, 6, 546094) I should also suggest that the Boards have these things manufactured in the villages under their jurisdiction as far as possible.
('78', 283, 1, 7, 546224) The purpose of the village movement will be defeated if this central fact is not borne in mind.
('78', 283, 1, 8, 546320) Decentra lization is the beauty of the movement as also the key to its success.

('78', 283, 13, 32, 547518) COMILLA MUNICIPALITY AND HARIJANS
('78', 283, 14, 33, 547552) Shri Thakkar Bapa sends the following interesting account of what the Comilla Municipality has done and proposes doing for Harijans:
('78', 283, 15, 34, 547685) 1. 15 days leave with full pay in a year, and maternity leave to female sweepers.
('78', 283, 16, 35, 547767) 2. A free primary school in their quarters.
('78', 283, 17, 36, 547811) 3. Corrugated iron roof huts for (a) Naga sweepers at a cost of Rs. 1,500 and (b) for other sweepers at a cost of Rs. 3,000. Some Nagas in East Bengal and Surma valley have taken to scavenging work.
('78', 284, 0, 1, 548010) VOL.78 : 23FEBRUARY, 1940 JULY, 1940 285
('78', 284, 1, 2, 548051) 4. The sweepers have been relieved almost wholly from their indebt edness, which totalled about Rs. 3,000 and on which they were paying an interest of three annas per rupee per month or 225 per cent!
('78', 284, 2, 3, 548251) The Commissioners intend to adopt the following further measures for them:
('78', 284, 3, 4, 548326) 1. To start a co operative store, proposal for which has been sent to the Registrar of Co operative Societies for registration.
('78', 284, 4, 5, 548454) 2. Sweepers have to be weaned form their drinking habit, which it is known is a difficult task.
('78', 284, 5, 6, 548550) 3. The insanitary drain behind the sweepers quarters requires to be made into a pucca drain.
('78', 284, 6, 7, 548643) 4. Providing kitchens for sweepers quarters, as at present they have to cook and sleep in the same room.
('78', 284, 6, 8, 548748) This reminds one of what the Ahmedabad Municipality has done in the matter.
('78', 284, 6, 9, 548824) The latter is possibly more thorough.
('78', 284, 6, 10, 548862) But that does not in any way detract from the merit of what the Comilla Munici pality has done.
('78', 284, 6, 11, 548958) It deserves warm congratulation.
('78', 284, 6, 12, 548991) Let us hope that the prospective reforms too will be carried out in good time.

('78', 284, 7, 14, 549111) 341. HINDU MUSLIM
('78', 284, 8, 15, 549129) Thus writes a Khan Bahadur from Delhi:
('78', 284, 9, 16, 549168) This is a letter for the Question Box in Harijan.
('78', 284, 10, 17, 549218) In your article in Harijan of April 6 1 , you observe as follows:
('78', 284, 11, 18, 549284) I should be failing in my duty, if I did not warn the Mussalmans against the untruth that is being propagated amongst them.
('78', 284, 11, 19, 549408) This warning is a duty because I have faithfully served them in their hour of need and because Hindu Muslim unity has been and is my lifes mission.
('78', 284, 12, 20, 549556) I will request you to consider the Hindu Muslim problem from our point of view.
('78', 284, 12, 21, 549636) The stumbling block to any negotiations for a settlement of the communal question has been the refusal of the Congress to recognize the All India Muslim League as the authoritative and sole representative body of the Indian Mussalmans.
('78', 284, 12, 22, 549872) The Congress claims that it speaks for whole India and that it has on its rolls a considerable number of Mussalmans, the very fact that the Congress has made several attempts to come to terms with Mr. Jinnah
('78', 284, 13, 23, 550080) 1 Vide Baffling Situation, 28 11 1939
('78', 285, 0, 1, 550118) THE COLLECTED WORKS OF MAHATMA GANDHI 286
('78', 285, 1, 2, 550160) shows that it is not fully confident of its representative character, as far as the Mussalmans are concerned.
('78', 285, 1, 3, 550270) But do not honestly feel that the Congress Mussalmans are the real stumbling block in the way of Hindu Muslim unity, and that it is for their sake that the Congress is not making a serious effort to solve the problem?
('78', 285, 1, 4, 550488) Believe me, they are a lazy lot who are enjoying their present position because they are in the Congress.
('78', 285, 2, 5, 550594) You know what the Muslim masses did to your President 1 in Calcutta where for years he had been leading Id prayer.
('78', 285, 2, 6, 550709) You also know that they have no courage to address a Muslim meeting to convert the Mussalmans to their point of view.
('78', 285, 2, 7, 550827) You blame the British for creating Princes, Moderates and Khan Bahadurs like me.
('78', 285, 2, 8, 550908) You blame the British for trying to create another Ulster in India.
('78', 285, 2, 9, 550976) Has not the Congress created equivalent Moderates and Khan Bahadurs in Azads, Asaf Alis and Kidwais?
('78', 285, 2, 10, 551077) Is not the action of the Congress tantamount to creation of a Muslim Ulster?
('78', 285, 3, 11, 551154) You may cite the case of Mr. Asaf Ali succeeding in the municipal elections of Delhi.
('78', 285, 3, 12, 551240) I may inform you that but for a division in the Provincial League and bad handling of the situation Mr. Asaf Ali would never have won the election.
('78', 285, 3, 13, 551388) I may inform you that even as it is, when Delhi Congress wanted to contest the municipal elections as a party, Mr. Asaf Ali , who is now a member of the Congress Working Committee, had declined to take a Congress ticket.
('78', 285, 3, 14, 551609) Therefore, Mr. Asaf Alis election was not a test case; and if you pardon my saying so, even now let Mr. Asaf Ali reseek election on a Congress ticket, and I am confident that any League candidate would defeat him.
('78', 285, 3, 15, 551823) You will thus realize that your being baffled by the Lahore resolution 2 of the League is not justified when Mussalmans have ceased to trust in your lifes
('78', 285, 4, 16, 551978) mission regarding Hindu Muslim unity.
('78', 285, 4, 17, 552016) On the other hand they are convinced that the sole aim of the Congress, for the last ten years at least, has been to divide and rule the Mussalmans.
('78', 285, 4, 18, 552165) I will beg of you to reconsider your attitude towards the League.
('78', 285, 4, 19, 552231) Please dont trust the Congressite Mussalmans, for they are not only the Mir Jafars amongst us, but the enemies of Hindu muslim accord and Indias freedom.
('78', 285, 4, 20, 552385) Just now I am inundated with letters of protest from Muslim friends.
('78', 285, 4, 21, 552454) Most writers do not argue.
('78', 285, 4, 22, 552481) They five themselves satisfaction by abusing.
('78', 285, 4, 23, 552527) Pyarelal, who opens and deals with the daily post, gives me only those letters which he thinks I should see.
('78', 285, 4, 24, 552636) Of these I take notice of those I think I must.
('78', 285, 4, 25, 552684) In some cases I answer them privately.
('78', 285, 5, 26, 552723) 1 Abul Kalam Azad 2 Demanding a separate Muslim State
('78', 286, 0, 1, 552777) VOL.78 : 23FEBRUARY, 1940 JULY, 1940 287
('78', 286, 1, 2, 552818) Therefore correspondents who never receive acknowledgement either through Harijan or the post should know the reason.
('78', 286, 1, 3, 552936) There are some Muslim letters of sympathy too.
('78', 286, 1, 4, 552983) One of them says that in his house he has to listen to wildest criticism of me.
('78', 286, 1, 5, 553063) No adjective is too bad to use.
('78', 286, 1, 6, 553095) Much criticism he knows to be false.
('78', 286, 1, 7, 553132) What is he to do, he asks.
('78', 286, 1, 8, 553159) Is he to leave the house, or is he to engage in endless disputation and convert his house into a bear garden?
('78', 286, 1, 9, 553269) I have advised my correspondent neither to leave the house nor to engage in a discussion.
('78', 286, 1, 10, 553359) If he can, he may put in mild word when he knows that a manifest falsehood is being uttered and believed.

('78', 286, 1, 12, 553671) If I was at one time acclaimed as their greatest friend and suffered the praise, I must suffer too to be described as an enemy.

('78', 287, 1, 15, 556229) It would be a bad day for India if the Congress could be proved to have mean motives.
('78', 287, 1, 16, 556315) Is it mean to woo Muslim opinion by the fairest means imaginable?
('78', 287, 1, 17, 556381) Rightly or wrongly the Con gress does not believe in watertight compartments on a communal basis.
('78', 287, 1, 18, 556479) If religion is allowed to be, as it is, a personal concern and a matter between God and man, there are many dominating common factors between the two which will compel common life and common action.
('78', 287, 1, 19, 556678) Religions are not for separating men from one another, they are meant to bind them.
('78', 287, 1, 20, 556762) It is a misfortune that today they are so distorted that they have become a potent cause of strife and mutual slaughter.
('78', 287, 1, 21, 556883) It will perhaps now be clear why I can have no concern with Asaf Ali Sahebs case.
('78', 287, 1, 22, 556965) I would grant that he would be beaten in a contest between him and a Leaguer.
('78', 287, 1, 23, 557043) Let it be further granted that such will be the case in the majority of such contests.
('78', 287, 1, 24, 557130) It will in no way weaken my position.
('78', 287, 1, 25, 557168) It will prove the superior organizing ability of the League and its popularity among the Muslims.
('78', 287, 1, 26, 557266) I have not doubted either.
('78', 287, 1, 27, 557293) My case is incredibly simple.
('78', 287, 1, 28, 557323) I must not be called upon to make any admissions about the status of the League before thinking of unity through the League.
('78', 287, 1, 29, 557448) I must not be disloyal to the Muslim nationalists however insignificant they may be considered to be.
('78', 287, 1, 30, 557550) I ask the Khan Bahadur, the writer of the letter under discussion, to exert his influence to bring the two communities together.

('78', 288, 1, 2, 557761) 342. PANIC
('78', 288, 2, 3, 557772) Nowadays one reads about panic in the Press and hears more than one reads.
('78', 288, 2, 4, 557847) One friend writes:
('78', 288, 3, 5, 557866) You sitting in lonely Sevagram can have no notion of the talks and whispers going on in the busy cities.
('78', 288, 3, 6, 557971) Panic has seized them.
('78', 288, 3, 7, 557994) Panic is the most demoralizing state anyone can be in.
('78', 288, 3, 8, 558049) There never is any cause for panic.
('78', 288, 3, 9, 558085) One must keep heart whatever happens.
('78', 288, 3, 10, 558123) War is an unmitigated evil.
('78', 288, 3, 11, 558151) But it certainly does one good thing, it drives away fear and brings bravery to the surface.
('78', 288, 3, 12, 558244) Several million lives must have been already lost between the Allies and the Germans.
('78', 288, 3, 13, 558330) They have been wasting blood like water.
('78', 288, 3, 14, 558371) Old men, women both old and young , and children in Britain and France are living in the midst of imminent death.
('78', 288, 3, 15, 558485) But there is no panic there.
('78', 288, 3, 16, 558514) If they were seized by it panic would be an enemy more dreadful than German bullets, bombs and poison gas.
('78', 288, 3, 17, 558621) let us learn from these suffering nations of the West an banish panic from our midst.
('78', 288, 3, 18, 558707) And in India there is no cause whatsoever for panic.
('78', 288, 3, 19, 558760) Britain will die hard and heroically even if she has to.
('78', 288, 3, 20, 558817) We may hear of reverses, but we will not hear of demoralization.
('78', 288, 3, 21, 558882) Whatever happens will happen in an orderly manner.
('78', 288, 3, 22, 558933) Therefore I would say to those who lend a listening ear to me: Go on with your work or business in the usual way.
('78', 288, 3, 23, 559047) Do not withdraw your deposits or make haste to turn your paper into cash.
('78', 288, 3, 24, 559121) If you are cautious, you will run no new risks.
('78', 288, 3, 25, 559169) Your metal buried underground of in your treasure chests need not be considered safer than in banks or in paper if anarchy overtakes us.
('78', 288, 3, 26, 559306) There is risk just now in everything.
('78', 288, 3, 27, 559344) It is best to be as you are in such a condition.
('78', 288, 3, 28, 559393) Your stead iness, if it is multiplied, will steady the market.
('78', 288, 3, 29, 559456) It will be the best preventive against anarchy.
('78', 288, 3, 30, 559504) There is undoubtedly fear of goondaism in such times.
('78', 288, 3, 31, 559558) You must be prepared to cope with it yourself.
('78', 288, 3, 32, 559605) Goondas flourish only in the midst of timid people.
('78', 288, 3, 33, 559657) They will have no quarter from people who can defend themselves violently or non violently.
('78', 288, 3, 34, 559749) Non violent defence presupposes recklessness about ones life and property.
('78', 288, 3, 35, 559824) If it is persisted in, it will in the end be a sure cure for goondaism.
('78', 288, 3, 36, 559896) But non violence cannot be learnt in a day.
('78', 288, 3, 37, 559940) It requires practice.
('78', 288, 3, 38, 559962) You can commence to learn it from now.
('78', 288, 3, 39, 560001) You must be ready to lose your life or property or both.
('78', 288, 3, 40, 560058) But that is implied in the art of non violence.
('78', 288, 3, 41, 560106) If you do not know how to defend yourself either way, the Government will not be able to save you in spite of its best effort.
('78', 288, 3, 42, 560233) No Government, however powerful it may be, can without the active
('78', 289, 0, 1, 560299) THE COLLECTED WORKS OF MAHATMA GANDHI 290
('78', 289, 1, 2, 560341) co operation of the people.
('78', 289, 1, 3, 560369) If even God only helps those who will help themselves, how much more true it must be of perishable Governments!
('78', 289, 1, 4, 560481) Do not lose nerve and think that tomorrow there will be no Government and it will be all anarchy.
('78', 289, 1, 5, 560579) You can be the Government now, and you certainly will be in the contingency you contemplate or you will perish.
('78', 289, 1, 6, 560691) SEVAGRAM, June 4, 1940 Harijan, 8 6 1940
('78', 289, 2, 7, 560732) 343. QUESTION BOX
('78', 289, 3, 8, 560750) IF YOU HAVE COURAGE
('78', 289, 4, 9, 560770) Q. My mother died last month.
('78', 289, 4, 10, 560800) I have for a long time been following the practice of eating food cooked by Harijan.
('78', 289, 4, 11, 560885) The orthodox did not like it, but they tolerated my practice.
('78', 289, 4, 12, 560947) Three years ago I accepted an invitation for a funeral dinner given by a Muslim friend on the occasion of his mothers demise.
('78', 289, 4, 13, 561073) Now my mother is dead.
('78', 289, 4, 14, 561096) My community have now boycotted all functions in connection with my mothers demise.
('78', 289, 4, 15, 561180) What am I to do?
('78', 289, 5, 16, 561197) A. If you have courage, you will let the castemen do their worst, but you will befriend your Muslim friend at all costs and dine with him as often as is necessary.
('78', 289, 5, 17, 561361) Such boycotts should not be feared at all.
('78', 289, 5, 18, 561404) BENEVOLENT DICTATORSHIP
('78', 289, 6, 19, 561428) Q. When the rich become callous and selfish and the evil continues unche cked, a revolution of the masses with all the attendant horrors inevitably results.
('78', 289, 6, 20, 561585) Since life, as you have put it, is often a choice between evils, wont you, in view of the lesson which the history of revolutions inculcates, welcome the rise of a benevolent dictatorship which would with the minimum use of force soak the rich, give justice to the poor, and thereby serve both?
('78', 289, 7, 21, 561880) A. I cannot accept benevolent or any other dictatorship.
('78', 289, 7, 22, 561937) Neither will the rich vanish nor will the poor be protected.
('78', 289, 7, 23, 561998) Some rich men will certainly be killed out and some poor men will be spoon fed.
('78', 289, 7, 24, 562078) As a class the rich will remain, and the poor also, in spite of dictator ship labelled benevolent.
('78', 289, 7, 25, 562177) The real remedy is non violent democracy, other wise spelt true education of all.
('78', 289, 7, 26, 562259) The rich should be taught the doctrine of stewardship and the poor that of self help.
('78', 289, 7, 27, 562345) A SOCIAL NUISANCE
('78', 289, 8, 28, 562363) Q. The beggar problem has become a social nuisance everywhere, especially in the cities.
('78', 289, 8, 29, 562452) India can ill bear the burden of this army of drones.
('78', 289, 8, 30, 562506) They use self torture,
('78', 290, 0, 1, 562529) VOL.78 : 23FEBRUARY, 1940 JULY, 1940 291
('78', 290, 1, 2, 562570) sometimes even threats and menaces, to work upon the sympathy and fear of our simple folk and extract alms from them.
('78', 290, 1, 3, 562688) Some of them have in this way accumulated a secret hoard and lead a life of vice and immorality.
('78', 290, 1, 4, 562785) What solution would you suggest for this problem?
('78', 290, 2, 5, 562835) A. Begging is an age old institution in India.
('78', 290, 2, 6, 562882) It was not always a nuisance.
('78', 290, 2, 7, 562912) It was not always a profession.
('78', 290, 2, 8, 562944) Now it has become a profession to which cheats have taken.
('78', 290, 2, 9, 563003) No person who is capable of working for his bread should be allowed to beg.
('78', 290, 2, 10, 563079) The way to deal with the problem will be to penalize those who give alms to professional beggars.
('78', 290, 2, 11, 563177) Of course begging itself by the able bodied should be pena lized.
('78', 290, 2, 12, 563243) But this reform is possible only when municipalities conduct factories where they will feed people against work.
('78', 290, 2, 13, 563356) The Salvation Army people are or were experts in this class of work.
('78', 290, 2, 14, 563425) They had opened a match factory in London in which any person who came found work and food.
('78', 290, 2, 15, 563517) What I have, however, suggused is an imme diate palliative.
('78', 290, 2, 16, 563577) The real remedy lies in discovering the root cause and dealing with it.
('78', 290, 2, 17, 563649) This means equalizing the economic condition of the people.
('78', 290, 2, 18, 563709) The present extremes have to be dealt with as a serious social disease.
('78', 290, 2, 19, 563781) In a healthy society concentration of riches in a few people and unemployment among millions is a great social crime or disease which needs to be remedied.
('78', 290, 3, 20, 563937) ECONOMIC INDEPENDENCE OF WOMEN
('78', 290, 4, 21, 563968) Q. Some people oppose a modification of laws relating to the right of a
('78', 290, 5, 22, 564040) married woman to own property on the ground that economic independence of woman
('78', 290, 6, 23, 564120) would lead to the spread of immorality among women and disruption of domestic life.
('78', 290, 7, 24, 564204) What is your attitude on the question.
('78', 290, 8, 25, 564243) A. I would answer the question by a counter question: Has not independence of man and his holding property led to the spread of immorality among men?
('78', 290, 8, 26, 564393) If you answer yes then let it be so also with women.
('78', 290, 8, 27, 564446) And when women have rights of ownership and the rest like men, it would be found that the enjoyment of such rights is not responsible for their vices or their virtues.
('78', 290, 8, 28, 564614) Morality which depends upon the helplessness of a man or woman has not much to recom mend it.
('78', 290, 8, 29, 564708) Morality is rooted in the purity of our hearts.
('78', 290, 9, 30, 564756) A TEMPLE TRUSTEE'S POSER
('78', 290, 10, 31, 564781) Q. I am a member of the A. I. C. C. Personally I neither believe in nor observe taboos relating to untouchability.
('78', 290, 10, 32, 564896) But I am trustee of a temple built by my ancestors who were thoroughly orthodox in their religious outlook.
('78', 290, 10, 33, 565004) I feel that it
('78', 291, 0, 1, 565019) THE COLLECTED WORKS OF MAHATMA GANDHI 292
('78', 291, 1, 2, 565061) would be a breach of trust to throw it open to Harijans.
('78', 291, 1, 3, 565118) Would that stand in the way of my signing the satyagraha pledge?
('78', 291, 2, 4, 565183) A. It would stand very much in the way of your signing the pledge.
('78', 291, 2, 5, 565250) It would be no breach of trust if the law allows you to open the temple.
('78', 291, 2, 6, 565323) The condition was immoral as we have now discovered and hence invalid.
('78', 291, 2, 7, 565394) UNCERTIFIELD KHADI
('78', 291, 3, 8, 565413) Q. You say that a person buying or using mill cloth cannot take the satyagraha pledge.
('78', 291, 3, 9, 565500) Can a person using, buying or dealing in uncertified khadi take the pledge or hold offices in Congress committee?
('78', 291, 3, 10, 565614) Is a person or an association other than the A. I. S. A. entitled to certify khadi dealers?
('78', 291, 4, 11, 565706) A. Certainly not, I repeatedly said that a person who uses or deals in uncertified khadi damages khadi and directly exploits the spinners and weavers whose lot the A. I. S. A. is striving to improve.

('78', 291, 4, 13, 565995) No person or institution other than the A. I. S. A. can issue the required certificates.
('78', 291, 4, 14, 566084) STUDENTS DIFFICULTY
('78', 291, 5, 15, 566104) Q. We are students in Poona.

('78', 291, 6, 23, 566490) A. You are doing good work.

('78', 291, 6, 27, 566837) I do not rule out court proceedings, but they will be evidence of want of enough ahimsa in you.
('78', 291, 6, 28, 566933) But you cannot go against your nature.
('78', 291, 6, 29, 566972) If you do not evoke response from them to your wooing, your work must not be held up because of the obstruction referred to by you.

('78', 291, 6, 31, 567153) But you must make all honest effort before you go to law.

('78', 307, 5, 18, 589288) 376. NON VIOLENCE AND KHADI
('78', 307, 6, 19, 589316) Mr. Richard Gregg, one of whose letters I reproduced some time ago, has sent another which I share with the reader: 2
('78', 307, 7, 20, 589434) All these months since I wrote you last I have been wrestling intellectually with the problem of discipline for non violence and of non violent persuasion and conversion, and how to state them and their solution in Western terminology.
('78', 307, 7, 21, 589670) As I think I wrote you, I am working on a book about those two aspects of satyagraha, to supplement my Power of non violence .
('78', 307, 7, 22, 589797) My effort is to try to get the Western world to realize the validity
('78', 307, 8, 23, 589866) and practicalness of your entire programme.
('78', 307, 9, 24, 589910) I have been so glad that during these last few months you have insisted so strongly that the Congress must earnestly and loyally take up the khadi programme before you will lead them in any open struggle of satyagraha against the Government.
('78', 307, 9, 25, 590152) I see clear as crystal the necessity for that.
('78', 307, 9, 26, 590199) You are absolutely right.
('78', 307, 10, 27, 590225) Despite the war and all its horrors, I am optimistic as to the future of
('78', 307, 11, 28, 590298) non violence.
('78', 307, 11, 29, 590312) Never before in all the history of the world have there been so
('78', 307, 12, 30, 590376) many believers in non violence , both in absolute number and also relatively
('78', 307, 13, 31, 590453) to the rest of the population.
('78', 307, 13, 32, 590484) Never before has that belief been found in all
('78', 307, 14, 33, 590531) groups, classes, religions and occupations.
('78', 307, 14, 34, 590575) Never before have so many
('78', 307, 15, 35, 590601) 1 From the reference to the fast which Gandhiji was to undertake from the 8th 2 Only extracts of the letter are reproduced here
('78', 308, 0, 1, 590729) VOL.78 : 23FEBRUARY, 1940 JULY, 1940 309
('78', 308, 1, 2, 590770) prominent statesmen stated earnestly, clearly and publicly the folly, futility
('78', 308, 2, 3, 590849) and appalling results of war and violence.
('78', 308, 2, 4, 590892) Never have so many military men
('78', 308, 3, 5, 590924) been so unsure of the validity and ultimate effectiveness of their method.
('78', 308, 4, 6, 590999) All during the past two years and rapidly since the war began, the organized peace movements of Britain and America have grown.
('78', 308, 5, 7, 591127) Up to March 9th 26,681 men among the military conscripts of Great Britain had been officially registered as conscientious objectors to war, as compared with about 16,000 for the entire four years of the war of 1914 18. .
('78', 308, 5, 8, 591348) In the five or six calls of conscripts in Great Britain between last June and March of this year the percentage of C. O.s ranged from 1.6 to 2.2%.
('78', 308, 5, 9, 591495) This may be interestingly compared with the estimate that in all countries the really effective or decisive work of government is done by not over 2% of the population.
('78', 308, 6, 10, 591664) If it be true that mans desire for order and significance in his life are stronger than fear and hate, the only programme which can produce order and significance to life will have non violence as its back bone .
('78', 308, 6, 11, 591877) This places a great responsibility upon the believers in non violence .
('78', 308, 6, 12, 591949) It will require of them great thought, discipline and social invention.
('78', 308, 6, 13, 592021) I consider your khadi programme one of those great social inventions.
('78', 308, 6, 14, 592091) The Wardha education scheme is another.
('78', 308, 7, 15, 592131) I am writing a letter to J. C. Kumarappa about some items that that I have long wanted to discuss with him, a set of suggestions for possible experiment by the A. I. V. I. A. One is to try hanging small mosquito net bags containing napthaline moth balls in village wells a yard or more above the level of the water.
('78', 308, 7, 16, 592447) The odour of the moth ball is much disliked by mosquitoes, and as it is slightly heavier than unscented air it would lie like a blanket over the surface of the water the keep the mosquitoes from laying their eggs in the water, without harming the water or killing the mosquitoes.
('78', 308, 7, 17, 592727) Another application of the same idea would be planting certain water living aromatic herbs along the banks of village tanks and rivers, close to the waters edge.
('78', 308, 7, 18, 592889) Mosquitoes lay their eggs preferably in shallow water so that the
('78', 308, 8, 19, 592955) larvae can escape being eaten by small fishes.
('78', 308, 8, 20, 593002) If the right herbs, of a kind whose odour is repellent to mosquitoes, were thus planted and kept growing, it would seem likely to cut down the malaria in this way.
('78', 308, 8, 21, 593166) Anyhow I think these two experiments worth trying.
('78', 308, 8, 22, 593217) The mint family of herbs are known to be repellent to mosquitoes.
('78', 308, 8, 23, 593283) Mr. Gregg is a careful thinker.
('78', 308, 8, 24, 593315) He takes nothing for granted.
('78', 308, 8, 25, 593345) The last paragraph of his letter shows his practical nature.
('78', 308, 8, 26, 593406) But I know that no amount of logical thinking is going to establish the supremacy of non violence on earth.
('78', 308, 8, 27, 593514) The only thing that can do it is Indias
('78', 309, 0, 1, 593554) THE COLLECTED WORKS OF MAHATMA GANDHI 310
('78', 309, 1, 2, 593596) ability to demonstrate beyond doubt its efficacy in gaining and defending national freedom.

('78', 313, 5, 13, 599523) 386. QUESTION BOX
('78', 313, 6, 14, 599541) ARRESTS
('78', 313, 7, 15, 599549) Q. You must know that arrests after arrests are being made under the defence of India Act.
('78', 313, 7, 16, 599640) Now your favourite Dr. Lohia is taken up.
('78', 313, 7, 17, 599682) I suppose you still see no reason for civil disobedience even as a protest against these arrests.
('78', 313, 7, 18, 599780) Or maybe you think that these arrests are legitimate.
('78', 313, 8, 19, 599834) A. The question is apposite.
('78', 313, 8, 20, 599863) Dr. Lohia is no more my favourite than any other Congressman.
('78', 313, 8, 21, 599925) True he has come nearer to me than he was.
('78', 313, 8, 22, 599968) Every arrest evokes my mental protest.
('78', 313, 8, 23, 600007) But I am not in the habit of reducing all my thoughts to writing.
('78', 313, 8, 24, 600073) I believe that our thoughts too produce effects, though not known to us or to the world.
('78', 313, 8, 25, 600162) I felt that any public protest by me would be ineffective.
('78', 313, 8, 26, 600221) All things are legiti mate and illegitimate in war time.
('78', 313, 8, 27, 600278) I regard war itself as illegitimate.
('78', 313, 8, 28, 600315) Therefore all repression is bad from my standpoint.
('78', 313, 8, 29, 600367) But I have as yet no effective remedy against war.
('78', 313, 8, 30, 600418) Even, therefore, as I suffer war, I suffer these repressive acts of warmakers.
('78', 313, 8, 31, 600497) One strange thing about India is that, so far as I know, it is not the people who are likely to help the Nazis that are being put under restraint, but those who are patriots hungering for the freedom of the country.
('78', 313, 8, 32, 600713) In a free country they will be fighting against designs upon their country.
('78', 313, 8, 33, 600789) Here their chief fault is that they are lovers of their country and its freedom.
('78', 313, 8, 34, 600870) If the authorities have anything else against them, they should publish it.
('78', 313, 8, 35, 600946) Repression is on the increase.
('78', 313, 8, 36, 600977) They know that the Congress is the
('78', 314, 0, 1, 601012) VOL.78 : 23FEBRUARY, 1940 JULY, 1940 315
('78', 314, 1, 2, 601053) most powerful instrument for preventing violence.
('78', 314, 1, 3, 601103) The Congress has taken no step which might, in spite of its efforts to the contrary, result in violence.
('78', 314, 1, 4, 601208) It is therefore difficult to understand these acts of repres sion.
('78', 314, 1, 5, 601275) They seem to be part of a concerted plan, for they are prevalent in almost all provinces.
('78', 314, 1, 6, 601365) One reflection I put before Congressmen for what it is worth.
('78', 314, 1, 7, 601427) Imprisonment has no terror for them.
('78', 314, 1, 8, 601464) Civil disobe dience means certain imprisonment.
('78', 314, 1, 9, 601512) The difference is that in the one case it is courted, in the other it comes uninvited.
('78', 314, 1, 10, 601599) Therefore any step the Congress can take will be not to secure the discharge of the per sons arrested but to take wind out of the Government sails by offering more victims than they can take.
('78', 314, 1, 11, 601791) Therefore the question is whether the Congress should take that step or not.
('78', 314, 1, 12, 601868) INCONSISTENCY
('78', 314, 2, 13, 601882) Q. Recently you wrote: The present is no atmosphere for influencing the
('78', 314, 3, 14, 601954) Britisher in the right direction through civil disobedience. And in the same article 1
('78', 314, 4, 15, 602041) you said: I would unhesitatingly declare civil disobedience if he country was demonstrably non violent and disciplined." Now the question is, if the country is demonstrably non violent after some time, and the war continues for a long time, will you start civil disobedience?
('78', 314, 4, 16, 602317) And if you start it, will it not embarrass the Britisher?
('78', 314, 4, 17, 602375) Will you hesitate to start civil disobedience if the group outside the congress are not non violent?
('78', 314, 5, 18, 602476) A. If you will fill in the sentences left to be understood in my article, you will not find any inconsistency.
('78', 314, 5, 19, 602587) The present atmosphere means English unreadiness to put up with anything when the safety of English homes is at stake.
('78', 314, 5, 20, 602706) It also means our very incomplete non violence.
('78', 314, 5, 21, 602754) If we were completely and therefore demonstrably non violent, it would mean that the British themselves would recognize our non violence .
('78', 314, 5, 22, 602893) Any purely non violent step cannot embarrass them.
('78', 314, 5, 23, 602944) As a matter of fact, if our non violence was complete, we would have no internal differences, no friction in the Congress ranks, no friction with non Congressmen.
('78', 314, 5, 24, 603107) In that case there would be no occasion for civil disobedience at all.
('78', 314, 5, 25, 603178) I have said as much only recently in these columns.
('78', 314, 5, 26, 603230) I have put the same thing in another manner in the sentence quoted by you.
('78', 314, 5, 27, 603305) For a non violent step taken by a united nation will carry its own fruition without any bitterness.
('78', 314, 5, 28, 603405) Therefore I should be ready for action the moment the non violence of my dream is establish, no matter in what peril the British may find themselves.
('78', 314, 6, 29, 603555) 1 Vide Not Yet, 28 5 1940.
('78', 315, 0, 1, 603582) THE COLLECTED WORKS OF MAHATMA GANDHI 316
('78', 315, 1, 2, 603624) Indeed, if that non violence comes, it will not only save India but also save Britain and France.
('78', 315, 1, 3, 603722) But you will be on safe ground in saying that I wrote nonsense because I knew that the degree of non violence required by me was not forthcoming in my time.
('78', 315, 1, 4, 603879) I am an irrepres sible optimist.
('78', 315, 1, 5, 603912) No scientist starts his experiments with a faint heart.
('78', 315, 1, 6, 603968) I belong to the tribe of Columbus and Stevenson who hoped against hope in the face of heaviest odds.
('78', 315, 1, 7, 604069) The days of miracles are not gone.
('78', 315, 1, 8, 604104) They will abide so long as God abides.
('78', 315, 1, 9, 604143) Your second question is answ ered in the foregoing.
('78', 315, 1, 10, 604195) Of course in the picture here presented non Congress groups will also have accepted non violence .
('78', 315, 1, 11, 604294) But first things first.
('78', 315, 1, 12, 604318) Let the congress put its own house in order.
('78', 315, 1, 13, 604363) A WIDOWS DIFFICULTY
('78', 315, 2, 14, 604383) Q. I am a Bengali Brahmin widow.
('78', 315, 2, 15, 604416) Since my widowhood these 24 years I have observed strict rules about my food.
('78', 315, 2, 16, 604494) I have my separate widows kitchen and utensils even in my own family.
('78', 315, 2, 17, 604564) I believe in your ideal of truth and non violence , I am a habitual wearer of Khadi since 1930 and a regular spinner.
('78', 315, 2, 18, 604682) Our Mahila Samaj has established a Harijan school in a Harijan village in Dacca.
('78', 315, 2, 19, 604763) I go there and mix with the Harijans.
('78', 315, 2, 20, 604801) I mix freely with my Muslim sisters towards whom I have nothing but goodwill.
('78', 315, 2, 21, 604879) But I cannot interdine with Harijans or any other non Brahmin caste.
('78', 315, 2, 22, 604948) Now cant orthodox widows like me enlist as satyagrahis, passive and active?
('78', 315, 2, 23, 605024) A. According to the congress constitution you have a perfect right to be enlisted.
('78', 315, 2, 24, 605107) You can even enforce your right.
('78', 315, 2, 25, 605140) But since you ask me, I would dissuade you from being enlisted.
('78', 315, 2, 26, 605204) I know the pun ctilious way in which Bengali widows observe the rules custom has prescribed for them.
('78', 315, 2, 27, 605306) But widows who dedicate themselves to the countrys cause, and that in a non violent way, should have no scr uples in dining with anybody.
('78', 315, 2, 28, 605444) I do not believe that dining with people, no matter who they are, hinders spiritual progress.
('78', 315, 2, 29, 605538) It is the motive which is the deciding factor.
('78', 315, 2, 30, 605585) If a widow approaches every task in a spirit of service, it is well with her.
('78', 315, 2, 31, 605663) A widow may observe all the dining and other rules with meticulous care and yet not be a true widow if she is not of a pure heart.
('78', 315, 2, 32, 605794) You know as well as I do that outward obser vance of rules governing a society often covers hypocrites.
('78', 315, 2, 33, 605898) I would, therefore, advise you to disregard the restriction on inter dining and the like as a hindrance to spiritual and national progress and concen trate on cultivation of the heart.
('78', 315, 2, 34, 606083) In the satyagraha dal I should like to have not self satisfied persons but those who have used their reason and chosen a way of life that has commended itself to both head and heart.
('78', 315, 2, 35, 606266) SEVAGRAM, June 10, 1940 Harijan, 15 6 1940

('78', 318, 2, 3, 611330) TRIBUTE FROM SOUTH AFRICA The joint Hon.
('78', 318, 2, 4, 611371) Secretaries of the Natal Indian Association send me the following:
('78', 318, 3, 5, 611438) At a meeting of the Indian community held under the auspices of the Association, on the death of the Rev.
('78', 318, 3, 6, 611544) C. F. Andrews, the followings resolu tion was passed unanimously:
('78', 318, 4, 7, 611610) This meeting of the Indian community held under the auspices of the Natal Indian Association (with which are amalgamated the Natal Indian Congress and the colonial Born and Settler Indian Association) deeply mourns the death of the Rev.
('78', 318, 4, 8, 611847) C. F. Andrews, whose services in the cause of the South African Indians were outstanding and whose humanitarian appeals for the better treatment of Indians overseas have always received the ear of the Government and the attention of responsible European opinion.
('78', 318, 4, 9, 612110) This meeting records its deepest sympathy and conveys its condolence to his family, Mahatma Gandhi, Poet Tagore and to the Indian nation.
('78', 318, 5, 10, 612248) The meeting was attended by not only the members of the Indian community but also by leading Europeans including the Rt.
('78', 318, 5, 11, 612369) Archdeacon Harris, who, after offering prayers, spoke of the sterling qualities and the humanitarian spirit of Mr. C. F. Andrews.
('78', 318, 5, 12, 612499) The Indian community of South Africa have lost a friend and guide.
('78', 318, 5, 13, 612566) His services in the cause of our community in South Africa, his simplicity, his constant endeavours to bring about a better
('78', 318, 6, 14, 612690) understanding between the European and Indian communities, his constant thought for the poor, will always remain fresh in the minds of those of us who have had the pleasure of working with him.
('78', 318, 7, 15, 612884) We respectfully tender to you our condolences, for we know that in Mr. Andrews you have lost a trusted friend.

('78', 318, 7, 17, 613142) The original is in Hindustani:
('78', 318, 8, 18, 613173) In the Tariff of Revenue it has been laid down that no import duty should be charged on any kind of hand spun and hand woven cloth whether
('78', 318, 9, 19, 613312) 1 For an appeal for funds for the Deenabandhu Memorial signed by Gandhiji and some others, vide Appendix Deenabandhu Memorial, 1 6 1940.

('78', 319, 1, 2, 613491) cotton, woollen or silk.
('78', 319, 1, 3, 613516) It has come to our notice that with the increasing popularity of khadi, very often khadi made out of mill yarn is passed for genuine hand spun and hand woven khadi, free of customs duty.
('78', 319, 1, 4, 613703) This causes loss of revenue and nullifies the object of exempting the industry of hand spinning and hand weaving from duty.
('78', 319, 1, 5, 613827) It should be realized that hand spun and hand woven khadi only is to be exempted from customs duty.

('78', 319, 1, 27, 615489) A WALKING TOUR Shrimati G. Vishalakshi of Gokulam Harijan Colony of Madras writes:
('78', 319, 2, 28, 615572) Nine Harijan students of the Gokulam Harijan Colony taking their training in village welfare work propose to tour the villages on foot in the neighbouring district of Chinglepet.
('78', 319, 2, 29, 615751) In the course of their training in the Ashram they learn the cause of their backwardness and how to cure it by being self reliant.
('78', 319, 2, 30, 615882) They will study first hand the economic condition of the vil 
('78', 320, 0, 1, 615944) VOL.78 : 23FEBRUARY, 1940 JULY, 1940 321
('78', 320, 1, 2, 615985) lagers and what types of cottage industries could be taken up in a particular village.
('78', 320, 1, 3, 616072) They will teach habits of thrift, how savings could be pooled and how they can derive benefit by organizing themselves into co operative societies for such purposes as better living, agriculture, credit, and industries as mat making, hand loom weaving, etc.
('78', 320, 1, 4, 616330) The students who are trained for welfare work in the villages are expected to settle in villages and do welfare work without expecting any subsidy from Government or public bodies.
('78', 320, 1, 5, 616511) They will earn a living by the industries they have learnt like spinning, weaving, mat making, paper making and bee keeping.
('78', 320, 1, 6, 616636) As they tour in the villages they will also speak to the villagers about these cottage industries which they can take up as spare time work.
('78', 320, 1, 7, 616777) The party start from Madras on 1st June and will complete their tour on 30th June.
('78', 320, 1, 8, 616860) As all of them are Harijan they will visit cheries only unless invited to go the caste Hindu villages also.
('78', 320, 1, 9, 616968) They will depend for the daily food during their tour on the hospitality of the cheries
('78', 320, 2, 10, 617056) they visit.
('78', 320, 2, 11, 617068) I hope the tourists started on their tour on the 1st.
('78', 320, 2, 12, 617122) It is a good plan.
('78', 320, 2, 13, 617141) If the tour succeeds, it will be an example to copy.
('78', 320, 2, 14, 617194) If the tourists are of the right type, they will succeed.
('78', 320, 2, 15, 617252) They wont be a burden on the villagers, for they will make ample return for the hospitality they will receive from them.

('78', 322, 1, 2, 618939) 391. TWO PARTIES
('78', 322, 2, 3, 618956) Private and public appeals are being made to me to call all parties together and arrive at a common agreement, and then, they say, we shall get what we want from Great Britain.
('78', 322, 2, 4, 619133) These good friends for get one central fact.
('78', 322, 2, 5, 619178) The Congress, which professes to speak for India and wants unadulterated independence, cannot strike a common mea sure of agreement with those who do not.
('78', 322, 2, 6, 619333) To act otherwise would be to betray its trust.
('78', 322, 2, 7, 619380) In the nature of things, therefore, there can be no all parties conference unless all have a common purpose.
('78', 322, 2, 8, 619489) The British Government would not ask for a common agree ment if they recognized any one party to be strong enough to take delivery.
('78', 322, 2, 9, 619621) The Congress, it must be admitted, has not that strength today.
('78', 322, 2, 10, 619685) It has come to its present position in the face of opposition.
('78', 322, 2, 11, 619748) If it does not weaken and has enough patience, it will develop sufficient strength to take delivery.
('78', 322, 2, 12, 619849) It is an illusion created by ourselves that we must come to an agreement with all parties before we can make any progress.
('78', 322, 2, 13, 619972) There is only one democratic, elected political organization, i.e.
('78', 322, 2, 14, 620039) the Congress.
('78', 322, 2, 15, 620053) All the others are self appointed, or elected on a sec tional basis.
('78', 322, 2, 16, 620122) The Muslim League is an organization which, like the congress, is popularly elected.
('78', 322, 2, 17, 620207) But it is frankly communal and wants to divide India into two parts, one Hindu and the other Muslim.
('78', 322, 2, 18, 620308) I read an appeal by a Muslim Leaguer suggesting that the British Govern ment should come to terms with the Muslims and depend upon Mus lim aid.
('78', 322, 2, 19, 620452) That would be one way of settling the question, but also of perpetuating British rule.
('78', 322, 2, 20, 620539) The Hindu Mahasabha will no doubt want favoured treatment for Hindus including Hindu States.
('78', 322, 2, 21, 620632) Thus for the present purpose there are only two parties the Congress and those who side with the Congress, and the parties who do not.
('78', 322, 2, 22, 620767) Between the two there is no meeting ground without the one or the other surrendering its purpose.
('78', 322, 2, 23, 620865) The other parties must be pre sumed to be as constant in their purpose as the Congress claims to be in its.
('78', 322, 2, 24, 620973) Therefore there is a stalemate.
('78', 322, 2, 25, 621005) But the stalemate is only appa rent.
('78', 322, 2, 26, 621042) An agreement independently of evolving a common demand the Congress must seek and has always sought.
('78', 322, 2, 27, 621143) It is the process of con version.
('78', 322, 2, 28, 621177) Its non violence forbids the Congress from standing aloof and riding the high horse as the opponents say.
('78', 322, 2, 29, 621283) On the contrary, it has to woo all parties, disarm suspicion and create trust in its bona fides.
('78', 322, 2, 30, 621380) This it can only do when it has cleaned its own stables.
('78', 322, 2, 31, 621437) The process
('78', 323, 0, 1, 621449) THE COLLECTED WORKS OF MAHATMA GANDHI 324
('78', 323, 1, 2, 621491) may take time.
('78', 323, 1, 3, 621506) That time must be given.
('78', 323, 1, 4, 621531) It will be no waste.
('78', 323, 1, 5, 621552) But if the Congress loses hope and faith and comes to the conclusion that it must surrender its original position for the purpose of getting a com mon measure of agreement.
('78', 323, 1, 6, 621725) It will cease to be the power it is.
('78', 323, 1, 7, 621762) Today it is the sheet anchor of Indias hope and faith.
('78', 323, 1, 8, 621817) It will be well with it if it refuses to move away from its moorings, whether it is in a minority or a majority.
('78', 323, 1, 9, 621930) SEVAGRAM, June 11, 1940 Harijan, 15 6 1940

('78', 334, 0, 1, 636675) VOL.78 : 23FEBRUARY, 1940 JULY, 1940 335
('78', 334, 1, 2, 636716) have been reading C. F. Andrewss Christ in the Silence, and thinking very much of my dear friend who has entered into fuller life I dare not say died, for I have never felt him more living.
('78', 334, 1, 3, 636906) Knowing something of what your friendship meant to him and his ( I imagine) to you, I felt that I should like to tell you a little of our contact.
('78', 334, 1, 4, 637053) I met him not only here in south Africa but also in England and France, where we both spoke in connection with the Oxford Group movement.
('78', 334, 1, 5, 637191) He is godfather to my youngest son.
('78', 334, 1, 6, 637227) Mr. Andrews had the greatest of gifts love.
('78', 334, 1, 7, 637271) In its weakness, it is yet the strongest thing on earth terrible as an army with banners.
('78', 334, 1, 8, 637361) You have taught us that lesson.
('78', 334, 1, 9, 637393) I would rather be like Mr. Andrews than the Prime Minister of a great country.
('78', 334, 1, 10, 637472) He was the closest among all the people that I have ever met to what I imagine Jesus to have been.

('78', 334, 1, 12, 637602) He learned much from India, and much from yourself.
('78', 334, 1, 13, 637654) Those who were made humbler and better by knowing him will, like myself, want to thank you for helping to make him what he was.
('78', 334, 1, 14, 637782) The letter shows how great was the influence that Deenabandhu produced on those with whom he came in contact.
('78', 334, 1, 15, 637892) ADULT LITERACY The Gandhi Mission Society, Tiruvennainallur, send me their half yearly report of adult literacy work.
('78', 334, 1, 16, 638010) The total number of adults educated was 197. But the problem that really faces them is  how to enable the adults to retain the knowledge thus gained.
('78', 334, 2, 17, 638160) Nearly half the members who attended the class during the first session have approached the workers in charge to repeat the lessons.
('78', 334, 2, 18, 638293) In fact they had lapsed into illiteracy.
('78', 334, 2, 19, 638334) The workers are racking their brains to devise means to prevent this lapse.
('78', 334, 2, 20, 638410) The workers need not rack their brains at all.
('78', 334, 2, 21, 638457) The lapse is bound to occur after the short courses that are given.
('78', 334, 2, 22, 638525) The lapse can only be prevented by correlating the teaching to the villagers daily wants.
('78', 334, 2, 23, 638615) The dry knowledge of the three Rs is not even now, it can never be, a permanent part of the villagers life.
('78', 334, 2, 24, 638723) They must have knowledge given to them which they must use daily.
('78', 334, 2, 25, 638789) It must not be thrust upon them.
('78', 334, 2, 26, 638822) They should have the appetite for it.
('78', 334, 2, 27, 638860) What they have today is something they neither want nor appreciate.
('78', 334, 2, 28, 638928) Give the villagers village arithmetic, village geography, village history and the literary knowledge that they must have use daily, i.e., reading and writing letters, etc.
('78', 334, 2, 29, 639100) They will treasure such knowledge and pass on to the other stages.
('78', 334, 2, 30, 639167) They have no use for books which give them nothing of daily use.
