('78', 339, 4, 7, 646396) 422. SPINNING COMPETITION IN RAMGARH
('78', 339, 5, 8, 646433) During the Congress Week there was the usual spinning compe tition at the exhibition.
('78', 339, 5, 9, 646519) There were six tests coarse counts up to 10, medium up to 18, fine up to 30, very fine ranging from 44 to 158, spinning on the Magan Charkha, and last on the takli.
('78', 339, 5, 10, 646684) The examiners were Ramdev Babu of Bihar, Shri Nandlal Patel of the Khadi Karya laya, Ahmedabad, and Prabhudas Gandhi who was also the organizer.
('78', 339, 5, 11, 646829) From the table before me I see that the examination was as strict and thorough as it should have been.
('78', 339, 5, 12, 646932) In my opinion the competitors were neither as many as should have been nor from many provinces.
('78', 339, 5, 13, 647028) They were principally from Bihar and Gujarat, some from Maharashtra and U. P. There were cash prizes, the highest being Rs.15, and trophies for the winning institutions.
('78', 339, 5, 14, 647198) It is worthy of note that in the very fine yarn competition there were many women.
('78', 339, 5, 15, 647281) The finest spinner was Devsundari Devi of Madhubani.
('78', 339, 5, 16, 647334) Her count was 158. The highest speed on the wheel was 618 yards per hour of 10 counts.
('78', 339, 5, 17, 647421) The highest on the Magan charkha was 925 yards of 15 counts.
('78', 339, 5, 18, 647482) The highest on the takli was 303 of 12 counts.
('78', 339, 5, 19, 647529) This is all satisfactory.
('78', 339, 5, 20, 647555) There is not much scope for increased speed with the present improvements except on the Magan Charkha.
('78', 339, 5, 21, 647658) Enough experiment has not yet been made on that wheel.
('78', 339, 5, 22, 647713) But all accounts go to show that is has further possibilities.
('78', 339, 5, 23, 647776) The takli is any day the queen for easy carriage, simpli city and cost.
('78', 339, 5, 24, 647848) On the whole it may prove to be the quickest.
('78', 339, 5, 25, 647894) Whereas the wheels many go out of order, the takli need never.
('78', 339, 5, 26, 647957) Experiments are being made in plying the takli after the style of the charkha.
('78', 339, 5, 27, 648036) I congratulate the winners.
('78', 339, 5, 28, 648064) I only hope that more interest will be taken than hitherto in such competitions.
('78', 339, 5, 29, 648145) Spinning competitions have a great national value.
('78', 339, 5, 30, 648196) I may note that the Maulana Saheb was to have given the prizes.
('78', 339, 5, 31, 648260) But the wholly unexpected downpour made it utterly impossible to do so.
('78', 339, 5, 32, 648332) SEVAGRAM, June 17, 1940 Harijan, 22 6 1940
('78', 340, 0, 1, 648375) VOL.78 : 23FEBRUARY, 1940 JULY, 1940 341
('78', 340, 1, 2, 648416) 423. QUESTION BOX
('78', 340, 2, 3, 648434) MEANING OF SPINNING ACTIVITIES
('78', 340, 3, 4, 648465) Q. It is an admitted fact that constructive activity keeps the political atmosphere pure and non violent.
('78', 340, 3, 5, 648571) You have recommended it for active satyagrahis.
('78', 340, 3, 6, 648619) This activity can be carried on in a centre amongst Congressmen as also the villagers
('78', 340, 4, 7, 648705) generally, which may include such people as old women, etc., who take to spinning as unemployment insurance, as is done in A. I. S. A. production centres.
('78', 340, 4, 8, 648860) Your writings make one infer that you want active satyagrahis to confine constructive activity to Congressmen and particularly in the direction of making them self spinners and make them were khadi of their own yarn; the khadi in the first instance to be bought from A. I. S. A. stores, until the Congressmen produce their own yarn.
('78', 340, 4, 9, 649193) Confining attention to Congressmen or political Congressmen seems to be more practicable than starting a general khadi centre of spinning for wages.
('78', 340, 4, 10, 649342) Is this a correct interpretation of your writing?
('78', 340, 5, 11, 649392) A. Your interpretation is correct so far as it goes.
('78', 340, 5, 12, 649445) I do not want the Congress organization to be an indifferent of glorified copy of the A. I. S. A. It has to do the work that the A. I. S. A. does not do.
('78', 340, 5, 13, 649599) Its motive will be predominantly political,, whereas that of the A. I. S. A., although it is a creation of the Congress, is purely philanthropic and economic.
('78', 340, 5, 14, 649758) The Congress organization aims at creating an army of non violent soldiers or, to drop the military terminology, a band of non violent workers for the freedom of the country.
('78', 340, 5, 15, 649933) The spinning work and all the allied processes keep Congressmen busy and away from mischief.
('78', 340, 5, 16, 650026) It will knit them together in a brotherhood, it will give them an insight into village life, it will bring them in direct touch with the villagers, it will give them a hold on the economic condition of the masses as nothing else will do, it will lead them on to a study of the whole of the vast village problem, it will make them sink their petty or big differences and forget class, racial or religious distinctions.
('78', 340, 5, 17, 650444) The charkha may or may not have all this potency inherent in it.
('78', 340, 5, 18, 650509) I want Congressmen to impute all these implications to it.
('78', 340, 5, 19, 650568) TEST TUBE BABIES
('78', 340, 6, 20, 650585) Q. You say that motherhood is sublime but sex is bad.
('78', 340, 6, 21, 650639) From the spiritual and
('78', 340, 7, 22, 650662) eugenic point of view dont you agree that the test tube technique of begetting babies
('78', 340, 8, 23, 650748) is ideal since it altogether eliminates lust and carnality from procreation?
('78', 340, 9, 24, 650825) A. I would reconcile myself to your method, if carnality itself can be eradicated thereby.
('78', 340, 9, 25, 650916) So long as I hold to the view that carnality prevents man or woman from rising to the fullest height possible, so
('78', 341, 0, 1, 651030) THE COLLECTED WORKS OF MAHATMA GANDHI 342
('78', 341, 1, 2, 651072) long must I rebel against these artificial methods of procreation.
('78', 341, 1, 3, 651139) Your method, as far as I can see, can only result in multiplying idiots or monsters, not human beings, thrown into the sea of passions which it should be their pride to subjugate.
('78', 341, 1, 4, 651319) But I own I belong to an age that is perhaps dying.
('78', 341, 1, 5, 651371) The new age to come, when men and women will walk, if they at all do , only for pleasure but go to their work on wheels or fly to it, and when the institution of marriage and all it implies will be abolished, does not enthuse me.
('78', 341, 1, 6, 651601) HOW TO FACE A LIE
('78', 341, 2, 7, 651619) Q. People believe in your sincerity when you sympathize with Britain and France in their struggle for existence, but some of us have scented a danger that the Indian capitalists may continue to employ you as a tool for keeping India calm when these capitalists are reaping rich profit as a result of this war.
('78', 341, 2, 8, 651929) What steps are you taking to remove this suspicion?
('78', 341, 3, 9, 651981) A. I propose to take no steps, even as I took none when I was accused of having one crore of rupees in the Bank of England.
('78', 341, 3, 10, 652105) Lies are best left unanswered.
('78', 341, 3, 11, 652136) They die of inanition.
('78', 341, 3, 12, 652159) They have no vitality of their own.
('78', 341, 3, 13, 652195) They flourish on opposition.
('78', 341, 3, 14, 652224) If my whole life is not sufficient answer to the lie referred to by you, no steps I can take will remove the impression created by the lie.
('78', 341, 3, 15, 652364) Mind you, I do not dispute the fact that the peaceful atmosphere created by my inaction benefits the capitalists, but it benefits the masses more than the capitalists, for the inaction enables the masses to garner their non violent strength which will enable them to deal effectively with capitalists and imperia lism which covers them.
('78', 341, 3, 16, 652701) SEVAGRAM, June 17, 1940 Harijan, 22 6 1940

('78', 342, 9, 22, 653862) 427. HOW TO COMBAT HITLERISM
('78', 342, 10, 23, 653891) Whatever Hitler may ultimately prove to be, we know what Hitlerism has come to mean.
('78', 342, 10, 24, 653976) It means naked, ruthless force reduced to an exact science and worked with scientific precision.
('78', 342, 10, 25, 654073) In its effect it becomes almost irresistible.

('78', 351, 1, 6, 673232) But I know that, if God shows me the way to demonstrate the efficacy of non violence of the strong, the break will prove to have been temporary.
('78', 351, 1, 7, 673377) If there is no way, they will have justified their wisdom in bearing the wrench of letting me go my way alone.
('78', 351, 1, 8, 673488) If that tragic discovery of my impotence is in store for me, I hope still to retain the faith that has sustained me all these years and to have humility enough to realize that I was no a fit enough instrument to carry the torch of non violence any further.
('78', 351, 1, 9, 673745) But this argument and doubt are based upon the assumption that the members of the Working Committee represent the feeling of the vast majority of Congressmen.
('78', 351, 1, 10, 673904) They would wish and hope that the vast majority of Congressmen had in them the non violence of the strong.
('78', 351, 1, 11, 674011) No one would be more glad than they to discover that they had underrated Congressmens strength.
('78', 351, 1, 12, 674107) The probability, however, is that there is no majority but only a good minority which represents the non violence of the strong.
('78', 351, 1, 13, 674236) It should be remembered that the matter does not lend itself to argument.
('78', 351, 1, 14, 674310) The members of the Working Committee had all the argument before them.
('78', 351, 1, 15, 674381) But non violence, which is a quality of the heart, cannot quiet but resolute demonstration on non violent strength.
('78', 351, 1, 16, 674497) The opportunity comes to everyone almost daily.
('78', 351, 1, 17, 674545) There are communal clashes, there are dacoities, there are wordy duels.
('78', 351, 1, 18, 674617) In all these things those who are truly non violent can and will demonstrate it.
('78', 351, 1, 19, 674698) If it is shown in an adequate measure, it will not fail to infect their surroundings.
('78', 351, 1, 20, 674784) I am quite clear that there is not a single Congressman who disbelieves in the efficacy of non violence out of sheer cussedness.
('78', 351, 1, 21, 674913) Let the Congressmen who believe that the Congress should adhere to non violence in dealing with internal dis orders or external aggression, express it in their daily conduct.
('78', 351, 1, 22, 675088) Non violence of the strong cannot be a mere policy.
('78', 351, 1, 23, 675140) It must be a creed, or a passion, if creed is objected to.
('78', 351, 1, 24, 675199) A man with a passion expresses it in every little act of his.
('78', 351, 1, 25, 675261) Therefore he who is possessed by non violence will express it in the family circle, in his dealings with neigh 
('78', 352, 0, 1, 675373) VOL.78 : 23FEBRUARY, 1940 JULY, 1940 353
('78', 352, 1, 2, 675414) bours, in his dealings with opponents.
('78', 352, 1, 3, 675453) It is because it has not expres sed itself in this way amount Congressmen that the members of the Working Committee rightly concluded that Congressmen were not ready for non violent treatment of internal disorders or external aggr ession.
('78', 352, 1, 4, 675692) Embarrassment caused by non violent action would move esta blished authority to yield to popular will.
('78', 352, 1, 5, 675795) But such action has obvio usly no play in the face of disorders.
('78', 352, 1, 6, 675860) We have to court death without retaliation and with no malice or anger towards those who bring about disorder.
('78', 352, 1, 7, 675971) It is easy enough to see that non violence required here is of a wholly different type from what the Congress has known hitherto.
('78', 352, 1, 8, 676101) But it is the only non violence that is true and that can save the world from self destruction.
('78', 352, 1, 9, 676197) This is a certainty sooner or later, sooner rather than later, if India cannot deliver that message of true non violence to a world which wants to be saved from the curse of wars and does not know how to find the deliverance.

('78', 353, 1, 2, 677612) Religions are not for separating men from one another, they are meant to bind them. (Page 157, 2nd column.)
('78', 353, 2, 3, 677720) These lines remind me of the immortal words of a famous Persian
('78', 353, 3, 4, 677784) poet put into the mouth of God who addresses Moses in verse 14 of the poem, viz.,
('78', 353, 4, 5, 677866) Thou hast come to this earth to unite; thou hast not come to this

('78', 353, 6, 7, 677951) Original:
('78', 353, 7, 8, 677961) To barae Vasl kardan amadi

('78', 353, 10, 11, 678082) show the beauty and the grandeur of the truth contained in the above verse:
('78', 353, 11, 12, 678158) Moses once saw on the road a shepherd who was exclaiming thus:
('78', 353, 12, 13, 678221) Oh God Almighty!
('78', 353, 13, 14, 678238) Tell me where Thou art, so that I may become Thy servant, stitch
('78', 353, 14, 15, 678303) Thy heavy shoes, comb Thy hair,
('78', 353, 15, 16, 678335) Kiss Thy hand, rub Thy feet, and sweep the floor for Thee to sleep.
('78', 353, 16, 17, 678403) If Thou wouldst fall ill in future, like Thy kith and kin I would
('78', 353, 17, 18, 678469) grieve for Thee.
('78', 353, 18, 19, 678486) Oh my Lord, my life is sacrificed to Thee: together with my children and
('78', 353, 19, 20, 678559) all the property that I own.
('78', 353, 20, 21, 678588) Aye, all my sheep are sacrificed to thee: every call of hae ha of
('78', 353, 21, 22, 678654) mine addressed to my wayward sheep is for Thy remembrance!"
('78', 353, 22, 23, 678714) In this strain that shepherd was speaking when Moses spoke to
('78', 353, 23, 24, 678776) him thus: Whom art thou addressing?
('78', 353, 24, 25, 678812) He replied: I am addressing Him who created us, the One from
('78', 353, 25, 26, 678873) whom became manifest this earth and this revolving celestial globe (Charkh).
('78', 353, 26, 27, 678950) Moses exclaimed:  Alas, thy head has become arrogant and dis 
('78', 353, 27, 28, 679012) courteous: thou hast ceased to be a Mussalman; thou has turned an infidel.
('78', 353, 28, 29, 679087) If thou dost not tie up (stop) these words in thy palate, the fire ( of Hell) will spread out and consume the whole world.
('78', 353, 29, 30, 679210) The poor shephered cried in agony: oh Moses, thou hast stitched my mouth; the repentance that thou hast caused in me has consumed my soul.
('78', 353, 30, 31, 679349) He tore his robe into tatters, heaved a burning sigh, set his face towards the forest and disappeared in its midst.

('78', 354, 8, 12, 680431) 435. QUESTION BOX
('78', 354, 9, 13, 680449) VOWS AND WILL POWER
('78', 354, 10, 14, 680469) Q. I am a genuine seeker after brahmacharya.
('78', 354, 10, 15, 680514) But in spite of all my prayerful
('78', 354, 11, 16, 680547) effort I am sinking deeper and deeper into self indulgence.
('78', 354, 11, 17, 680607) I cannot blame my partner
('78', 354, 12, 18, 680633) for it.
('78', 354, 12, 19, 680641) My circumstances do not permit me to enforce the rule about segregation.
('78', 354, 13, 20, 680714) You advocate and believe in the efficacy of vows.
('78', 354, 13, 21, 680764) You have said in Harijan
('78', 354, 14, 22, 680789) that for the weak in mind and soul vows are like tonics.
('78', 354, 14, 23, 680846) But how will you administer this tonic to a case like mine who has not the strength of will to carry out the vow he has taken?
('78', 354, 14, 24, 680973) Had I such a strong will, the necessity for taking vows would not have arisen.
('78', 354, 15, 25, 681052) A. Let me bluntly tell you that I do not believe in your genuineness, not that you are wilfully lying.
('78', 354, 15, 26, 681155) You are unconsciously un genuine.
('78', 354, 15, 27, 681189) If you are genuine, you will at least observe the rules of the game.
('78', 354, 15, 28, 681258) You give up you case when you say you cannot segregate yourself from your wife for want of room.
('78', 354, 15, 29, 681355) I have never heard such an excuse.
('78', 354, 15, 30, 681390) If you take the vow, you must at least produce the necessary atmosphere around you for its observance.
('78', 354, 15, 31, 681493) Everyone who has succes sfully carried out the vow has invariably observed this first condition.
('78', 355, 0, 1, 681590) THE COLLECTED WORKS OF MAHATMA GANDHI 356
('78', 355, 1, 2, 681632) If you are living in only one room, you should go elsewhere or send away your wife or have a relative to sleep in the same room.
('78', 355, 1, 3, 681761) The ques tion is how far you are determined.
('78', 355, 1, 4, 681806) It may be that you want to observe brahmacharya because you have read much about it and would like to be classed among brahmacharis.
('78', 355, 1, 5, 681939) I know many such young men.
('78', 355, 1, 6, 681967) If that is your case, you should not make the attempt.
('78', 355, 1, 7, 682022) One must have a burning desire to live that life.
('78', 355, 1, 8, 682072) If you have it, you will adopt the mea sures that all aspirants have invariably adopted.
('78', 355, 1, 9, 682161) You are then bound to succeed.
('78', 355, 1, 10, 682192) If you have not read Self restraint v.
('78', 355, 1, 11, 682231) Self indulgence, you should read it.
('78', 355, 1, 12, 682268) WHAT TO DO?
('78', 355, 2, 13, 682280) Q. The situation in the country is becoming graver daily.
('78', 355, 2, 14, 682338) Everywhere panic is growing.
('78', 355, 2, 15, 682367) In certain parts armed gangs are already organizing themselves to take advantage of the ensuing anarchy in case the central power should disintegrate or weaken.
('78', 355, 2, 16, 682528) The danger may not be imminent, but it would be folly to ignore its possibility.
('78', 355, 2, 17, 682609) With all the education in non violence which the country has received during the last twenty years, you will agree that it has not developed the sort of non violence that can be effective in the face of anarchy and gangsterism.
('78', 355, 2, 18, 682837) The Government is taking steps to organize the citizens for self defence.
('78', 355, 2, 19, 682911) What is the duty of those who look up to you for lead and guidance?
('78', 355, 2, 20, 682979) Should they take part in these Government activities?
('78', 355, 2, 21, 683033) If they should not, what else are they to do?
('78', 355, 2, 22, 683079) Surely they cannot sit with folded hands doing nothing.
('78', 355, 3, 23, 683135) A. I am unable to say what the Congress will exactly do, in view of the recent statement of the Working Committee.
('78', 355, 3, 24, 683250) If you believe in non violent treatment of anarchy and the like, naturally you will pre pare yourself and your neighbours and those whom you can influ ence for non violent defence.
('78', 355, 3, 25, 683431) I quite agree with you that no respon sible person can sit idly by in these times.
('78', 355, 3, 26, 683514) Violent preparation would need long previous training.
('78', 355, 3, 27, 683569) Non violent preparation means mental adjustment.
('78', 355, 3, 28, 683618) Possibility of anarchy there undoubtedly is.
('78', 355, 3, 29, 683663) But if you are non violent, you will not give way to fear.
('78', 355, 3, 30, 683722) Do not anticipate anarchy, just as you do not anticipate death though you know that it is a certainty.
('78', 355, 3, 31, 683825) If you are non violent, you will believe that there will be no anarchy.
('78', 355, 3, 32, 683897) But if unfortunately it comes, you and your companions of followers will give your lives to prevent it.
('78', 355, 3, 33, 684001) Those who five their lives, in trying to kill those whim they regard as robbers or mischief makers, do no better, possibly they do worse.
('78', 355, 3, 34, 684139) They risk their lives and there is darkness after they are gone.
('78', 355, 3, 35, 684204) What is more, they may leave
('78', 356, 0, 1, 684233) VOL.78 : 23FEBRUARY, 1940 JULY, 1940 357
('78', 356, 1, 2, 684274) things worse by feeding the fire of violence by counter violence.
('78', 356, 1, 3, 684340) Those who die unresistingly are likely to still the fury of violence by their wholly innocent sacrifice.
('78', 356, 1, 4, 684445) But this truly non violent action is not possible unless it springs from a heart belief that he whom you fear and regard as a robber, dacoit, or worse and you are one, and that therefore it is better that you die at his hands than that he, your igno rant brother, should die at yours.
('78', 356, 1, 5, 684730) PAKISTAN AND CONSTITUENT ASSEMBLY
('78', 356, 2, 6, 684764) Q. The two nations theory is by way of a counterblast to the demand for a
('78', 356, 3, 7, 684838) Constituent Assembly which is about as absurd as the other thing.
('78', 356, 3, 8, 684904) To me the idea of a
('78', 356, 4, 9, 684924) Constituent Assembly ignores the existing conditions.
('78', 356, 4, 10, 684978) 95 per cent of our people are
('78', 356, 5, 11, 685008) illiterate, and nearly cent per cent are swayed by religious prejudices; and then there is
('78', 356, 6, 12, 685099) the additional factor of corruption.
('78', 356, 6, 13, 685136) And the fatal objection to a constituent Assembly
('78', 356, 7, 14, 685186) is that without a genuine desire on the part of the majority to give effect to safeguards
('78', 356, 8, 15, 685276) the best of these are bound to prove unreal.
('78', 356, 9, 16, 685321) A. Surely you cannot speak of the Constituent Assembly side by side with Pakistan.
('78', 356, 9, 17, 685404) The latter is wrong, as I conceive it, in every way.
('78', 356, 9, 18, 685457) There is nothing wrong in the idea of a Constituent Assembly.
('78', 356, 9, 19, 685519) At its worst, dangers surround its formation.
('78', 356, 9, 20, 685565) Every big experiment is beset with dangers.
('78', 356, 9, 21, 685609) These risks must be taken.
('78', 356, 9, 22, 685636) Every effort should be made to minimize them.
('78', 356, 9, 23, 685682) But there seems to me to be nothing like a Constituent Assembly for achieving the common purpose.
('78', 356, 9, 24, 685780) I admit the difficulty of illiteracy.
('78', 356, 9, 25, 685818) Indeed adult suffrage was introduced at the instance of Muslim nationalists including the late Ali Brothers.
('78', 356, 9, 26, 685927) The danger of corruption is also there.
('78', 356, 9, 27, 685967) The greater the origination the less felt is the effect of corruption because it is so widely distributed.
('78', 356, 9, 28, 686074) Thus in the Congress there are much corruption and jealousy, but they are confined to those few who run the machinery.
('78', 356, 9, 29, 686193) But the vast body of Congressmen are untouched by these defects, though they profit by the good the Congress does.
('78', 356, 9, 30, 686308) The danger you mention about safe guards will be reduced to the vanishing point if they come through a Constituent Assembly.
('78', 356, 9, 31, 686433) For safeguards laid down by the representatives elected by the adult Muslim population will depend for their safety not on the goodwill or honesty of the majority but on the strength of the awakened Muslim masses.
('78', 356, 9, 32, 686647) Fatality really attaches to your wrong conception of the majority, not to a Constituent Assembly.
('78', 356, 9, 33, 686745) There is a
('78', 357, 0, 1, 686756) THE COLLECTED WORKS OF MAHATMA GANDHI 358
('78', 357, 1, 2, 686798) majority of Hindus undoubtedly, but we observe that in popular poli tical assemblies parties are not rigidly divided according to religious opinions, but they are according to political and other opinions.
('78', 357, 1, 3, 687004) The curse of communalism became intensified by the introduction of sep arate electorates.
('78', 357, 1, 4, 687094) The cry for partition is the logical outcome, but it is also the strongest condemnation, of separate electorates.
('78', 357, 1, 5, 687208) When we have learnt wisdom we shall cease to think in terms of separate electo rates and two nations.
('78', 357, 1, 6, 687310) I believe in the innate goodness of human nature.
('78', 357, 1, 7, 687360) I therefore swear by the Constituent Assembly.
('78', 357, 1, 8, 687407) The Muslim vote will surely decide the issue so far as their special interest is con cerned.
('78', 357, 1, 9, 687500) Arguing communally, therefore, the fear, if there is any, about a Constituent Assembly should surely be on the part of the Hindus.
('78', 357, 1, 10, 687631) For if the Muslim vote goes in favour of partition, they have either to submit not to one but many partitions or to a civil war.
('78', 357, 1, 11, 687760) As things are, all satisfy themselves by passing resolutions and seeing their names in print.
('78', 357, 1, 12, 687854) In practice all of us remain where we are in a state of subjection.
('78', 357, 1, 13, 687922) A Constituent Assembly is a reality.
('78', 357, 1, 14, 687959) It will not be a debating or legislative irresponsible body.
('78', 357, 1, 15, 688020) By registering its final decision it will decide the fate of millions of human beings.
('78', 357, 1, 16, 688107) You may oppose it.
('78', 357, 1, 17, 688126) If you are successful in your opposition, there is the dread prospect of anarchy, not an orderly civil war.
('78', 357, 1, 18, 688234) There seems to me to be no solution of the painful deadlock except through a Constituent Assembly.

('78', 361, 1, 2, 691816) 444. INTERVIEW TO VISITORS FROM PRINCELY STATES 1
('78', 361, 2, 3, 691866) [Before June 27, 1940] They should cease to be Princes and become servants of the people.
('78', 361, 2, 4, 691956) They will have to descend from their pedestal and seek the co operation of their people.
('78', 361, 2, 5, 692045) If they do so, they need not use force at all to put down the forces of disorder.
('78', 361, 2, 6, 692127) The Congress does not want to do away with the Princes, and they can seek its co operation in bringing about peace and contentment in their States.
('78', 361, 2, 7, 692275) They will have to be genuine servants of the people.
('78', 361, 2, 8, 692328) When they do so, no one will think of eliminating them.
('78', 361, 2, 9, 692384) If they are the servants and the people are the masters, why should the masters do away with the servants?
('78', 361, 2, 10, 692491) You say there are a number of smaller Princes today who are anxious to make up with the Congress.
('78', 361, 2, 11, 692589) If they are, what prevents them from doing the most elementary things.?
('78', 361, 3, 12, 692661) INTERVIEWERS: They want to do certain things, but they are on the one hand afraid of the Paramount Power and on the other afraid of the people.
('78', 361, 3, 13, 692805) Some kind of fear seems to have seized them that the people will want to pay off old scores.
('78', 361, 4, 14, 692898) GANDHIJI: Both their fears are groundless.
('78', 361, 4, 15, 692941) If they will do justice, I can scarcely think of the people wanting to pay off old scores.
('78', 361, 4, 16, 693032) Our people are not of a revengeful nature.
('78', 361, 4, 17, 693075) Is the Ruler of Aundh afraid of any rebellion in his State?
('78', 361, 4, 18, 693135) He is not, for whom will they rebel against when they know that he has divested himself of practically all power?
('78', 361, 4, 19, 693249) If they want to rebel, I think he is capable of saying to them, Come and take charge of my palace, I shall be content to go and stay among the poorest of you!
('78', 361, 4, 20, 693408) Appasaheb, the son of the Chief of Aundh, is slaving away for the people as no servant of the State does.
('78', 361, 4, 21, 693514) But the fact is that the people have to be convinced of their bona fides.
('78', 361, 4, 22, 693588) Let them do two things.
('78', 361, 4, 23, 693612) One is that they have to purify their lives and reduce themselves to utter simplicity.
('78', 361, 4, 24, 693699) The fabulous am ounts they spend on themselves are unconscionable.
('78', 361, 4, 25, 693766) I cannot under stand how they can have the heart to squander the peoples money in riotous living, when thousands of their people cannot get a square meal a day.
('78', 361, 4, 26, 693927) Why should they not be content with two or three hun 
('78', 361, 5, 27, 693981) 1 Extracted from Mahadev Desai's occasional Notes, 27 6 1940. The inter viewers had asked Gandhiji what the Princes were to do in the face of the panic, insecurity and impending anarchy in the States.
('78', 362, 0, 1, 694182) VOL.78 : 23FEBRUARY, 1940 JULY, 1940 363
('78', 362, 1, 2, 694223) dred rupees a month?
('78', 362, 1, 3, 694244) But my point is this .
('78', 362, 1, 4, 694267) let them take what the people will give them.
('78', 362, 1, 5, 694313) Their privy purse must be votable.
('78', 362, 1, 6, 694348) No reforms and no budget can have any value unless the people have the fullest right to say how much their ruler take for himself.
('78', 362, 1, 7, 694479) An new age has already begun, and no ruler can conceivably be tolerated whose life does not correspond largely with the life of his people and who does not identify himself with them.
('78', 362, 1, 8, 694663) That is one thing.
('78', 362, 1, 9, 694682) The other thing is that their judiciary will have to be above board and therefore independent of them.
('78', 362, 1, 10, 694785) I cannot say today with confidence that in any State the judiciary is really independent.
('78', 362, 1, 11, 694875) And there must be complete civil liberty.
('78', 362, 1, 12, 694917) These, then, are the first steps in the way of reform.
('78', 362, 1, 13, 694972) Their fear of the Paramount Power is groundless.
('78', 362, 1, 14, 695021) That Power dare not openly say or do anything to interfere with bona fide reforms.
('78', 362, 1, 15, 695104) Wherever they have interfered they have made some flaw in the particular Princes character an excuse.
('78', 362, 1, 16, 695206) The deduction is that Princes should be, like Caesars wife, above suspicion.
('78', 362, 1, 17, 695283) As for the Congress, let them know that it is ever ready to come to an understanding with them.
('78', 362, 1, 18, 695379) The Con gress is essentially a non violent organization.
('78', 362, 1, 19, 695436) Let the Princes volun tarily go under the authority of their people and the Congress will be friend them.
('78', 362, 1, 20, 695542) If they do not do so, there are breakers ahead.
('78', 362, 1, 21, 695590) The Con gress, let me repeat, is not out to destroy the Princes, unless it be that they do not mend their ways and destroy themselves.
('78', 362, 1, 22, 695725) Even if there is one Prince who will be content to be the servant of the people, the Congress will stand by him.

('78', 362, 2, 24, 695857) 445. INTERVIEW TO AMERICAN VISITORS 1
('78', 362, 3, 25, 695895) SEVAGRAM, [ Before June 27, 1940 ]
('78', 362, 4, 26, 695930) QUESTION: How can I best prepare in India to help in America towards a better understanding between Indians and Americans?
('78', 362, 4, 27, 696053) How could I contribute towards this end in America?
('78', 362, 5, 28, 696105) ANSWER: One has to show in ones life ones countrys best traits, and that is how one can bring another country to a better
('78', 362, 6, 29, 696227) 1 EXtracted from Mahadev Desai's Occasional Notes, 27 6 1940. The visitor was a pacifist and represented various women's associations.
('78', 363, 0, 1, 696362) THE COLLECTED WORKS OF MAHATMA GANDHI 364
('78', 363, 1, 2, 696404) understanding of ones own.
('78', 363, 1, 3, 696431) If you do not show the best in you whilst you are here, you make America liable to be misunderstood; and the same thing I would say about Indians in America.
('78', 363, 1, 4, 696589) If one wants to interpret one country to another, he or she has to discover the best in that country and place it before the other country.
('78', 363, 1, 5, 696729) If you, for instance, see nothing good in the life here, then you certainly are not the best person to interpret India to America.
('78', 363, 1, 6, 696860) In America you find a Miss Mayo bringing out all the filth from the Indian gutters.
('78', 363, 1, 7, 696944) You will contradict her, and as against one calumny uttered by a hasty or a paid or an interested observer you will adduce many testimonies gathered out of a sympathetic understanding and knock the bottom out of that calumny.
('78', 363, 2, 8, 697170) Q. What can pacifist Americans do to help the world situation?
('78', 363, 3, 9, 697233) A. It is a difficult question.
('78', 363, 3, 10, 697264) If you mean pacifist Americans in India, they can do precious little.
('78', 363, 3, 11, 697334) But in America they should, I suppose, be able to do a great deal.
('78', 363, 3, 12, 697401) But it is a question really outside my depth, and I must not say anything more about it.
('78', 363, 4, 13, 697490) Q. I do a lot of writing and speaking especially among women.
('78', 363, 4, 14, 697552) Have you any
('78', 363, 5, 15, 697565) message to give to American women?
('78', 363, 6, 16, 697600) A. Not as a message.
('78', 363, 6, 17, 697621) I can throw out a suggestion and, if it appeals to you, you can develop it.
('78', 363, 6, 18, 697697) Woman can play a most important part in the work of pacifism.
('78', 363, 6, 19, 697759) She should refuse to be swept off her feet and to imitate mans language and refuse to allow herself and hers to be identified with anything connected with war.
('78', 363, 6, 20, 697919) For she must know that she can represent peace more than war.
('78', 363, 6, 21, 697981) She is made for the demonstration and exhibition of that silent force which is not less effective because it is silent, but the more effective because it is silent.
('78', 363, 6, 22, 698146) Harijan, 13 7 1940

('78', 365, 1, 2, 698682) 448. DISCUSSION WITH PYARELAL AND MAHADEV DESAI
('78', 365, 3, 3, 698730) [ June 29, 1940 ]
('78', 365, 5, 4, 698748) PYARELAL: This puzzles one.
('78', 365, 6, 5, 698776) 3 What is so personal about that letter?
('78', 365, 7, 6, 698817) man has a curtness which one does not like.
('78', 365, 8, 7, 698861) GANDHIJI: It is improper of you to judge a co worker from one
('78', 365, 9, 8, 698923) single instance.
('78', 365, 9, 9, 698940) It is improper from the point of view of logic and more so from the point of view of ahimsa.
('78', 365, 9, 10, 699033) Darwin, in his book The Descent of Man, has not based his conclusions on any one fact.
('78', 365, 9, 11, 699120) He never tired of adducing heaps and heaps of evidence.
('78', 365, 9, 12, 699176) He has cram med the whole book with facts to prove his thesis and in the end he has formulated that thesis in the fewest words.
('78', 365, 9, 13, 699304) Imagine how much he valued truth!
('78', 365, 9, 14, 699338) Even so I find a flaw in his thesis because Syadvad of Jain philosophy teaches me that notwithstanding all this testimony we may come across some other facts which may refute Darwins thesis.
('78', 365, 9, 15, 699529) Because the writer of the letter has written personal on the top of the letter, you came to the conclusion that he is curt.
('78', 365, 9, 16, 699653) Now let me give an instance.
('78', 365, 9, 17, 699682) Many people eat out of each others plates and they believe that that promotes friendship.
('78', 365, 9, 18, 699772) Hindu wives believe that they earn merit by eating the orts from their husbands plates.
('78', 365, 9, 19, 699860) Maybe Ba also believes that and she would not shrink from eating from the plate used by me.
('78', 365, 9, 20, 699952) But as for me, leaving others aside, I would not be able to eat even from Bas plate.
('78', 365, 9, 21, 700037) If someone was to see me refusing food from Bas plate and drew the conclusion that I was curt and fussy what an injustice he would be doing me!
('78', 365, 9, 22, 700181) Even though I may feel repelled by this one thing, I have no doubt that by temperament I am neither curt not fussy, and I can cite hundreds of instances to prove that.
('78', 365, 9, 23, 700349) Similarly numerous instances can be cited to prove that your friend about whom you have complained is not what you have des cribed him to be.
('78', 365, 9, 24, 700491) No proposition can be called universal unless it is proved so by analysis and synthesis.
('78', 365, 9, 25, 700580) We know that water consists of two parts of hydrogen and one part of oxygen.
('78', 365, 9, 26, 700657) But we must prove that by synthesis and analysis.
('78', 365, 9, 27, 700707) If we analyse water we get two parts of
('78', 365, 10, 28, 700747) 1 Extracted from Mahadev Desai's " A Revealing Dialogue".
('78', 365, 10, 29, 700805) A brief report by
('78', 365, 11, 30, 700823) Pyarelal also appeared in Harijan, 6 06 1940, under the title "On the Road to Simla".
('78', 365, 12, 31, 700909) 2 ibid.
('78', 365, 13, 32, 700917) 3 Pyarelal was commenting on a co worker's marking Personal a letter he
('78', 365, 14, 33, 700989) had written to Gandhiji.
('78', 366, 0, 1, 701014) VOL.78 : 23FEBRUARY, 1940 JULY, 1940 367
('78', 366, 1, 2, 701055) hydrogen and one part of oxygen.
('78', 366, 1, 3, 701088) However we should synthesize two parts of hydrogen and one part of oxygen and if that produces water, our proposition about its composition is proved.
('78', 366, 1, 4, 701239) The same applies to our day to day behaviour.
('78', 366, 1, 5, 701285) We cannot jump to the conclusion about a certain thing, even though it be as clear as daylight, without examining hundreds of facts which may prove it wrong.
('78', 366, 1, 6, 701443) It certainly violates truth and in being uncharitable towards others we violate ahimsa too.
('78', 366, 1, 7, 701535) We who tread the path of ahimsa should take each step with great care.
('78', 366, 1, 8, 701606) It is not that I am unaware of his faults.
('78', 366, 1, 9, 701649) Maybe you are justified in finding him curt in this particular instance but to believe that he is always so betrays lack of charity on your part.
('78', 366, 1, 10, 701795) Shall we not take into account the circumstances under which this co worker has been brought up and educated, the difficulties he has had to face and the efforts he had to make to reach the present position?
('78', 366, 1, 11, 702003) Shall we judge him by this one manifest shortcoming of his?
('78', 366, 1, 12, 702063) What a beautiful word the English language has for love charity.
('78', 366, 1, 13, 702128) It connotes compassion too.
('78', 366, 1, 14, 702156) And compassion should be an integral part of our ahimsa.
('78', 366, 2, 15, 702213) M. D. The meaning of the roots of charity and daya is the same.
('78', 366, 3, 16, 702277) G. I did not know that the roots of both the words meant the same.
('78', 366, 3, 17, 702344) But one thing is certain: that even if we see shortcomings in others, we should overlook them and take into account their good points alone.
('78', 366, 3, 18, 702485) The beauty of love and compassion lies in magnifying the virtues of others.
('78', 366, 3, 19, 702561) Moreover there is always another way to win over others i.e., by rendering silent service.
('78', 366, 4, 20, 702652) P. I agree.
('78', 366, 4, 21, 702664) But there should be an opportunity for that.
('78', 366, 4, 22, 702709) I have many times endeavoured to befriend him and make myself agreeable to him.
('78', 366, 4, 23, 702789) But I have failed.
('78', 366, 4, 24, 702808) You do not know the utter contempt in which he holds me.
('78', 366, 5, 25, 702865) G. You do not see the point.
('78', 366, 5, 26, 702894) I tell you there is subtle pride in those words of yours.
('78', 366, 5, 27, 702952) It is your pride that prompts you to say that you have tried to befriend him ignoring his contempt for you.
('78', 366, 5, 28, 703060) All the time you were conscious of the injustice done to you.
('78', 366, 5, 29, 703122) But you have never thought of analysing why he was unjust to you either consciously or unconsciously.
('78', 366, 5, 30, 703224) Dont I know his faults and shortcomings?
('78', 366, 5, 31, 703265) You do not know how many times I have made him shed tears by reminding him of all his faults.
('78', 366, 5, 32, 703359) I have not even restrained myself in exposing him in the presence of all co workers.
('78', 366, 5, 33, 703444) But look at his behaviour.
('78', 366, 5, 34, 703471) He is fighting against all his faults and shortcomings.
('78', 366, 5, 35, 703527) All the twenty four hours he is making incessant efforts to subjugate them and he has achieved considerable success.
('78', 366, 5, 36, 703644) But how much can a man rise beyond
('78', 367, 0, 1, 703679) THE COLLECTED WORKS OF MAHATMA GANDHI 368
('78', 367, 1, 2, 703721) his inborn nature and upbringing?
('78', 367, 1, 3, 703755) If we are perpetually aware of these things, we shall never have the courage to do injustice to others.
('78', 367, 1, 4, 703859) Who knows better then I the faults of the Rajas and Maharajas?
('78', 367, 1, 5, 703922) But why do I have sympathy for them?
('78', 367, 1, 6, 703959) Because I know that their nature, their temper is conditioned by their circumstances.
('78', 367, 1, 7, 704045) I understand them and they also know that in me they have a friend.
('78', 367, 1, 8, 704113) While talking about contempt, we must think about Andrews.
('78', 367, 1, 9, 704172) Numerous Government officials had nothing but contempt for him.
('78', 367, 1, 10, 704236) It is not that he did not know about it but he never hesitated in going to their houses.
('78', 367, 1, 11, 704325) He tried to find out why they showed contempt for him and endeavoured to remove the cause.
('78', 367, 1, 12, 704416) As a result many of those who had hated him repented of their attitude and confessed that they had been unjust to him.
('78', 367, 1, 13, 704535) Such contempt creates opportunities for love to come into play.
('78', 367, 1, 14, 704599) What is so remarkable about loving those who love us?
('78', 367, 1, 15, 704653) The beauty lies in melting those who hate us with our love and kindness.
('78', 367, 2, 16, 704726) P. I understand.
('78', 367, 2, 17, 704743) I understand all.
('78', 367, 2, 18, 704761) There were occasions when I sensed the
('78', 367, 3, 19, 704800) dreariness of his condition.
('78', 367, 3, 20, 704829) Many times on such occasions I felt like befriending
('78', 367, 4, 21, 704882) him, but always feared that he might misinterpret the gesture.
('78', 367, 5, 22, 704945) G. Even that fear had himsa.
('78', 367, 5, 23, 704974) Love and fear cannot co exist.
('78', 367, 5, 24, 705005) There was pride even in your fear.
('78', 367, 5, 25, 705040) But for all this I am to blame.
('78', 367, 5, 26, 705072) My ahimsa is imperfect and that is why my surroundings are not saturated with ahimsa.
('78', 367, 5, 27, 705158) Sevagram is to me a laboratory for ahimsa 1 .
('78', 367, 5, 28, 705204) If my experiment here were successful and I could find a solution for the little problems that confront me here, I am sure the same formula would provide me a solution for the bigger issues that today face us in the country.
('78', 367, 5, 29, 705429) That is why I am so reluctant to leave Sevagram.
('78', 367, 5, 30, 705478) It is my laboratory for satyagraha.
('78', 367, 5, 31, 705514) It is there that I expect to discover the key to Indias independence, not in Simla or New Delhi.
('78', 367, 5, 32, 705611) I sometimes feel like taking shelter in flight, not to seek cloistered peace, but in the stillness of utter isolation to know myself, to see where I stand, to catch more effectively the faint whispering of the still small voice within.
('78', 367, 5, 33, 705847) Then alone would my experiment in ahimsa be complete.
('78', 367, 6, 34, 705901) M. D. we who are near to you are utterly devoid of ahimsa, so I feel that in order to lighten your burden we should leave you.

('78', 368, 10, 14, 706971) 450. LETTER TO LORD LINLITHGOW
('78', 368, 11, 15, 707002) BIRLA HOUSE, ALBUQUERQUE ROAD NEW DELHI, June 30, 1940
('78', 368, 12, 16, 707057) DEAR LORD LINLITHGOW,
('78', 368, 13, 17, 707079) I think it will be mutually helpful if I reduce to writing the substance of the advice I tendered you yesterday as a personal friend and friend of the British.
('78', 368, 14, 18, 707239) I had made it clear at the outset that I had no representative capacity and that, after the last resolution of the Working Committee, I
('78', 368, 15, 19, 707375) 1 Later in the afternoon Gandhiji left to see the Viceroy.
('78', 368, 15, 20, 707434) 2 Gandhiji had met the Viceroy on June 29 at Simla at the latter's invitation.
('78', 369, 0, 1, 707513) THE COLLECTED WORKS OF MAHATMA GANDHI 370
('78', 369, 1, 2, 707555) could only speak as an individual in any case.
('78', 369, 2, 3, 707602) Your first proposal was to advise His Majestys Govern ment to let you announce that a status similar to that of the self governing dominions would be granted to India within one year of the termination of the war, subject to an agreed understanding about British commercial interests, defence, external relations, rights of minorities and the position of Princes regard being had to treaty obligations with them.
('78', 369, 2, 4, 708015) 2 Granted these reservations, a Constituent Assembly 3 may draw up the Constitution which, unless there were un acceptable provisions, will be adopted by His Majestys Government and placed by them before the Parliament for acceptance.
('78', 369, 2, 5, 708250) I said as to this that I personally could never accept it and that so far as I knew, the Congress also would never approve of it.
('78', 369, 2, 6, 708380) My strong advice was that it should not be put before the Secretary of State of before India.
('78', 369, 2, 7, 708474) Any such announcement would further embitter the relations between His Majestys Government and India.
('78', 369, 2, 8, 708576) I stressed the point that nothing short of immediate unequivocal declarations of independence,, free of all control by the British Government, would be accepted by the Congress.
('78', 369, 2, 9, 708754) (India free will no doubt have to negotiate a treaty, I hope, of partnership, with Great Britain; will have to make provision for protection of legitimate foreign interests, guarantee to the full the rights of the minorities and make adequate arrangements with the Princes consistently with due protection of the people living within their jurisdiction.
('78', 369, 2, 10, 709108) All this is inherent in the non violent policy of the Congress.
('78', 369, 2, 11, 709172) For its predominant sanction will be, not the force of arms behind it, but its sense of fairness and absolute justice.
('78', 369, 2, 12, 709291) In the absence of these two, independence will go as soon as obtained.
('78', 369, 2, 13, 709362) The thought thus expressed parenthetically was not put before you as part of my advice.
('78', 369, 2, 14, 709450) I see as I am writing this letter that it was incomplete
('78', 369, 3, 15, 709507) 1 The Congress Working Committee which met at Wardha on June 21 resolved that they were unable to extend to the region of national defence, Mahatma Gandhi's creed of non violence; vide Both Happy and Unhappy, 29 6 1940
('78', 369, 4, 16, 709726) 2 The Viceroy, writing on July 1, gave his own version of the talk.

('78', 373, 1, 3, 717317) I doubt if these fair weather customers could be good for anything.

('78', 378, 1, 2, 729492) 456. A VALID COMPLAINT
('78', 378, 2, 3, 729515) A correspondent sends me a forcible letter in which he argues that, though I expect great things from my countrymen, I write only for Harijan which is edited in English, and utterly neglect its Hindus tani and Gujarati editions.
('78', 378, 2, 4, 729744) Both Harijanbandhu (Gujarati) and Hari jan Sevak (Hindustani) have only translations of the writings in Harijan.
('78', 378, 2, 5, 729857) I must plead guilty to the charge.
('78', 378, 2, 6, 729892) My excuse for writing in English has been that I had to address English educated India who could understand neither Gujarati nor my faulty Hindustani, and also the ever growing number of Western readers.
('78', 378, 2, 7, 730096) I hope that the excuse will be deemed valid.
('78', 378, 2, 8, 730141) But it seems to me that the time has come for me to confine my writings, as far as possible, exclusively to Gujarati and occasionally to Hindustani.
('78', 378, 2, 9, 730290) The reason is simple and, I hope, convincing.
('78', 378, 2, 10, 730336) I have before me that most difficult task of reaching the message of the non violence of the strong to the masses.
('78', 378, 2, 11, 730451) They will not understand the fineness of the Working Committees decision.
('78', 378, 2, 12, 730525) Alre ady I have warnings that they will be confused.
('78', 378, 2, 13, 730578) They will believe that the Congress has given up non violence and wants them also to do likewise.
('78', 378, 2, 14, 730676) Then they would say, But the Mahatma still believes in it.

('78', 387, 1, 2, 751097) pupils and, with much greater skill than we have, perfected this match less weapon and met the German and Italian friends menace with it.

('78', 391, 7, 11, 757218) Q. But who will then live to enjoy freedom?
('78', 391, 8, 12, 757262) A. The survivors if there are any.

('78', 391, 8, 18, 757803) This is both illogical and invidious.
('78', 391, 8, 19, 757841) In satyagraha more than in armed warfare, it may be said that we find life by losing it.

('78', 397, 1, 2, 770240) 469. DRAFT RESOLUTION FOR THE WORKING COMMITTEE
('78', 397, 2, 3, 770288) [ July 3/7, 1940 ] The Working committee have noted that confusion prevails amongst Congressmen as to the interpretation of their last statement made in Wardha on 21 June.
('78', 397, 2, 4, 770460) They observe that several newspapers and others in common with many Congressmen have believed that the committee had given up non violence as an integral part of the Con gress policy.
('78', 397, 2, 5, 770644) Certain paragraphs of the statement do lend themselves to such interpretation in spite of the following emphatic and unequi vocal declaration therein of the Congress policy:
('78', 397, 3, 6, 770818) The war in Europe, resulting from a desire for imperialist domination
('78', 397, 4, 7, 770888) over other peoples and countries, and a suicidal race in armaments, has led to
('78', 397, 5, 8, 770967) human sorrow and misery on a scale hitherto unknown.
('78', 397, 5, 9, 771020) It has demonstrated
('78', 397, 6, 10, 771040) the inefficacy of organized violence, on however vast a scale, for the defence
('78', 397, 7, 11, 771119) of national freedom and the liberties of peoples.
('78', 397, 7, 12, 771169) It has shown beyond a doubt
('78', 397, 8, 13, 771197) that warfare cannot lead to peace and freedom and the choice before the world
('78', 397, 9, 14, 771275) is uttermost degradation and destruction through warfare or the way of peace
('78', 397, 10, 15, 771352) and non violence on a basis of freedom for all people.
('78', 397, 10, 16, 771407) The Committee
('78', 397, 11, 17, 771421) wish to make it clear that the methods and basic policy of non violence in the
('78', 397, 12, 18, 771500) national struggle for freedom continue with full force and are not affected in
('78', 397, 13, 19, 771579) the least by the inability to extend it to the region of national defence.
('78', 397, 13, 20, 771654) The Working Committee have come to the conclusion that they should exclusively rely upon Congress volunteers pledged to non violence and the Congress discipline to deal with internal disorders to the extent it is possible.
('78', 397, 13, 21, 771877) The volunteers will co operate in a non viol ent way with other similar organizations in their non violent activities.
('78', 397, 13, 22, 771996) The Working Committee advise all Congress Committees to form volunteer corps provided that they are sure that the candidates know the implications of non violence and the value of strict discipline.
('78', 397, 13, 23, 772195) The Congress non violence has been hitherto confined to the fight with the British government.
('78', 397, 13, 24, 772290) If success achieved so far has made non violence, to the extent mentioned, the settled policy of the Congress beyond assail, it must be admitted that success cannot be claimed for non violent effort in the case of communal riots.
('78', 397, 13, 25, 772520) The Working Committee are of opinion that the fault must be laid at the door of volunteer organizations.
('78', 397, 13, 26, 772625) The Working Committee hope that at
('78', 398, 0, 1, 772660) VOL.78 : 23 FEBRUARY, 1940 15 JULY, 1940 399
('78', 398, 1, 2, 772705) this the critical hour in the history of India volunteer organizations would be able effectively to deal with riots and the like in a non violent manner.
('78', 398, 1, 3, 772859) The Working Committee never had occasion to determine whe ther India can be defended non violently, nor is it even now called upon to do so, though the proved futility of violence to defend the nations of Europe is sufficient indication for the Working Committee for coming to a decision.
('78', 398, 1, 4, 773148) But till the hour for taking a final decision arrived, the Working Committee must keep an open mind.
('78', 398, 1, 5, 773249) But so far as the present is concerned, the Working Committee are firmly of opinion that in pursuance of their non violent policy Congressmen must not have anything to do with military training or activities calcu lated to made India military minded.
('78', 398, 1, 6, 773500) Therefore the Working Com mittee cannot but view with grave alarm the attempt made in an orga nized manner to prepare India for military defence.
('78', 398, 1, 7, 773646) In the opinion of the Working committee if India were free and independent without an army she would have no fear of external aggression.
('78', 398, 1, 8, 773784) The best defence that free India can put up if the people accepted the Congress policy would be to cultivate friendliness with the whole world.
('78', 398, 1, 9, 773928) To invest crores of rupees in armaments, fortresses and the like would be to invite foreign attack.
('78', 398, 1, 10, 774028) The Working committee believe that India is too poor to invest money in costly defence forces and modern equipment.
('78', 398, 1, 11, 774144) The Working Committee therefore warn the British Government agai nst the feverish preparations that they are making for the professed defence of India.
('78', 398, 1, 12, 774296) They are of opinion that they are intended merely to help Britain.
('78', 398, 1, 13, 774363) These preparations cannot help India in any real sense.
('78', 398, 1, 14, 774419) The Working Committee draw the attention of the British Gove rnment and people that although India is claimed by them to have provincial autonomy and every province has elected assemblies, and there is also a partially popularly elected Central Legislative Assembly, the huge expense is being incurred without any reference to these legislatures.
('78', 398, 1, 15, 774766) The Working committee believe that it is wrong and immoral to arm one man, however honest and distinguished, with unlimited powers to utilize the resources of a great country like India and to impress her people in any manner he chooses without any control or check on the part of her people.
('78', 398, 1, 16, 775059) It is a procedure in no way
('78', 399, 0, 1, 775087) 400 THE COLLECTED WORKS OF MAHATMA GANDHI
('78', 399, 1, 2, 775129) in keeping with the British Governments declarations, however un satisfactory from the congress standpoint, about the freedom of India.
('78', 399, 1, 3, 775265) The Working Committee wish to declare that the Congress claims to be wholly friendly to the British people.
('78', 399, 1, 4, 775373) Its non violent policy demands nothing but goodwill towards them.
('78', 399, 1, 5, 775439) But the friend liness and goodwill can have no play and no meaning, so long as India remains in helpless bondage and her resources in men and money are utilized without ascertaining the wishes of the representa tives of the people elected under a system established by Great Britain.
('78', 399, 1, 6, 775723) The Working Committee ask the British Government to revise their suicidal policy and take the popular assemblies into their confidence.
('78', 399, 1, 7, 775859) The Working Committee associate themselves with the appeal recently made by Gandhiji to every Briton 1 and hope that Great Britain will accept the policy of non violence whose potency has been proved beyond doubt even though its application was admittedly imperfect.
('78', 399, 1, 8, 776126) British Government may rely upon the fullest and friendliest co operation of the Congress in the direction of peace effort in the non violent way commended by Gandhiji.
('78', 399, 1, 9, 776295) In spite of the repeated and firm declaration of the Congress to the contrary, there seems to be a belief among the public, including even some Congressmen, that the Congress will be satisfied with Dominion Status.
('78', 399, 1, 10, 776510) The Working Committee warn all concerned that they will accept no status lower than complete independence and that declaration should be made now and given effect to, immediately so far as may be.
('78', 399, 1, 11, 776707) The legal formality may await a suitable future period.
('78', 399, 1, 12, 776763) Only India free and independent in action can decide upon the part she should play in the present war.
('78', 399, 1, 13, 776866) There is talk among some Congressmen that the Congress may countenance resumption of Ministerial offices.
('78', 399, 1, 14, 776972) The Working Commit tee wish to make it clear that there is no prospect of the Congress countenancing such a step without a satisfactory settlement with the Government and in no case of promoting a war effort in which they have no faith.
('78', 399, 1, 15, 777209) In view of the foregoing it is superfluous to say that the Working Committee cannot associate themselves with any Government proposals to expand the Central executive.
('78', 399, 2, 16, 777377) 1 Vide To Every Briton, 2 7 1940.

('78', 406, 1, 11, 792069) If I have the power to carry my experiment of ahimsa to success in an apparently new field, if my faith endures, and if I am right in thinking that the masses are fundamentally non violent, Rajaji and the Sardar will again be with me as before.
('78', 406, 1, 12, 792314) What are these apparently new fields for the operation of non violence?
('78', 406, 1, 13, 792386) Those who have followed the Working Committees resolu tions and writings in Harijan are now familiar with these.
('78', 406, 1, 14, 792499) Non violence in its operation against constituted authority is one field.
('78', 406, 1, 15, 792573) We have exercise this up to now with a fair amount of success, and I have always described it as the non violence of the weak.
('78', 406, 1, 16, 792700) This non violence may be said to have come to stay with Congressmen.
('78', 406, 1, 17, 792769) The other field is the exercise of ahimsa in internal disturbances Hindus Muslim riots and the like.
('78', 406, 1, 18, 792870) We have not been able to show visible success in the exercise of ahimsa in this field.
('78', 406, 1, 19, 792957) What then should the Congressmen do when internal chaos is so imminent?

('78', 406, 1, 23, 793331) He who meets death without striking a blow fulfils his duty cent per cent.
('78', 406, 1, 24, 793406) The result is in Gods hands.

('78', 406, 1, 26, 793511) It does not give one the joy of jail going.
('78', 406, 1, 27, 793555) One can have that joy and also cover thereby the ill will one harbours in his breast agai nst the Government.
('78', 406, 1, 28, 793665) One can also non co operate with the Govern ment.

('78', 409, 1, 2, 798034) 475. ABOUT THE WAZIRIS 1
('78', 409, 2, 3, 798059) Waziristan is one of the regions on the border of the Frontier Province.
('78', 409, 2, 4, 798132) Everybody knows that there are a number of tribes living on the north western frontier of India.
('78', 409, 2, 5, 798229) The popular notion about them is that they are born only to rob and plunder and harass the British Government.
('78', 409, 2, 6, 798340) Both these notions are far removed from reality.
('78', 409, 2, 7, 798389) These trans border 2 tribes are born and bred in extreme poverty.
('78', 409, 2, 8, 798455) Life among their native hills is a tale of chronic hardship and internecine strife.
('78', 409, 2, 9, 798539) India comes handy to them for satisfying their pecuniary need by raiding.
('78', 409, 2, 10, 798613) Besides, there are not lacking people who in order to serve their own political ends are ready to misguide them and set them on the wrong path.
('78', 409, 2, 11, 798757) Our knowledge about these tribes, therefore, is almost confined to their raiding activities.
('78', 409, 2, 12, 798850) Khan Saheb has told me that these tribesmen are very simple and innocent by nature.
('78', 409, 2, 13, 798934) Whenever I have visited the Frontier Province I have tried to go across and make acquaintance with these tribes.
('78', 409, 2, 14, 799047) My first effort in this direction was made at the time of the Irwin Gandhi Pact.
('78', 409, 2, 15, 799128) I had to give it up as Lord Irwin said his Government would feel embarrassed.
('78', 409, 2, 16, 799206) I next sought permission through correspondence but was equally unsuccessful.
('78', 409, 2, 17, 799284) I renewed the attempt at the time of my first Frontier tour and interviewed H. E. the Governor in that behalf, but he could not give or rather could not obtain for me the necessary permission.
('78', 409, 2, 18, 799477) Recently the Frontier Provincial Congress Committee tried to send a deputation among the Waziris not with any political motive but simply to do welfare work.
('78', 409, 2, 19, 799635) But the permission could not be obtained.
('78', 409, 2, 20, 799677) The Working Committee has now decided to send a deputation consisting of Shri Bhulabhai Desai the Janab Asaf Ali.
('78', 409, 2, 21, 799791) Let us hope the deputation will be given the necessary permission.
('78', 409, 2, 22, 799858) The object of the Working Committees resolution is not political.
('78', 409, 2, 23, 799924) Its purpose simply is to find out how help can be rendered to the border tribes and friendly relations cultivated with them.
('78', 409, 2, 24, 800049) It ill comports with our dignity to be in constant dread of them.
('78', 409, 2, 25, 800115) Ignorance is at the root of most of our fears.
('78', 409, 2, 26, 800162) If I suspected my neighbour, naturally I would be afraid of him.
('78', 409, 2, 27, 800227) But if I cast out my suspicion, the

('78', 410, 3, 9, 801183) 476. IS ISLAM INSPIRED?
('78', 410, 4, 10, 801207) A writer in a Muslim paper has suggested that, if I regard Islam as an inspired religion and Muhammad as the Prophet of God, I should declare my belief, so that Mussalmans doubts may be dispelled and Hindu Muslim unity may possibly be more easily achieved.
('78', 410, 4, 11, 801464) I read the suggestion about a month ago, but Idid not think it necessary to respond to it.
('78', 410, 4, 12, 801555) But as nowadays I read as many Muslim papers as I can, in order to acquaint myself with the Muslim mind, and as I find them so full of poison and conscious or unconscious untruths, I feel it necessary to redeclare my opinion about Islam, though I think it is well known.
('78', 410, 4, 13, 801826) I certainly regard Islam as one of the inspired religions, and therefore the Holy Koran as an inspired book and Muhammad as one of the Prophets.
('78', 410, 4, 14, 801971) But even so I regard Hinduism, Christianity, Zoroas trianism as inspired religions.
('78', 410, 4, 15, 802055) The names of many of them have been already forgotten, for the simple reason that those religions and those prophets related to the particular ages for which and peoples for whom they flourished.
('78', 410, 4, 16, 802251) Some principal religions are still extant, after a study of those religions to the extent it was possible for me, I have come to the conclusion that, if it is proper and necessary to discover an underlying unity among all religions, a master key is needed.
('78', 410, 4, 17, 802508) That master key is that of truth and non violence.
('78', 410, 4, 18, 802559) When I unlock the chest
('78', 410, 5, 19, 802583) 1 The Gujarati has Out of fear.
('78', 410, 5, 20, 802615) 2 The Gujarati original of this was published in Harijanbandhu, 14 7 1940. This translation is taken from Harijan.
('78', 411, 0, 1, 802730) 412 THE COLLECTED WORKS OF MAHATMA GANDHI
('78', 411, 1, 2, 802772) of a religion with this master key, I do not find it difficult to discover its likeness with other religions.
('78', 411, 1, 3, 802882) When you look at these religions as so many leaves of a tree they seem so different, but at the trunk they are one.
('78', 411, 1, 4, 802998) Unless and until we realize this fundamental unity, wars in the name of religion will not cease.
('78', 411, 1, 5, 803095) These are not confined to Hindus and Mussalmans alone.

('78', 412, 5, 37, 805971) 480. THE DELHI RESOLUTION
('78', 412, 6, 38, 805997) I have just seen the news that the Working Committees fateful resolution 1 has been released to the Press.
('78', 412, 6, 39, 806104) It was passed in my pre 
('78', 412, 7, 40, 806129) 1 The resolution, passed on July 7, called for acknowledgment by Great Britain of the complete independence of India and as an immediate step in giving
('78', 413, 0, 1, 806281) 414 THE COLLECTED WORKS OF MAHATMA GANDHI
('78', 413, 1, 2, 806323) sence, but I wanted to say nothing before it was actually released for publication.
('78', 413, 1, 3, 806407) It will be a profound mistake to suppose that the members passed the five solid days in wrangling.
('78', 413, 1, 4, 806506) They had to dis charge a heavy responsibility.
('78', 413, 1, 5, 806553) Though logically the resolution is no departure from the Ramgarh resolution 2, it is an undoubted departure from its spirit.
('78', 413, 1, 6, 806678) The letter often remains constant, the spirit changes.
('78', 413, 1, 7, 806733) Up to now for one reason or another the Congress policy was: No participation in the war except for the moral influence that the Con gress can exercise if the vital demand was satisfied of Britains own free will.
('78', 413, 1, 8, 806946) Such was not the position of all the members of the Wor king Committee.
('78', 413, 1, 9, 807018) Hence at the critical moment every member had to make up his or her mind independently of the rest.
('78', 413, 1, 10, 807118) The five days were days of tremendous heart searching.
('78', 413, 1, 11, 807173) I had produced a draft resolu tion 3 which almost all thought was the best, if they could bring to bear a living belief in non violence through and through, or if they could truthfully say that such was the belief of their constituencies.
('78', 413, 1, 12, 807412) Some had neither and some had individually the required faith.
('78', 413, 1, 13, 807475) Only Khan Saheb was clear so far as his own faith and that of his beloved Khudai Khidmatgars were concerned.
('78', 413, 1, 14, 807584) So he had decided even after the last Wardha resolution that he had no place in the Congress.
('78', 413, 1, 15, 807678) He had a special mission and a special duty to his followers.

('78', 415, 2, 4, 811926) 481. MYSORE LAWYERS
('78', 415, 3, 5, 811946) Several Mysore lawyers who had taken part in the Mysore satyagraha struggle have been disbarred by the Mysore Chief Court.
('78', 415, 3, 6, 812069) The last victim is Shri H. C. Dasappa, a most respected Mysorean and a practitioner of twenty years, standing.
('78', 415, 3, 7, 812180) Serious as the disbarring of a member belonging to a liberal profession must be, such cases have happened before now on insufficient or purely political grounds.
('78', 415, 3, 8, 812342) Such injustices have to be borne with resignation and fortitude.
('78', 415, 3, 9, 812407) But the order of the Chief Judge in Shri Dasappas case as reported in The Hindu has made for me most painful reading.
('78', 415, 3, 10, 812525) Shri Dasappa had the hardihood to defy a magistrates order not to address meetings in a part to Mysore, and had the equal hardihood under my instructions to advise satyagrahi prisoners to boycott the departmental inquiry by Justice Nagesvar Iyer.
('78', 415, 3, 11, 812772) For these grave offences Shri Dasappa has been disbarred for ever.
('78', 415, 3, 12, 812839) He well be reduced to penury, if the Judges could help it and, if their verdict has any potency beyond the paper on which it is written, Shri Dasappa becomes a man without a character, to be despised and shunned by society.
('78', 415, 3, 13, 813063) I happen to know Shri Dasappa personally.
('78', 415, 3, 14, 813105) I hold him to be a man of spotless character and unim peachable honesty.
('78', 415, 3, 15, 813178) He has been manfully striving to practise non violence to the best of his ability.
('78', 415, 3, 16, 813261) He has done what many patriots, lawyers or no lawyers, have done in British India.
('78', 415, 3, 17, 813344) And nowadays the Judges take no notice of their conduct, and the public have made of them heroes.
('78', 415, 3, 18, 813442) Advocate Bhulabhai has been Advocate General of the Bombay High Court.
('78', 415, 3, 19, 813513) He has defied laws.
('78', 415, 3, 20, 813533) So has Advocate Munshi and so has Chakravarti Rajagopalachari.
('78', 415, 3, 21, 813596) They have not been disbarred.
('78', 415, 3, 22, 813626) Two of them have been Ministers in their Provinces.
('78', 415, 3, 23, 813678) Public inquiries have been boycotted before now with impunity.
('78', 415, 3, 24, 813741) Neither the honour nor the character of those who have brought about such boycotts have been impugned.
('78', 415, 3, 25, 813844) In my opinion the Judges of the Mysore Court have forgotten themselves in delivering their 
('78', 416, 0, 1, 813936) VOL.78 : 23 FEBRUARY, 1940 15 JULY, 1940 417
('78', 416, 1, 2, 813981) judgement.
('78', 416, 1, 3, 813992) Shri Dasappa has not suffered.
('78', 416, 1, 4, 814023) He will rise in the estimation of the people of mysore.
('78', 416, 1, 5, 814079) But I make bold to say the Mysore Judges have suffered by allowing themselves to be carried away by prejudice.
('78', 416, 1, 6, 814190) Such travesty of justice has happened before now.
('78', 416, 1, 7, 814240) A Durban Magistrate who was carried away by some stupid prejudice had con demned an innocent man.
('78', 416, 1, 8, 814338) His judgement was reversed and the Sup reme Court condemned it in such scathing terms that the Magistrate had to be removed.
('78', 416, 1, 9, 814463) The Judges of the martial law days in the Punjab were not removed, but many were thoroughly disgraced because they had pronounced judgements which could not be supported by evi dence before them.
('78', 416, 1, 10, 814659) This Mysore judgement is worse than the Punjab judgements.
('78', 416, 1, 11, 814718) Then there was panic.
('78', 416, 1, 12, 814740) Murders had been com mitted by the mob, and eminent men were tried not by ordinary courts but by martial law tribunals.
('78', 416, 1, 13, 814860) In Mysore nothing of the kind has happened.
('78', 416, 1, 14, 814904) The Chief Judges order is a cool and calculated attack on the honour of a man who could not defend himself against reckless statements from the Bench.
('78', 416, 1, 15, 815055) Judges sometimes forget, as these Mysor gentlemen have done, that there is the bar of public opinion which is no respecter of persons.
('78', 416, 1, 16, 815190) My condolence and pity go out to the Judges who have deli vered a judgement which, let me hope, in their cooler moments they will regret.
('78', 416, 1, 17, 815328) For Shri Dasappa and his colleagues who have been dis barred I have nothing but congratulations.
('78', 416, 1, 18, 815425) I would ask them to turn the punishment into a blessing.
('78', 416, 1, 19, 815482) It is well that they cannot appear before Judges who can be so grossly prejudiced as the Mysore Judges have proved themselves to be.
('78', 416, 1, 20, 815615) Let these lawyers be proud of their poverty which will be probably their lot now.
('78', 416, 1, 21, 815697) Let them remember Thoreaus saying that possession of riches is a crime and poverty a virtue under an unjust administration.
('78', 416, 1, 22, 815821) This is an eternal maxim for satyagrahis.
('78', 416, 1, 23, 815863) The disbarred lawyers have a rare opportunity of so remodelling their lives that they can always be above want.
('78', 416, 1, 24, 815975) Let them remember that practice of law ought not to mean more taking daily than, say, a village carpenters wage.
('78', 416, 1, 25, 816088) Let them make redoubled efforts to produce such a state of affairs in Mysore that the travesty of the nature I have described may become impossible.
('78', 416, 1, 26, 816237) It is no pleasure to me to have to write as strongly as I have done.
('78', 416, 1, 27, 816306) But I could do no less if I was to serve Truth.
('78', 416, 1, 28, 816354) SEVAGRAM, July 9, 1940 Harijan, 13 7 1940
